text: Take care of yourself. The price of kolto tanks has jumped through the roof.
The Selkath put a bunch of export restrictions in place for kolto. It's hurting everybody.
I hear that Manaan is no longer shipping kolto. The Selkath must be trying to drive prices up.
If you have kolto tanks, use them sparingly. I can't find them cheap anywhere.
I'm sure I saw some holo-footage of you on the Manaan swoop track, what you doing here?
Did you win a regional swoop championship on Manaan or something? I recognize your face.
I heard about your Manaan win. I'm surprised the Tatooine track was able to attract a racer of your ability.
Motta swears he can get professional racers to come to Tatooine. If the Manaan Sector Champion is here, I guess he was right.
I hear Czerka is closing their Kashyyyk operation. Nobody seems to know why.
Czerka is claiming that their operation on Kashyyyk has become to costly to maintain. Sounds like a cover-up to me.
No more supplies have been ordered for the Czerka outposts on Kashyyyk. Doesn't sound like "economic restructuring" to me.
A private trader told me about the bloodshed on Kashyyyk. Seems like Czerka wants to forget it was ever there.
A trader I know says there was some trouble on Korriban. I didn't want to hear about it. That's where the Sith Academy is.
If you're doing any private shipping, stay away from Korriban. Sounds like the Sith can't even get along with themselves.
Word is Korriban is a dangerous place to visit right now. Something about the Sith at the Academy.
I heard the Sith were fighting amongst themselves on Korriban. Course, they're always fighting someone.
I still haven't heard a final figure of how many people died on Taris.
You never know what the Sith will do. Look at Taris; was there any reason for what happened there?
The Republic is too complacent. If they let Taris fall, do you think they care what happens out here?
With Taris gone, I wonder who the Sith will turn on next.
Move along, spacer.
You want to arrange a purchase, go talk to the director in his office.
This assignment is the worst in the galaxy.
Czerka Corporation should burn down some trees. Make room for some swoop races.
Keep walking. This ain't no holiday port of call.
If you've business with Czerka Corporation, take it to the director's office.
Take a walk, spacer. You don't look like a big buyer to me.
Watch yourself. We don't need anyone agitating the locals.
I was told that you're a friend of Jolee Bindo... and that Jolee has returned to the sector. Please, I must speak to him. It's very urgent!
Who are you?
My name is Elora. My husband Sunry and Jolee are old friends. Now Sunry needs Jolee's help.
I shall tell Jolee immediately.
Please, I beg you to bring Jolee to speak to me about my husband. Sunry's life depends on it!
Maybe I can help your husband.
Someone is out to destroy my husband. I... I don't know who I can trust. I don't know you. But Jolee - he was always a true friend to Sunry.
Why do you need to speak to Jolee?
I don't have time for this.
Jolee! It *is* you! I... need your help.
Elora? Of all the people... How did you even know I'd left Kashyyyk?
I didn't. Nobody knew where you were, not even Sunry! But I heard the Selkath mention you and your friends. The Force has brought you to help us!
Why? Whatever could be the matter, my dear?
It's horrible, Jolee! Sunry has been arrested! The Sith have accused him of murder!
Murder? But how...
It's all a mistake, Jolee! Sunry isn't a murderer - someone is trying to frame him.
Calm down, Elora. Where's Sunry now?
Sunry's being held at the Selkath courts. They won't let anyone in to see him. Please, go to the courts, talk to the Judges. Maybe the Selkath will listen to you.
Don't worry, Elora. We'll get to the bottom of this and help Sunry... somehow.
I hear you have been appointed as Arbiter in Sunry's trial. My husband is innocent - please don't let him go to jail for a crime he didn't commit!
Can you tell me anything about Sunry?
Sunry is... he's a cripple. There's no way he could have overpowered this Sith woman like they claim.
That's true... I'd forgotten about that. Let's not forget that he would have had to have been considerably older than the Sith woman.
Are you saying someone your age couldn't overpower a woman?
Hmph. I'm a Jedi... and one who was living alone in the Shadowlands until recently. That keeps you in shape, damn it! We're talking about Sunry, here.
And there's no way he would do something so dishonorable as hit her from behind. Sunry's a decorated war hero! He's a hero of the Republic!
Don't worry, Elora. I'll save him.
Find the real evidence, that's all I ask. The real evidence will prove Sunry didn't do this.
Your husband might not be so innocent, Elora.
This is all a plot to discredit the Republic! Sunry is a victim of a Sith frame up!
It's possible. I haven't seen Sunry since I crashed on Kashyyyk... a man can change a lot in that time. The man I knew could never have done this crime, however.
[Persuade] Was Sunry having an affair?
[Success] Of... of course not! He... he... *sob*
Yes... *sob* ...yes, he was having an affair. He was seeing that... that Sith woman.
After all these years we've been together he just... just dropped me like that. Not publicly, oh no, but inside that's what it feels like.
He started seeing Elassa last year. I... I had my suspicions for a while, but he was careless. Pretty soon everyone knew.

But... but... even though I'm sure that harlot was only using him, I know he couldn't have killed her. He came and confessed to the affair to me. He said he was going there to break it off - to end it.
Maybe the Sith woman attacked him and he had to defend himself?
But even though he cheated on me, inside he's still the man I loved... love... He is too kind and gentle to have killed her in cold blood.
He is a soldier, though.
That was a long time ago, in a war far, far away. He's changed now... settled down. Just please, prove his innocence.
He has killed many Sith before.
[Failure] What?? Don't insult us both! Sunry is... Sunry is a just and honorable man. How dare you accuse him... us, of such a thing!
Now, now, Elora. We're not here to pass judgment, my dear. We do need to know everything if we're to help, yes?
Madam. I would remind you that I am a Jedi. Now, then... was he having an affair?
Find proof to set him free instead of bringing these baseless accusations against us.
Tell me about Sunry and Elassa.
I have this recording showing Sunry killing Elassa.
Lies! It... it must be! I knew the Sith would never let a Republic hero get away... You must find Sunry innocent!
A horrible fate for poor Hendar... I warned him not to leave the safety of the village.
But I couldn't open the gate... not while the rakghouls were so close. I had to protect the village.
But enough of this grim talk... we must focus on the positive if we are to survive down here. How can I help you, up-worlder?
Open the gate for me.
I will open the gate for you, up-worlder, but you've got to be quick. In a few seconds I must close and lock it again for the safety of the village.
Who are you?
I am Trewin, from the Outcast village. It's my job to guard the gates and see they are locked to protect us from the rakghouls.
I want to ask you some questions.
Heh. I just guard the gates. Gendar is the leader of the village, up-worlder. You should speak to him if you have any questions.
Goodbye.
Goodbye, up-worlder.
Thank you for saving Hendar. You are braver than I, up-worlder. Maybe we Outcasts have lived too long in selfish fear.
Perhaps we can learn a lesson from your brave actions. Hmph. But enough of my ramblings... is there something you need, up-worlder?
You're not from the village. In fact, you look like you're from the up-world!
I don't know why you'd come down here to our village, but I guess I can let you in. There don't seem to be any rakghouls nearby.
Hurry, up-worlder. I can only leave the gate open for a few seconds. I can't risk letting the rakghouls in!
I can't open the gate... not while the rakghouls are so near.
Open the gate... I will kill the rakghouls.
You would risk your life for a stranger? You are brave... or foolish.
You're right, it's too dangerous. Leave the gate closed.
*Sigh* A horrible fate for poor Hendar. I warned him not to leave the safety of the village.
Keep the gate closed. I'm not risking my life here.
The gate is open. If you're going through you have to hurry, up-worlder, before I have to close it again.
Yes, up-worlder? Is there something you need?
So do we have a deal?
That's an awful lot of money... is there something you're not telling me?
Don't be so suspicious. The Republic is generous, we pay our mercenaries well.
Makes sense, I guess. Alright, I'm in. When do I start?
Just show up at the Republic Embassy tomorrow and speak to our Representative there. I'm sure he'll have some task he wants you to start on right away.
Do you mind? I'm in the middle of a Republic recruiting drive right now. I need to hire these mercenaries before they sign up with the Sith.
Why are you hiring mercenaries?
In case you hadn't noticed, there's a war on. If we don't hire these mercs, the Sith will. Now excuse me, I have to continue my recruitments.
Maybe you could hire me?
I don't know if you've got what we're looking for... Jedi aren't generally suited to mercenary work. If you want, talk to Roland Wann at the Republic Embassy and see if he can find anything for you.
It's north of here, then east past the first courtyard. It's just off the north end of the second courtyard. You can't miss it.
Now if you'll excuse me, I have to continue my recruitments.
I'll be going now.
Good. The longer I spend talking to you, the less time I have to talk to the mercs.
The second tomb on the left within the valley is the tomb of Naga Sadow. It is off-limits to all students, unless they are in the company of Master Uthar.
Beware of the tuk'ata. They are a pack beast that have their nests in one of the tombs. We fight them off as best we can.
There is an old Sith hermit that has been haunting this area, we understand. Watch out for him.
A dangerous assassin droid has barricaded itself within the tomb of Marka Ragnos, the first one on the left. Be wary.
Watch out for the tuk'ata. They will charge you on sight. Run back to the excavation area and we can protect you.
Any artifacts found should be brought to the attention of Master Uthar immediately.
I am not here to get you out of trouble if you do something stupid, student. Enter the tombs at your own risk.
I will stay here in this chamber and use my Battle Meditation to aid the Republic fleet. I am their only hope of destroying the Star Forge and ending the Sith menace.
You must go and face Malak, but you have to hurry. Once I turn the battle in the Republic's favor we won't have much time to escape the Star Forge before it is destroyed.
Good luck, my love... and may the Force be with you.
Good luck... and may the Force be with you.
The Star Forge is under assault from the entire Republic fleet! If I don't use my Battle Meditation to turn the tide, Admiral Dodonna's capital ships will destroy the Star Forge.
I have to stay here in the command center so that I can best use my Battle Meditation against our enemy. If I don't the Star Forge will be lost!
You must go to face Malak without me. Find him, kill him and reclaim the title of Dark Lord of the Sith!
Revan - I knew you'd come for me.
I'm <FullName> now, Bastila. Revan is no more.
Sadly, I know this is true. Had you reclaimed the power of your previous identity I would be your apprentice, not Malak's. But you rejected the dark side.
Now you must pay the price. Here on the Star Forge the power of the dark side is at its strongest. This time you will not defeat me!
I'll never give up on you, Bastila. I know you can still be saved.
You are wasting your time. I have seen the Jedi for what they are: weak and afraid. The Sith are the true Masters of the Force. You have forgotten that lesson, Revan.
You can't escape, Bastila! Wherever you run I'll hunt you down!
I have no doubt of that. I was no match for you in the Temple, but when I fled I knew you would follow me here.
I see now why Malak followed you. Even though you are only a shell of your former self, you are still a formidable opponent.
I can't even imagine the power you must have wielded when you were the Dark Lord. You were a fool to give it all up and follow the light side.
I am as strong in the light as I ever was following the dark side.
The dark side has made me stronger than I ever was before! I have a greater command of the Force than all but the most powerful Jedi Masters.
As Malak teaches me the greatest secrets of the Sith, I will unlock more of my potential. Eventually there will be no limit to what I can accomplish with the Force!
Malak will never let you become that powerful. He will kill you first.
Have you forgotten the ways of the Sith already, Revan? Eventually I will challenge my Master. If I am worthy he will die by my hand and I will become the new Sith Master.
Then I will take on my own apprentice and the cycle will begin again. This is the way of the Sith, it is how we assure our leaders are always the strongest and most worthy!
You're dooming yourself to an endless cycle of death and betrayal.
No, Revan, it is you who are doomed!
I won't let that happen! I'll kill you first!
No, Revan. You are the one who will die here!
You will accomplish death and destruction with the dark side, nothing else.
Jedi propaganda. The dark side is only a tool, and Malak will train me in its use. Eventually I will surpass my Master and challenge him. If I am worthy he will die by my hand.
You've been consumed by the dark side, Bastila. Can't you see it's destroying you?
I'm still strong enough to defeat you, Bastila!
Then it's time for you to prove it!
You are growing weary, I can sense it! Your strength falters, the light side is failing you while the power of the Star Forge re-energizes me! Soon this will all be over!
I have not faltered, Bastila. You have been misled by the dark side.
The dark side will always triumph over the light! Malak has assured me of victory! You can't defeat me here on the Star Forge! YOU CAN'T!
Then strike me down, Bastila. I won't defend myself.
What type of trick is this?
Remember what you once were, Bastila. A Jedi would never strike down a defenseless opponent.
I am a Sith apprentice now. You place too much faith in what I used to be... and for that you shall pay!
You are not evil, Bastila. You will not strike down a defenseless opponent.
We meant something to each other, once. I don't believe you will strike me down.
Your emotions get the better of you, Bastila. Remember the Jedi code.
You dare spew those Jedi lies in my face? You will die screaming, Revan!
You are the one growing weak, Bastila. I hear the desperation in your voice!
No, this is not possible! You have rejected the dark side, you are a weak and pathetic servant of the light! How can you still stand against me? Why can't I defeat you?
Now you see the dark side is not stronger than the light.
Yes, I see you speak the truth. I am no match for you. Please, for the sake of what we once shared, do not make me suffer. End my life quickly. There is no other way.
I could never kill you, Bastila.
What other choice do you have? I have fallen to the dark side, I am the apprentice to the Dark Lord himself. You cannot let me live.
You can reject the dark side, Bastila. Return to the light.
No... I'm not strong enough. There is too much anger inside me now. Too much hatred and fear. I can no longer find peace in the Force.
[Persuade] Use our bond, then. Take your strength from me.
[Success] You... always had more strength than I did. I told you that. I felt so... helpless before your destiny.
You were Revan and I couldn't tell you... it was agonizing! Even worse when I began to... feel closer to you. I despised myself for it.
And even now I... feel your strength. It... does help me. Thank you, I think I can face the end, now. If you are the one to end it for me.
[Persuade] I love you, Bastila. I can't abandon you, ever.
[Success] You... love me? Heh. I... there was a time I yearned for and yet dreaded to hear those words. I loved you, too, but I could never... face who you were.
Malak knew how I felt. Any part of the light that was within me would be extinguished when I killed you.
But what good is love? It cannot save me from the sea of blackness I am drowning in. I have betrayed everything I ever believed in! How can I atone for that?
Help us defeat the Sith, Bastila. This will atone for what you have done.
Yes, I... could join you in your battle against the Dark Lord. That alone would not make up for all I have done, yet... it would be a step in the right direction.
But how would you be able to trust me? How do you know I wouldn't turn on you when you faced Darth Malak? How do you know the dark side wouldn't make me betray you again?
I trust you enough to leave myself open to your attack, Bastila.
You play a dangerous game. Are you certain you wish to take this risk? I could end your life and gain Malak's favor with a single stroke of my lightsaber.
You won't, Bastila. Because I love you and I believe in you.
You are brave... and some would say foolish. But you are also right. The dark side has not wholly consumed me. I cannot raise my blade against you.
You will go on to defeat Malak, of this I have little doubt. You will have gone from being the Sith Lord, himself, to the savior of our galaxy.
And... and you said you loved me. This may not be the best time to say it, but...
I love you, too. With all my heart.
You aren't afraid to love anymore?
After this? No, nothing could make me feel safer than to be loved by you.
You should go. Malak awaits. This isn't over, yet... for any of us.
I should stay here, though. If we face Malak I am afraid his dark presence will overwhelm me. It would not be wise to expose myself to such temptation.
Bastila, I want you at my side when I face the Dark Lord.
I'm sorry, but the risk is too great. I am not wholly free of the dark side's shadow. Not yet. But you are more than a match for the Dark Lord. I understand that now.
You could use your Battle Meditation to aid the Republic fleet.
Yes, that would be for the best. You don't need me to defeat Malak, anyway. Now I understand that a true Jedi is a match for any Sith. Even the Dark Lord himself.
I... I must know something, first, before that happens. I must ask you something.
Will there be a place for me in your future? Do you... do you love me?
I do love you, Bastila.
I love you, Bastila, but after everything that's happened...
I see. Thank you for your honesty. It's probably for the best that it goes no further. You saved me and I will always be grateful.
No. I'm sorry, Bastila, but I don't love you.
You are brave... and foolish. The dark side has wholly consumed me, and you will suffer for failing to see that!
You won't, Bastila. I know you still serve the light side.
You're right. I suppose I can't trust you, after all.
A wise decision. You cannot trust me, and you cannot bring yourself to execute me. I see now there is only one way this can end. The time for words is done! Defend yourself!
You're right. Don't worry, you won't feel a thing.
Do it. Quickly...
[Failure] There is nothing in my heart but the blackness of the dark side! I am sick of your preaching, Revan!
I ask you for an honorable death, but you are too weak to even grant me that! No more words! This must end with blood!
[Persuade] Look into your heart, Bastila, and you will find the light.
[Success] I... I know a flicker of the light still burns within me. Malak felt it too. He knew it could only be extinguished if I killed you.
But what good is a single flicker of light against the sea of darkness I am drowning in? I can never atone for my betrayal.
I was redeemed, Bastila. You can be, too.
You were a special case. The Council had no other choice. They needed you alive so they could discover the location of the Star Forge. It was an act of desperation.
It was my responsibility to watch over you, to make sure you did not slip back into your evil ways. I was supposed to protect you from the dark side.
You did protect me, Bastila.
But at what cost? In protecting you, I fell to the dark side myself. Is that the price of a Jedi's redemption? Must another of the Order fall to save me?
I cannot allow that to happen. Please, this is too painful. Strike me down. End this now, quickly. There is no other way.
You can't protect someone from the dark side. Each individual must choose their own path.
I... I suppose you are right. Yet the path I have chosen is that of the dark side. I don't see any way I could atone for what I have done. I deserve to die.
You did more than protect me, Bastila.
It's true I possess... feelings for you. But was it only an illusion brought about by our bond? And what was the cost?
Please... this is too painful. End it now, quickly. There is no other way.
I was the Dark Lord, Bastila, and the Jedi Council let me live.
[Failure!] No! That bond is what took me down this path to begin with! It poisoned me... I hated myself for loving you and now I have betrayed everything!
[Persuade] Turn to the Jedi code, Bastila. It can help you.
[Success] I doubt mere words can help me now, but to appease you I will recite them:
There is no emotion: there is peace. There is no ignorance: there is knowledge. There is no passion: there is serenity. There is no chaos: there is harmony...
Strange, but even now I find comfort in these words. I... suppose old habits die hard.
There is no death: there is the Force. Thank you, Revan. I am ready to face my fate now.
[Failure] The Jedi code is nothing but words, the babblings of senile old Masters! The code cannot help me now!
There's no need for me to kill you, Bastila.
I am stronger than you could ever be, Bastila!
You can't win, Bastila. Now you must die!
You there! Up-worlder! Anyone using this elevator has to pay the toll!
Yeah, this is our elevator! If you use it, you've got to give us something!
I don't believe this planet! Even the beggars are trying to shake us down.
Five credits! That's what it costs to use our elevator! Five credits!
Who are you? What are you doing here in the Undercity?
We are the Outcasts, banished and reviled by those who dwell above!
Here in the filth and darkness we claw out a wretched existence, scavenging and begging just to survive long enough to see another wretched day.
This is our village. We live here in the undercity. You have to pay us five credits for using our elevator.
You poor wretches. Here's 20 credits to buy some food and clothing.
Credits, my brother! We have credits! Now we can buy food and medicine!
Hush, or the others will hear us! They'll want our credits! We have to hide them!
Go on, you two! Get out of here! I'm sorry about that... those two beggars give everyone in the village a bad name! We aren't all like that, you know. Most of us are good people.
I'm sure you are, miss. It's just too bad your little welcoming committee is there to give people a bad first impression.
My name's <FullName>. Who are you?
My name is Shaleena... you're from the up-world, aren't you? I've... I've never seen it. I was born here in the Undercity. Is it as nice as they say up there?
The surface is a beautiful place.
I've never been to the surface, but sometimes I think I can see it in my dreams. The sun, the sky, the stars... it all sounds so... so... so wonderful.
Gendar, the leader of our village, tells me I should spend more time trying to improve things down here and less time dreaming about something I can never have. Maybe he's right.
You probably think I'm a fool, having dreams of a place I've never even seen. But when I was little, Rukil used to tell me stories of what it was like up there.
Rukil? Who's that?
Rukil's the oldest man in the village. The kids call him Rukil Wrinkle-Skin, but he's a kind man. He used to tell me the greatest stories when I was a little girl.
I still like to listen to his tales about the Promised Land, even though I know they're just legends. But it helps to make the Undercity seem less... less dark, somehow.
The Promised Land? What's that?
It's... it's just a story to make little children smile. Rukil believes in it, though. Sometimes I can almost believe it myself, but then I look around and I see the ugly truth.
*sigh* I guess we have to make the best of what we have though. If you really want to learn more about the promised land you should speak to Rukil.
Where can I find Rukil?
He's wandering around somewhere on the south side of the village. He doesn't move too far... it's hard on his bones. He's over 100 years old!
The children laugh at him and people think he's crazy because of his stories about the Promised Land, but he's really just a kind old man.
I want to ask you some questions.
You'd probably get more information from Gendar, the village leader. Or maybe Rukil. But I'll tell you whatever I can.
Where can I find Gendar?
He'll be somewhere in the village. I couldn't say where for sure. He's always busy, doing whatever he can to make the lives of the other villagers easier.
I'll be going now.
Oh... okay. Well, if you ever need anything, or if you just feel like talking, come back and see me. I hardly ever get a chance to speak to someone from the up-world.
Do you know anything about the escape pods that crashed into the Undercity?
I don't know anything about that, but maybe Gendar could help you. Sorry... is there anything else you need?
Have any other up-worlders come through here recently?
There were quite a few people from the surface marching through the village, but none of them bothered to talk to me. Gendar might know more about them.
Tell me about this village.
Well, I was born here for starters. My parents were Outcasts, banished to the Undercity for some crime or other... they never really liked to talk about it.
Everyone here is an Outcast... or the descendant of one. It's tough down here, but we survive. I guess it's easier for me, since I've never known anything different.
Some of the people have given up all hope; they've become bitter and depressed. But most of us are good people... despite what our ancestors may have done.
Gendar could probably tell you more. Or maybe Rukil. You could talk to them if you want.
I don't have time for this.
Of course... I'm sorry. You're probably here for something important, right? You probably want to speak to Gendar. He's the leader of our village.
But if you... if you have time later, maybe you could come back and speak to me again. I don't get much chance to talk with people from the surface.
It's nothing special.
Not to you, I suppose. But you're probably used to its beauty by now.
It's better than this festering slime pit.
I... I suppose our world doesn't look like much to you. It's dark and cold and lonely down here - but this is the only world I've ever known.
What do you want?
Okay, here's five credits.
I don't have any credits on me.
We are not fools... we know all who come from the up-world are rich! Please, is 5 credits so much to ask?
Please, have pity on us. We have nothing. All we ask is a few credits to make our lives easier.
Get out of here you filthy beggars, or I'll use my blaster to end your suffering permanently!
Run, my brother! Flee this one's wrath!
Forget it! You get nothing from me!
Have you no heart? Have you no compassion?
Come, my brother - let us go. We will get nothing from this selfish up-worlder!
This is a public elevator! I'm not paying any toll!
So... is there news? Is the passageway clear?
No. But thanks for letting your guard down.
You... you tricked us! You just wanted to get closer!! Quick, get them!!
Not yet, but I'm working on it.
Alright. We'll keep waiting, then. Watch out for that beast... it's dangerous.
It's clear. You're free to go.
It... it's clear? We can go?
Thank you. This... I wasn't expecting help from anyone in the academy. I guess we aren't the only ones who don't... agree with everything.
Maybe... maybe the Jedi will accept us. I've seen how evil the dark side is. Maybe I could try.
At any rate, thank you again. You've saved our lives.
Hold it right there, whoever you are! We... we're not going back to the academy! We'll kill you rather than go back!
Go back? What are you talking about?
You mean you aren't here to kill us or bring us back? I find that hard to believe. The only way into these caves is through the academy. You must be a Sith.
So what is it, then? If you're not here to kill us or bring us back, why are you here? Speak up!
Okay, you got me. I'm here to kill you after all.
Open fire! Get them! Get them!!
Slow down and tell me what you're doing here.
So you don't know about us? I don't know if I'm ready to believe that or not, but I'll play along for the moment.
My name is Thalia May. The others here and myself refused to murder a bunch of people on a whim from Master Uthar... so here we are.
We thought that becoming a Sith was what we always wanted, but that wasn't true. Now all we want is to get out of here. Fair enough?
Maybe I can help you.
Help us? Why should I believe that this isn't some kind of trick?
[Persuade] Give me a chance and I'll prove it to you.
[Success] You want to help us? Alright... I can think of a way. We're stuck in these caves, obviously, or we would have been long gone.
There's a passage to the surface through the caves, but we're blocked by some kind of large creature. We can't defeat it.
If you could kill it and clear up the passageway for us, we could escape. That would be help enough. Can you do that?
I can try.
I'll believe that when I see it... but if you could, we would be... grateful.
Forget it. Get yourselves out.
I figured as much. Get out of here, then. Go on! We have enough to worry about with the shyrack!
The passage is already clear.
[Failure] No! I know what Sith like you want from us! You're not bringing our heads to Master Uthar so he can pat you on the back!
They're here to kill us! Get them!! Get them!!
Fine. You've worn out my patience. Time to die.
Fair enough. I'll leave you be.
Then get out of here! Now! Or we'll open fire!!
Sorry. Time for you to die.
You're... the renegade students? The ones who ran away?
So you have heard about us. Yes, we ran away before Master Uthar could execute us. Is that so hard to believe?
I'm not here to bring you back.
I guess we'll do this the hard way, then.
Alright, I'll leave you be.
You came back again? Why?! I told you we're not going back to the academy, so go away!!
Czerka will never come back here, we will make certain!
You are the only outsider that will survive us! We swear it!
Kashyyyk will be ours once more!
Let no one escape! They must learn the price we place on dishonor!
Let their blood feed out forests! That will be their payment!
These Czerka animals will die by sword and bowcaster!
The Shadowlands are too good for them! We'll kill them all!
At last, we will push them off our beloved Kashyyyk!
The outsiders will pay for how they dishonored us!
Death to all slavers! Kashyyyk will be free!
Your precious Republic's days are numbered! It won't be long until Malak turns his armada loose on Coruscant itself!
Save your empty threats, Sith scum! Malak isn't stupid enough to attack the Core worlds - not with the entire Republic fleet waiting for him!
You're a fool! When the Sith descend on Coruscant, our numbers will block out the sun itself! The galactic senators will collapse trembling in fear, and beg for mercy at Malak's feet!
You underestimate the Republic's resolve! We'll die before we surrender Coruscant!
That can be arranged. Remember what happened to Taris - Malak could do the same to the Core worlds!
He wouldn't dare!
Now it is you who underestimate our resolve.
What's this? Another Republic lackey wandering the streets? Don't worry - the Sith will destroy you along with all the rest who don't bow down before Malak!
I have no wish to trade childish taunts and empty words with you.
I have nothing more to say to you. I have important Sith business to tend to.
You'll want to change your tone. You wouldn't be the first Sith I've killed.
Save your empty threats. If you're stupid enough to attack me the Selkath authorities will lock you away for a long, long time.
Do you know who I am, worm?
Let me guess... Dark Lord of the Sith?
Er... well... yeah.
HAHAHAHAHAHAHA! Revan, right?
Why you...
HAHAHAHA! You moron! Revan's dead! And if you try to back up your stupid words with stupid deeds the Selkath will be all over you like a Mon Calamari during mating season.
Now some of us have serious work to do. *chuckle* Run along, fool.
I'll kill you!
Don't laugh!
Yes... Yes I am.
And don't you forget it!
Excuse me, sentient. I do not think it wise to speak to you.
I must go to the office of the Czerka company. That is where business is transacted.
This planet is controlled by the Sith. They are the supreme law here, and I suggest you be wary of them.
I have only recently come to this planet, myself. My apologies if I cannot help you.
Many sentients come to this planet to attempt to enter the Sith academy. I understand most die in the process. How unfortunate.
There is a building called the cantina which is a place of recreation.
Taris has been destroyed. This portends ill for the future, sentient.
If you are wise, you will avoid the Sith on this planet, sentient. They do as they wish and many are killed without regret.
I must be on my way, sentient. My ship leaves very soon.
Czerka is making us put a deposit on standard issue kolto packs. I know the cost has gone up, but come on.
This planet is the worst assignment to have with a kolto shortage coming up.
Bring those Selkath here see if they think we need kolto. They'd start shipping it out quick, I bet.
If we don't get another shipment of kolto, we'll have to start using local herbs for healing. Then we'll hurt *and* stink.
Are you... no, there's no way a swoop champion is on Kashyyyk. No way.
Is your ship equipped to get the major planetary broadcasts? I heard the Manaan races were pretty good.
I heard some rookie took the big prize at the Manaan swoop races. I guess anyone can win now that Taris is gone.
You look a lot like the winner of the Manaan races. I bet that opens door for you.
I don't mind being on a backwater planet when I hear about the trouble places like Korriban get.
I heard something about trouble with Sith on Korriban, but as long as no cities are being destroyed, they can do what they like.
Have you been by Korriban recently? The Sith there aren't planning on taking their trouble off-world, are they?
We get the occasional private trader from Korriban through here, but not recently. I wonder what's up.
Have you heard where the Sith might be headed next? I don't even know why they targetted Taris.
All those people on Taris dead. First I heard the whole planet was gone, but even just the city is sad.
I guess I should be grateful I'm on Kashyyyk. I could have been posted to Taris.
It took ten days for news of Taris to reach me. They don't tell us anything.
Who are you? You can't come in here! Sound the alarm, Gadon!
Relax, Kaeira - this is an ally, not an enemy. He's promised to help get our prototype accelerator back from the Vulkars.
You're too trusting, Gadon. These must be the assassins Brejik sent! How else did they get in here?
[Persuade] The guards recognized me and let me in.
[Failure] Liar! The guards would have announced you! Gadon - we've been betrayed again!
We're under attack! Guards! Guards!
Sorry, but Brejik made me an offer I couldn't refuse.
Time for you to die, old man!
Relax, Kaeira - this is an ally, not an enemy. She's promised to help get our prototype accelerator back from the Vulkars.

Having fun on the dunes, Tanis? I made sure you would. Here's the deal: Your precious droids have trapped you. They'll hold you until you die of thirst. Make a mistake while repairing them, they explode. Have a good death. My mother was right about you.

Do I know you? No? Then why are you speaking to me?
Why do you poor folk always smell so funny?
Are you our waiter? Gana's buying tonight. Talk to her to get my order.
Let the record show that the trial of Sunry vs. the Ahto City Authority has commenced. Presiding are judges Shelkar...
Jhosa...
Naleshekan...
Kota...
and Duula.
This trial is to determine the culpability of Sunry in the death of the Sith Elassa.
Representing Sunry in his defense is a member of the Jedi Order. Do you have any opening statements?
Sunry is guilty of the murder. He has confessed to me.
No! You traitor!
Sunry! No!
Your client is guilty, Arbiter? Are you sure you wish to enter this plea?
I do.
No! I object! I am the victim of a conspiracy here!
Is this true Arbiter? Your client does not seem to agree with your assertations.
The position of Arbiter is to defend your client. Therefore, inspite of your personal feelings, you must do so to the best of your ability.
This trial will proceed on schedule.
Acting as a prosecutor for the Ahto City Authority is an impartial observer from the Sith Empire.
It is an honor to see justice served.
And I will see Sunry is executed for the crime he has committed.
Do not be too overzealous in pressing your commission, Sith!
The first matter of business is the presentation of a sworn testimony by the proprietor - Ignus - of the hotel where the murder occurred. What is the testimony you wish to give us?
The man I saw leaving - Sunry - left before I heard the blaster shot.
Impossible!
Know your place, Sith!
This is serious evidence indeed. The court will keep this in mind near the top of the list of pertinent facts.
We will now begin by calling forth the witnesses to the crime and taking their testimony.

After each witness has given their testimony and you have cross-examined them, you may ask the presiding judges for their opinions on the current state of the case. This is a special privilege given by Manaan law only to the defendant, so use it wisely.
The first witness is Firith. The prosecution will question the witness first.
You are Firith Me, the well-known Pazaak player. I wonder if we can trust the word of a gambler as reliable testimony...
Objection, your Honors!
Objection sustained. Ask the witness your questions and do it promply.
Of course, your Honor.
Firith: what did you see the night of the murder?
I came out into the hallway after hearing the blaster shot and saw Sunry over there limping down the hall out of the building.
Heh. A very obvious point, your Honors. The accused was seen leaving the scene of the crime after the blaster that killed Elassa was fired.
A very pertinent point, prosecutor.
It is now the defense's turn to cross-examine the witness.
I have no additional questions.
Very well. Would you like to use this opportunity to poll the judges?
Yes.
I think that Sunry, perhaps, could have been the culprit.
I think that Sunry was perfectly capable of committing this crime.
It seems to me that the evidence is weighted against Sunry.
Despite his honorable past, Sunry would seem to have done something deplorable.
Sunry is obviously guilty of killing the Sith woman.
Since the defense has no further questions, we will call out the second witness: the Rodian Gluupor.
The prosecution may question the witness.
Gluupor the Rodian, you were staying in the hotel the night of the murder and saw Sunry leaving Elassa's room didn't you?
Yes, Gluupor see Sunry running down hallway, and when Gluupor look in room, Sith woman dead on floor.
This is clear then: that Sunry left the room with the Sith Elassa already dead behind him.
Perhaps, Sith, perhaps. It is the turn of the defense to question the witness now.
Did you see Sunry kill Elassa?
Gluupor... Gluupor not see Sunry really hurt Sith... But Gluupor did see Sunry leaving room with dead Sith in it!
But... Gluupor not see him really kill Sith...
An important distinction Arbiter.
Do you wish to ask the witness anything else?
Isn't the medal at the crime scene too obvious a clue?
Gluupor not know. Why anyone leave things in someone else's room?
Gluupor just think these things happen. It is just... odd...
Yes. Odd indeed.
Do you really think a cripple could have hurt Elassa?
Sunry seems like strong man, but he is hurt, too.
Gluupor not think that man like that would stand up to a Sith. Not at all. But Sunry still run fast after.
We know full well the extend of Sunry's injuries, Arbiter!
But the fact still remains.
Did you plant the medal on Elassa?
Gluupor... Gluupor...
Don't do it, Gluupor...
The prosecution will be silent!
What is it you wish to say Gluupor?
Gluupor... Gluupor paid by Sith to plant that medal.
Lies! Slander! I object!
You are certain of this Gluupor?
Gluupor certain...
This new evidence puts the entire case in a new light.
Perhaps I was wrong, after all, in my thoughts about Sunry.
I cannot tell yet if Sunry killed Elassa, but I am confident it will be proven.
I do not believe Sunry, as a well-standing Republic citizen, could have committed this crime.
I just do not have enough information to judge this case yet.
Sunry did not have the capacity to commit these murders... I think.
I cannot make my decision on what I have yet seen.
Sunry perhaps was not the killer.
I am unsure as yet as to whether Sunry was the actual murderer.
I think that Sunry could not have committed this crime.
I do not have enough information to make an informed decision.
No.
Did you actually see the murder happen?
You mean actually see him kill her with my own eyes? Well... no... But I don't think there could have been anyone else there.
Your point is well-taken Arbiter.
Do you have additional questions?
Was the medal left at the crime scene not a little too obvious?
I think it may have been. I mean, you'd have to pretty stupid to leave something that important lying around, wouldn't you?
This argument has merit.
How could Sunry have harmed her if he was a cripple?
Well he was moving pretty fast running away... but yeah, I mean, how could he kill a Sith warrior in combat? I don't know for sure...
Do not think less of Sunry because of his handicap. He is fully capable.
Can't you see that the man can hardly walk, let alone fight Elassa?
That is enough for now. We will deliberate on this later in private.
Elassa is a Dark Jedi, isn't she?
Yes, from what I could tell. She carried a lightsaber around under that cloak of hers.
Objection! That doesn't prove she was a Jedi!
No, this piece of evidence is very important. It establishes the character of Elassa and perhaps her intent in dealing with Sunry.
Do not undermine the witness!
The man I saw leaving - Sunry - probably left after I heard the blaster shot.
The guilt of the accused is apparent even this early in the trial.
I have reconsidered.
Honesty is an attribute essential to the position of Arbiter, as is impartiality. It would not be advised for you to abuse either of these.
Do not mock us, Jedi!
Enough! This case will proceed on schedule.
Sunry is guilty of the murder. I have this recording as proof.
A recording? Let this new evidence be entered in the records.
Ah... this new evidence is most convincing.
Yes. Yes it seems to be.
This shortens the trial considerably. In light of this new evidence there is no need to proceed with the witnesses or cross-examinations.
This court hereby finds Sunry guilty of the murder of the Sith Elassa.
In accordance with Selkath law the proscribed punishment for murder is death.
The verdict has been delivered and this trial is now over.
Well, that didn't go well. If I'm ever on trial remind me not to ask you for help.
This is why we Mandalorians don't have courts. We prefer to settle things with trial by combat.
Remove the guilty party from this courtroom.
I... I'm sorry, Sunry. And Elora. There is nothing more we can do.
*sob* Sunry... No...
This is the will of the court, but it doesn't feel like justice to me.
I... I don't believe this. Sunry should be remembered as a hero, not as a murderer. This isn't right.
[Force Persuade] You will find Sunry innocent.
[Failure] You are in no position to tell us how to judge our laws!
We know of your Order, Jedi. We know that you have powers to manipulate the minds of lesser creatures.
Do not think that we Selkath, the pinnacle of evolution, can be swayed by such means!
If you attempt such manipulations again, Sunry will be found guilty, and you will summarily be put to death! We do not tolerate intrusions upon the justice of our courts!
I will find Sunry innocent.
That remains to be seen.
I have no comments at this time.
If the defense has no more questions, the court will call out Elora, Sunry's wife.
You Elora, are Sunry's lawful wife. Your husband was a hero in the last war between the Sith Empire and the Republic.
He was crippled in that war. Do you not believe he'd blame the Sith for his injury?
Yes, I guess he would.
And there you have motive! Sunry seeks revenge on the Sith for what they did him and killed Elassa.
A supposition for now, prosecutor. Does the defense have any questions for the witness?
Was it true your husband was having an affair with Elassa?
Yes... Yes it was true. He was having an affair with that Sith harlot.
It seems painfully obvious that he killed her to keep quiet about the affair.
Be silent! You have already questioned the witness, prosecutor.
He had been seeing her for some time, I think. *sniff* But he said he was going to change!
He had gone there that night to end it! We talked the night before and he had promised!
But now things have become so very complicated...
That is very enlightening evidence. It will influence our deliberation considerably.
Do you have any more questions, Arbiter?
Sunry was a cripple. Could he have killed Elassa?
He was a good man, but his injuries pained him terribly. But he always held on. Always persevered.
I don't think he could have beaten her or anything like that... but a blaster? I just don't know...
Sunry seems fully capable to me. But it seems unlikely that he would choose to do such a thing.
Sunry was a Republic war hero, wasn't he?
Yes. He fought against the Sith in the last war. He fought bravely and was even awarded the Hero's Cross!
I don't know how much that means to the Sith or to your Selkath, your Honors, but in the Republic it is awarded only to the bravest, most valorous, most honorable men.
The kind of man who earns that medal would not kill someone in cold blood!
Your husband earned a medal because he excelled at killing Sith. It relates directly.
Do not let personal opinions sway your judgment of the law!
Does the prosecution have any remaining witnesses to call forth?
I wish to call forth Sunry himself, your Honors.
Very well.
Are you a war hero, Mr. Sunry? You fought in wars against the Sith Empire, correct?
Yeah, that's right. I don't regret it either. The Republic needs its heroes.
Indeed... Would you say that you dislike the Sith? Even... hate them?
Of course I hate them! Trying to take over the galaxy every chance they get! Killing millions of innocents!
Pure politics. Were you in Elassa's room on the night of the murder?
Well, yes I... I was...
I had been having an affair with Elassa on my wife, yes... But I realized how wrong I had been and I was going there to end it!
You were having an affair with a Sith! You wanted to end it quickly and quietly, so you killed her from behind and tried to flee!
No, I...
I think we can see the answer clear enough, Mr. Sunry!
Do not interrupt the accused!
In fact, I think you've said quite enough already, prosecutor.
Do you have any question to ask the accused, Arbiter?
Elassa was a Sith spy, wasn't she?
Of course she was! Why would a young, beautiful Sith woman get with an old cripple like me?
You are not helping yourself, Sunry. You only give reason why you might kill her.
He merely states facts. The incompetence of the murder indicates that her occupation was not the motive for the killing.
The fact remains: Elassa was a Sith and likely a spy as well.
Is there anything else you wish to ask the accused?
How could Elassa have got ahold of your medal?
I don't know. The medal had gone missing some time ago. I never found out what happened to it.
It's possible the Sith had stolen it and had it planted on the body...
Supposition, your Honors!
True, but it does have merit and deserves consideration.
You were going there to end the affair. Would the Sith object?
Yes I think they would. They wouldn't want to lose one of their sources - even though I didn't give them anything!
They... they might have killed her for her failure... or they might have thought she'd turn against them or something like that.
The Sith Empire is not the barbaric institution you portray it to be!
Be silent, prosecutor. This is a valuable point, that lends some credence to your defense, Arbiter.
I knew she was a Sith, and she would be trying to pump me - for information, of course - so I... I just simply turned the tables.
I was working on her, trying to turn her over to the Republic's side. Trying to turn her into a double agent. But that's kind of ruined now that she's been murdered.
An obviously false story! I have proof here, in the form of data recording, that proves you were, in fact, having an affair with Elassa!
Let this new evidence be entered in the court records.
So be it.
I... I... What's the use now... I had been having an affair with Elassa, it's true. But I had realized my mistake and was going there to end it! But I did not kill her!
The witnesses have all been called forward and questioned by both prosecution and defense. The prosecution will now present, in closing, its summary of the pertinent facts of this case.

I think the facts in this case are very straight forward: Sunry was having an affair with Elassa. He sought to end it, and the simplest, quickest method given his hatred of the Sith was to simply kill her.
*Ahem* Witnesses saw Sunry fleeing the scene, and material evidence places him there at the time of the murder as well.
I am confident that any informed observation of the facts will lead the judges - your Honors - to this very conclusion.
Indeed. And your closing statements, Arbiter?
No one actually witnessed the murder.
Truth.
That doesn't mean a thing! He was there, running from the room!
If you speak out of turn again, you will be forcibly ejected from the court! The Arbiter speaks a valid fact.
Is there another point you would make?
Sunry was a cripple and couldn't have killed her.
A cripple can be just as capable as any other man. And Sunry more than most.
You overrate this man!
Perhaps. Are there any other arguments, Arbiter?
The Sith are obviously evil and set this up.
Objection!
The Arbiter is allowed an opinion as well as you, prosecutor.
No matter how erroneous...
Or truthful.
Sunry was ending the affair, so the Sith killed her.
The Sith would not leave the medal of her killer clutched in her hand!
Your time for arguments has passed, and you would do well to remember that!
The Arbiter's argument does bring up a valid point.
Is there anything else you would state?
Elassa was a spy and the Sith are framing Sunry.
I find that highly unlikely, Arbiter. The Sith have no need of such deception. The facts speak clear.
But the Sith have been known for violence, deception, and murder before.
That is also true. Is there another point you would make?
My arguments are complete.
Then the court will now deliberate amongst ourselves.
This court hereby finds Sunry innocent of the murder of the Sith Elassa.
In addition, this court finds the Sith Empire guilty of conspiracy and obstruction of justice.
Your Honors! No!
Silence!
The Sith Empire is hereby forced to subsidize a portion of Republic purchases on Manaan for a period of the next solar year.
The verdict has been delivered and this trial is now over.
Yes! Score one for the good guys!
I knew you wouldn't let the Republic down!
Well done. You showed wisdom worthy of a Jedi Master during this trial.
I guess you got the result you wanted, but I still think this was a big waste of time. We Mandalorians prefer to settle things with a nice, quick trial by combat.
Sunry... I'm so glad...
Elora...
We have done all we could for you, old friend.
Thank you for saving me. I don't know how I can repay you. Elora and I are going to leave here and get as far away from all this as soon as we can.
I - and the Republic - will not forget what you've done for us. Thank you.
Thank you, Jolee! I... I don't know what I would have done if you hadn't shown up!
Don't thank me, thank your Arbiter. I was glad to help.
It's really strange. Nobody seems to know where Master Uthar or Yuthura Ban have disappeared to. Some of the sensitives are claiming they're dead.
Rumor has it that something has happened to Master Uthar and Yuthura Ban. Do you know anything?
I heard that Yuthura Ban was dead. I suppose that means Master Uthar will be taking a new apprentice, soon.
Did you hear? Yuthura is dead. Master Uthar said so. I bet she got too impatient and failed to assassinate him. Idiot.
Master Yuthura has taken over the academy. Everyone's talking about it! I guess she finally got rid of Uthar, somehow.
Have you heard? Yuthura... I mean Master Yuthura has taken over the academy! Well done, I say!
You aren't even a full Sith. Don't bother me.
Get out of my way. I don't have time to deal with hopefuls.
Come back when you've taken your final test. If you survive it.
If Master Uthar gives you an order, you'd better follow it. There were some students who disobeyed him and now they're hiding out on the surface somewhere.
There are some students in hiding that refused to follow an order. Master Uthar wants them found and dead... and is offering a reward for it, too!
Just be careful if you go into the valley. I hear there's a hermit living in the hills that kidnaps students.
The former master of the academy, Jorak Uln, is supposedly hiding out in the hills on the surface as some kind of mad hermit.
Word is that one of our experimental droids went mad and escaped and is hiding in the ruins. I wonder why we don't just gather up and destroy it?
One of my friends went to find that crazy droid that's hiding in the ruins in the valley. He hasn't come back, yet.
Ha! It's great to be on the winning side, isn't it? We've been crushing the Republic at every battle so far!
The latest reports say the Republic is on the run. Before long the Sith will be ruling the entire galaxy.
Darth Malak is one of the greatest Sith leaders ever. I hope he comes back to the academy before I leave.
It is my most fervent hope to serve under Darth Malak once my training is complete. Don't you feel the same?
Rumor around the academy is that you had something to do with those rebel students being caught, finally. They got what they deserved, I say.
I was told that you actually met the old master of the academy, Jorak. Is the hermit as mad as they say?
The buzz is that you took care of that crazy droid out in the ruins. That's pretty impressive.
Hmm. So you got enough prestige to win out, I hear. We'll just see if you make it through your final test.
Sorry, I don't have time to speak. My training awaits.
Hold on - where do you think you're going? This area is restricted to Undercity patrols! Without the proper security papers I can't let you past.
I've got my security papers right here.
Let me see... hmmm, these look to be in order. Okay, you can go down if you want. Can't say I envy you, though.
The Undercity is crawling with mutants. Rakghouls, they call 'em. If you see anything moving down there, shoot first and ask questions later.
[Persuade] I forgot my security papers back at the base.
[Failure] I don't know how they do things in the Upper City, but down here we follow our orders to the letter! Without your security papers I can't let you past.
So just march on back to the base, talk to your commanding officer and tell him you need the security papers. Otherwise you ain't getting down.
[Persuade] I've got orders to join up with one of the Undercity patrols.
You can't keep me out if you're dead!
You just made a big mistake!
I'll be going now.
Good... I don't have time for this foolishness. Down here we run a tight ship - not like the slipshod operation in the Upper City.
Hold on there, civilian! Only those with official Sith business are allowed into the Undercity.
Unless you've got the proper security papers you better just turn around and go back the way you came.
Where can I get these security papers?
You can't... not unless you're on official Sith business. And if you were, someone would already have given you the papers.
I want to ask you some questions.
I'm not here to answer your questions. My orders are to guard the elevator. Now either show me the proper security papers or move along.
Hey, you've already shown me your security clearance. You don't have to speak to me every time you come by. If you need to use the elevator to the Undercity just go ahead.
Just be careful down there. Watch out for those rakghouls!
Beep beep beep-oop!
[This tach may be Rulan Prolik in disguise, but you can't tell for sure. Maybe if you kill it, it will revert to its true form... assuming it's Rulan.]
[Attack the tach.]
[Leave the tach alone.]
Why do you disturb me, human? Grarwwaar comes to the Shadowlands to get away from your kind.
According to a datapad I found, Grarwwaar is dead!
So you have uncovered my little secret. No matter, this body has grown tiresome to me. Maybe I can find one more to your liking, human.
How can I help?
That's... that's impossible!
Your tricks don't fool me, Rulan!
Enough games, Rulan. Time to die.
What do you need?
Yes? What is it?
Got something on your mind, do you?
Yeah? What do you want?
Hey, there. What can I do for you?
Statement: HK-47 is ready to serve, master.
A remarkable likeness, wouldn't you agree?
The resemblance is uncanny, isn't it?
I want to ask you some questions.
I am no slave, human! I am Grarwwaar, a free Wookiee. I do not answer to you.
Leave me be, human. Return to the village in the tree tops. The Shadowlands is no place for your kind.
I'm sorry. I'll be going now.
You are the great warrior now, it seems. You came before and defeated us, and now do so again.
What of it?
If you are as great as you appear to be, then perhaps you can help us as well.
There have been many attacks on the island recently by blue- and red-armored warriors against our scouts.
Mandalorians!
If that is your name for them, then yes.
I was given the task of rooting out their forces, but as you can see, I have failed... Failed both the One, who gave me the command, and the dozen warriors who accompanied me... and did not return.
If you are a great warrior, then you may yet be able to destroy them where I have failed. Surely you have powers beyond my ken, and those would undoubtedly prove critical.
Why should I help you?
You came to the One seeking entrance to the Temple of the Ancients, did you not?

These killers have made their base of sorts near the entrance to the Temple itself. Our scouts can no longer travel safely in that area, and any passage by you towards the Elders' compound would be in danger as well.
Your own best interests lie in their deaths... and...
And?

There have been many wrecks that have crashed onto this world... Many of the items from these vessels may be of some use to you. If you bring me back the head of their leader, I could show you one of the better caches...
Why don't I just take that information?
I am an old and bitter warrior. My injuries are many and I have just come back from a fearsome battle... a slaughter. Even a light hit could kill me, so don't threaten me with violence!
I don't need anything from you!
Whether you believe you do or not, there is no way into the Temple without our assistance. Bring his head to me, and both our causes will be helped.
Why do you need his head?
Why, to gain his strength and knowledge, of course! So will you do this thing? For both of us?
Very well, I'll do it.
Good. I can see that you are a true friend to our people.
I will be waiting here for you when you return.
I've already killed the Mandalorians.
I assure you, I can give a reward, I... You... you what?
Th... thank you for what you have done! The souls of my warriors can rest at peace now.
And with his head, I can gain his strength so that we may overcome his people in the future.
And now, for the reward I promised...
I found these while searching among the wreckage. I don't know what they do, but I hid them here quite some time ago. They are yours now.
I still see no reason to help you.
I don't really feel like.
OK, I'll find those Mandalorians.
I know the beings you are talking about.
... And? So?
What do you want?
Yeah, I kicked your backsides pretty good.
You have earned the gratitude of our people for eliminating the killers who lurked by the Temple of the Ancients.
Now the souls of my warriors can rest in peace. Thank you, Revan.
You have returned. Have you managed to slay the aliens who massacred my warriors?
They are dead. Here is their leader's head.
No, I have not.
Return to me when you have the head of their leader, and I shall show you where some items I have scavenged are.
I don't have to do your dirty work!
If you do not slay them, then you will never gain entrance to the Temple anyway. They make their camp there, and you think they will let you pass?
When you do get the head of their leader, I will be waiting here.
What can you tell me about the Mandalorians?
They appear from the shadows, seeming to blend in and out of thin air. They gather near the obelisk at the far side of the field, attacking any who approach.
Perhaps they worship it, and kill us as sacrifices... but they haven't eaten any of the bodies... They hold us in contempt!
My blood burns at their insult! The souls of the dead howl in anger!
You must go there and kill them so that my warriors will be avenged... Only then will I give you the reward I have promised you.
You mentioned something about salvage?
I will only show you where it is once you've brought me the head of their leader!
Threaten me all you want, but until then, I will show you nothing! The souls of my warriors rest uneasy knowing they still live...
I have to go now.
Your death will bring glory to our new Sith Master!
The droid is actively engaged in its patrol route. You cannot reprogram it anymore.

H... help me! Please! I can... I can feel it inside my skin! Something growing... like some kind of hideous disease!
Here, take this serum. It will cure you.
Th... thank you. Those things - they attacked as soon as we came out the doors. They... they killed the others. It was... it was horrible.
You're okay now.
Over there... I heard something. I know I did! There it is again! It's those monsters! They're coming back! Run for your lives!
I want to ask you some questions.
You're okay now. But I need information. I'm looking for Bastila.
Bastila? She wasn't in this pod. We were tracking her pod just before we hit the planet's surface. It went down somewhere to the west.
We lost the signal when our own pod crashed. Maybe... wait - what was that? Did you hear that? I thought I heard something.
I didn't hear anything.
Don't change the subject. I still have some questions to ask you.
Quit whining and start talking! I need to know where Bastila is!
Wait here... I'll see if I can find something to help you.
No... no!!! I can feel... ARGH!
I'm sorry... there's nothing I can do for you.
I'll help you, but I need some information first.
Get away from me, you diseased freak!
Hey! You not come in here! Brejik say only lab guys come here!
Sorry, I'll be going now.
Good - you go now or me tell Brejik!
You idiot! You can't just let them walk out of here! They might be a Bek spy after our spice!
Huh? Them be Bek spy? BEKS DIE NOW!!
[Persuade] I'm the new lab tech Brejik hired.
[Success] Oh - you lab tech? Okay then.
Oh, you idiot! Brejik didn't hire any new lab techs. That's probably a Bek spy!
[Persuade] I just want a quick look around. Will 20 credits calm you down?
[Persuade] You give money? That sound good to me!
If you take that money I'll tell Brejik you let a Bek spy bribe you!
Time for you to die!
Me not die - you be one who die!
You've just about cleaned me out... I have no more money... but I do have a couple cards I could wager if you want one more game.
Sure. Let's play.
Less talk, more Pazaak.
Not right now.
Well, if you feel like it, that's what I'm here for.
You're just better than I am. I have to concede. I can't play against you if you always beat me like this.
Here, take this. My old Pazaak mentor Daoy gave them to me when I started playing. Maybe they'll do you more good than they have me.
That was a good game. It was closer than I'd have thought. You interested in another?
Yeah? What do you want?
Who are you?
My name is Jolan. Just a travelling Pazaak player with no special story to tell.
Are you interested in a game?
I don't have a deck.
Well, I just happen to have a spare on me. One of my old decks actually. You can have it if you want for, say, 200 credits?
I don't have that much.
Well, if you get enough, come back and maybe we can have a game.
Sure, here you go.
Good. Here it is. I'll give you a copy of the rules as well to even the field a bit.
Sure, I'll play.
Can we play a practice game?
I suppose we could play a match just to help you get a feel for the game.
[Play Pazaak Tutorial]
What are you doing here?
I travel the galaxy looking for Pazaak players to challenge myself. I'm trying to build a deck good enough for the championships.
Nothing for now.
Er... OK.
How did you get in here? Wait - I recognize you!
Lord Malak was most displeased when he learned you had escaped Taris alive! He has promised a great reward to whoever destroys you.
Well, let me guess! You intend to collect this reward, right?
Master, give us the honor of aiding you in destroying this enemy of the Sith.
See? What did I tell you?
As you wish, my eager apprentices. We shall remove this thorn from Malak's side once and for all!
Commentary: It is not possible to destroy the master. It is suggested you run while my blasters warm up, meatbags.
Yes? Is there something you wish? I have a moment or two while others post their times.
I'm sure you will be racing again soon yourself. You have shown that you have the necessary skills.
I wanted to ask a few questions, if you have the time.
I'm not so preoccupied with the track that I can't spare a few minutes. Go ahead.
I want to ask about you and racing.
My name is Zoriis Bafka. I suppose I am one of the more experienced racers here. What do you want me to answer?
Is this the best place for racing?
Perhaps not, but it will do for now. Professional racers like myself travel wherever the purses are highest.
It's no secret that one of the most popular tracks was lost with Taris. Other promoters will need time to organize.
In the meantime, we will race at the smaller venues. This is almost a recreational stop for me.
If this track is so small, why bother?
You lose the skills if you don't use them. I could race on any open road, but competition gives the push to get better.
Besides, if my presence lends a little prestige to the track, maybe we'll get some new racers out of it.
How long have you been at this?
A few years, but I raced under a different name when I was young. My early career was not very spectacular.
Why did you change your racing name?
It wasn't that big of a deal. I made the jump from one league to another and wanted to shed some baggage.
Don't waste much thought on it. It was purely a personal matter that has no bearing today.
What can you tell me about the other racers?
There are some promising newcomers here. Garm tries hard and I wish him well, but Nico is the one to watch.
It's invigorating to watch him discover his skills. I hope he manages to remember why he took up the sport.
What makes you say that?
The race is not just about speed. It is a business, and we are the product. He must market himself carefully.
What do you think about that?
It is a necessary side to the sport. We must make someone money, or there would be no circuit.
Let's go back to my first questions.
If you wish. I don't mind answering.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
I must confess that I haven't had much time to learn about this planet. Talk of Taris has seemed more important.
Some of the hunters in Fazza's lodge seem like they would know more than I would, but that wouldn't take much.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
Racer's luck be with you.
Your petty hobbies are of no interest to me.
All right. Merely making conversation. I'm not looking for a fight.
[Force Persuade] A fight? You are nothing to me. Leave.
[Success] [Her face suggests that she knows the suggestion in her mind was not her own, but she sees no reason to fight it. She obviously didn't like your company.]
I don't want a fight either. I just want money.
Is that all? Then take what I have. Yes, I'm just giving it to you. I can afford to turn this mugging into simple beggary.
You know what? Sometimes you're nothing but a bully!
I know I'm just an old codger, but in my time I've learned what goes around comes around. These things have a way of coming back to you in the end.
Now, if we are through, I must get back to my race preparations. I prefer to leave your unpleasantness behind.
I think you've found one anyway!
Wait! Look, if I've offended some local custom or something, I apologize. I don't want a fight. Here, take this.
Of course not. I meant no harm.
The humor of this is lost on me. The mood on this planet is harsh enough without your games.
But you already know about him. The favor you have done for him will help him greatly in years to come.
But you know about him. He will be a champion, but with his deal he won't see many of the benefits of it.
He should have been smarter.
Are you denying your role in his choice? I think it was fairly explicit that you pushed him into the deal.
But, I suppose it was his choice, even with your... vigorous encouragement.
I am not used to such attention. What do you want me to repeat?
I always have time for a fellow swoop racer. Go ahead.
I just have some questions. Don't bother getting friendly.
All right, I will be as brief as possible. Ask away.
Is this a racing matter? Perhaps you are interested in taking up the sport?
Well, I am impressed with your efforts on the track. You show the promise of a gifted beginner.
You have certainly shown your skill on the track. I imagine you'll be taking aim at my times next.
The track is yours today, I see. Well done beating my time. The sport needs people that give the crowd a spectacle.
Hello again. Have you had a chance to look more closely at our sport?
I have nothing more to say to you. There is no point in continuing this.
Who that? Turn it, you gunda fasca, customers are talking! That's better. Hello customer! Buy from Mic'Tunan'Jus and save your credits!
Very important to save these days, Thuursa knows it's true. Kolto prices make healing expensive, but you can't go without, we're sure.
Just show me what you have for sale.
Yes, of course. We don't want to keep you from your important business. Please, have a look.
I want to ask you a few questions.
We are here to serve. What do you need to know?
I want to ask about you.
Mic'Tunan'Jus is just a humble merchant from the Rim. What would you wish to know about we?
Where do you come from?
You couldn't say it, and don't have the ears for it. Two voices create the name, and four ears hear the true sound.
We suppose the trade lanes have had to call us something. With one mouth the world is Sorjus, far off the Perlemian trade route.
It's an unimportant stop, we admit. We left for a life of trade, because we are strong and a good talker. We have done well.
Are you one creature or two?
You are pardoned for asking because you only know one mind... or at least only one at a time. We are one now, but weren't always.
We grow together, bonded from the age of choosing when we become whole. Not like you. You are half of what you should be, like brood-squeeler.
Er, not that we would want to offend you. We don't want to lose any business. That is just our way as Paaerduag.
Your other half doesn't say much.
Just because *you* can't hear it, doesn't mean it isn't there.
Let's go back to my other questions.
I have to go now.
We wait for your return. Anyone with credits is always welcome.
Again you ask, but we have not changed. Just an honest merchant from the Rim.
Do you know anything about Tatooine?
Not as much as we should. If we knew more, we would have better business. Travelers like us best. Settlers don't have much to trade.
We don't travel far on Tatooine itself, you see. The weather is not like our home. Too dry. Way too dry.
Who would I ask to get more information?
Always trust the locals, even if they don't trust you. They are the ones that really know what's going on. That's true on any world.
We have not moved since you last asked. The Tatooine dust is rough on our hide, and the sun is much harsher than it needs to be.
Heard any off-world rumors?
Just what everyone else talks about: Taris and the Sith and the stirring of change. Could be good for business, could be bad for business.
All that we know is that wise people keep low and stay out of the way. Something to always remind your other half. Er... if you have one.
Yes, save, because you never know when situations turn all around. Look at Czerka. We hear... well, things are not well on outpost Kashyyyk, we're sure you know.
Yes, save, because you never know when hardship will come. The galaxy is dangerous, we say, even before we hear of Sith trouble on Korriban.
You will want to save your money for your swoop, we would bet. Yes, you have the champion's face. we'll have what you need.
And don't be shy. Just ask to see what you want. If you can't get a good look, we don't move the merchandise.
And like we were saying, we don't sell anything if you don't ask for it, so step up and see what Mic'Tunan'Jus can both do for you.
Turn it around, fassa to gammenda! The customers come back and we need to see them good! There you are, back to save your credits.
Beep beep beep-oop!
Bastila, Carth and the crew have been taken prisoner as you ordered, commander!
Excellent. Have you searched the ship thoroughly? Admiral Karath warned me to be on alert for any kind of treachery.
We found a young Twi'lek in the back. She's got quite the mouth on her! She swore at me and spit on my uniform.
She tried to bite me through my armor! And you should hear what she said about my mother. Admiral Karath needs to teach her the proper respect for the Sith!
The Admiral doesn't have time to bother with some Twi'lek girl! Take her away to solitary confinement. I'll leave it up to you to teach her the proper respect for the Sith!
We found a disabled astromech droid in the back of the ship.
Wipe its memory chips and take it to the junk pile. Maybe we can use some of its parts for salvage.
We found an old man in the back. I... I think we should keep him separate from the others. For questioning.
A strange request. And why do you think this old man should be segregated?
I... I'm not sure, Commander. After speaking with him I just... I just think we should question him away from the others.
I... I agree, Commander. After speaking with the old man I think we should question him away from the others.
Very well. The Admiral is probably too busy to bother with this old man anyway. Take him to solitary confinement for interrogation. Report back to me if you learn anything.
We found an injured Mandalorian in the back. Looks like he was trying to rig the ship's engines to break free of our tractor beam when something exploded.
Admiral Karath wants us to question all the prisoners. Did you get any information from him?
He's unconscious right now. I don't think he's going to make it. He's burned pretty bad.
Dump the Mandalorian in the medical bay. Let them take the blame if he dies before the Admiral has a chance to interrogate him.
We searched the ship from top to bottom. Somebody would have had to be invisible for us not to find them in there.
Well done. Return to your posts, and I will tell the Admiral of this.
We found a disabled hunter-killer droid in the back of the ship.
Excellent. We can reprogram this droid to fight in our own army. Wipe its memory chip and take it to the salvage shop. The technicians will deal with it later.
I'm not doing anything wrong! I'm just standing here... you Sith can't arrest me for that!
I can't believe the Sith put a quarantine on the planet! It's bad enough we can't leave, but all you off-worlders are stuck here, too!
I heard there's a swoop gang war in the Lower City! They say you can get shot just walking in the streets down there!
Ever since the Sith quarantine Javyar's cantina is packed with off-worlders! It never used to be that busy.
I heard the Sith are sending salvage teams into the Undercity. I heard they're looking for Republic survivors to take prisoner.
You there! I don't recognize you! How did you get in here?
I have a passcard.
Your pass-card is out of date! And I don't recognize you at all! We'll get to the bottom of this soon enough!
Commander Grann, report to the security desk immediately!
You authorized this person to enter?
Yes, they had the proper authorization to enter...
I don't know them... and their identification doesn't match up! They're spies!
What?! Sound the alarm! Droids, destroy them!
Yes? What is it?
I know the pass code.
Your pass-code is out of date! And I don't recognize you at all! We'll get to the bottom of this soon enough!
[Lie] I don't have to tell you! I have higher authority!
[Failure] Ha! I don't recognize you and I know every Sith on this planet! We'll get to the bottom of this!
[Force Persuade] We are authorized to be here.
[Failure] You... I don't recognize you! I know the face of every Sith on the planet! We'll get to the bottom of this!
[This Sand People warrior ignores you. It seems your presence here is a barely tolerated event.]
[Your disguise fails at short range. The warrior attacks!]
[This gizka looks rather sickly. It must have been infected with the gizka poison. You probably should keep your distance.]
[The gizka looks at you curiously, cooing.]
[Feed it the gizka poison.]
[The gizka devours the poison in a single, greedy gulp. It will probably take a few seconds for the poison to have an effect.]
[Pick it up.]
[You try to pick up the gizka, but it wriggles from your grasp and plops back down to the floor.]
[Kill it.]
[The fragile creature's neck is easily wrung. Strangely enough, another gizka shows itself a moment later, crawling out from between two panels.]
[Pet it.]
[You scratch the little critter behind its nubs that pass for ears and it coos enthusiastically in response.]
[Play a game with the gizka.]
[You play a game of peek-a-boo with the little creature, hiding your face behind your hands and startling it each time you "appear". What fun.]
[Leave it alone.]
[The gizka looks disappointed at the lack of attention and hops away.]
Leave me, citizen. I've business to attend to.
More rabble with every landing. Go farm the dunes, ship-rat.
I'll be glad when we close up operations here.
Can't get any buyers for Tatooine ore anywhere. Word is getting out.
See the office if you're looking for work. I don't hand out shovels.
If I were smart I'd use these business junkets to just keep going. Get off this rock for good.
I've work to do. Why don't you go drown yourself in the cantina like the other diggers.
I haven't time to talk to you. Czerka business takes precedence.
We might have a position within the Sith organization for one such as you.
Your offer is pretty good. But I've heard some nasty things about you Sith. Is it true you bombed Taris into dust?
