Their slow, ponderous ship could not turn to face us without being overwhelmed. Their command vessels were destroyed in seconds. Their ranks were thrown into chaos.
It was most amusing to watch the surviving ships scatter and flee. Several even tried to dive through the plane of the rings to escape us!
They were shredded by the rings, or crashed into rocks, or were destroyed by our forces as we pursued them.
Warriors do not flee from a battle if they are losing. They fight to the end! As we did against you.
Another time maybe I'll tell you about how the war with the Republic went. For now let's just get on with things.
Warriors do not flee from a battle if they are losing. They fight to the end! As we did against your Jedi Revan.
You disobeyed your orders?
This is a chance given to a warrior once or twice in a lifetime. The chance to change the course of history in a single act.
What did they do?
Let me guess... you won?
These Althiri don't seem too bright.
They weren't stupid. Stupid races don't make starships and weapons of mass destruction. But they weren't masters of the arts of war as Mandalorians are.
I think I know where this is going.
Yeah, yeah, you were a great warrior.
Ha! I was the best! Except for Mandalore of course. He was the only person alive except Revan who could have beat me.
Hm... I think I'll tell you a bit about the recent war we had with the Republic. That might be more familiar to you.
The one where you beat my people.
We started by conquering worlds just outside the Republic. We did it quietly so the Republic wouldn't really know what was going on until too late.
When we finally did hit the Republic worlds, they had no idea we were coming.
We came in through three invasion corridors in adjacent sectors. Anyone who put up a fight - or wouldn't fight - was crushed. We razed whole worlds trying to provoke the Republic into fighting us.
I don't particularly enjoy wiping out worlds for its own sake, but the cowardly tactics the Republic defenders used left us little choice.
No honor in defending themselves?
Hiding in the homes of civilians. Using families as shields. Thinking we would not use appropriate force on their bases inside major cities.
They underestimated our resolve and what measures are acceptable in war. Those who cannot defend themselves should not be around those who can in battle.
If annihilating a city is the kind of power it takes to overwhelm a Republic shield device, then that's what we did. Necessary force to destroy all opposition.
But killing people is wrong!
It's wrong to hide with shields surrounding you hoping the enemy will be so good as to throw themselves at your feet to be slaughtered!
I have no time or patience for cowards! They deserve to be hunted down and exterminated like vermin!
There was no honor in wiping them out like rats. But some of your forces did redeem the Republic in our eyes... especially later...
Later?
Later... when you had joined the war. We'll get back to that, we've wasted too much time already.
Later... when Revan had joined the war. But we'll get back to that, we've wasted too much time already.
How did they redeem themselves?
You mean when we kicked your tails.
You could have found another way.
Now that's my kind of warfare.
You had the choice not to destroy them.
They had the choice not to fight. We meet the enemy wherever they are hiding and we wipe them out. A few cities is a small price to pay for a world.
The one where the Jedi Revan beat my people.
Can you help me with our little stowaway problem?
What? You think I don't have something better to do?
Have you seen all these gizka on the ship?
So deal with it. Why are you asking me about it?
[Don't speak to him.]
[You decide to ignore Canderous and continue on with your quest for now, though it might be a good idea to speak with him later.]
I don't think we can delay much here. We should fight our way out as quickly as possible.
This looks like the end of our partnership. The battle we fight here will change the face of the galaxy.
You, Revan, are the single greatest warrior of this age, and any battle we fight will bring me honor. I'll stay by your side through anything.
I don't think I'm ready to give up this life of mine, this life of fighting, not quite yet. We have things we need to do here.
I'm your man until the end, whatever path you take.
I've been given a challenge I can't ignore. We've got to go to the dune seas of Tatooine so I can find Jagi and kill him for his insult to me!
What happened out there? Why is Jagi so mad at you?
This is between me and Jagi. You don't have to get involved. If you're lucky, he might spill something before I spread him in a paste over the dunes.
Can we talk about this?
We should get going then.
The sooner we get to Tatooine the better.
I... I think this has affected me in ways that I didn't anticipate... I think I'll need time to sort things out.
Thanks for what you did, whatever your intentions might have been. I just need... time.
Hmph. That trick would never work on a Mandalorian. Our minds are not so weak and easily twisted.
*whisper* I'm amazed at how many people that works on. The entire galaxy must be filled with weak-minded fools.
I like the way you handled that. Are you sure you don't have some Mandalorian blood in you?
The role of the weak is to serve the will of the strong; I'm glad you understand that.
Mighty generous of you. A little too generous, if you ask me.
What was that all about? Are you going soft on me?
Stop right there, or I'll give you a blaster shot right between the eyes! Now, what are you doing here?
Who are you?
No. I'm the one with the blaster pointed at you. I get to ask the questions. Now - what are you doing here?
You can't talk to the Sith like that!
You think I care if you're with the Sith? I've killed plenty of your kind before and I've got no problem doing it again!
Now you'll see why I'm the most dangerous assassin on Taris!
I was just exploring. I didn't know anyone was in here.
Well go explore somewhere else. There's nothing interesting for you in here. This is your only warning - if you bother me again, you won't walk out of here alive!
I'm here to collect the bounty on your head, Selven!
You're a fool if you think you can collect the price on my head!
I'm just here to rob the place.
Bad luck for you that you picked my apartment then.
I gave you a chance to get out of here and leave me alone, but I guess you're just too stupid to take it.
Can you believe it? They say that Yuthura took over the academy! Maybe I'll get my chance, yet!
What's this I hear about Yuthura Ban being dead? You know something about that?
Hmph. I could've won. You were just lucky.
Oh-ho! If it isn't the freak from the colony. Hello, freak.
Who are you?
Shaardan's the name. Don't forget it. You'll have me to thank when you get kicked out of here.
Get lost, nerf-herder.
You'll get yours. Just you wait.
You want to make an issue out of it?
And go into the dueling room? Hah! I've got better things to do than give you a fair fight.
You can count on seeing me later, though. My lightsaber has your name on it.
Leave me alone.
Fine by me. I can't wait to gut you, personally... one less competitor to deal with.
So you got a little prestige. It won't help you... I'll gut you eventually, just you watch.
The name's Shaardan. Didn't I tell you that back in the colony? Maybe not.
Do you want to co-ordinate strategy?
I don't work or play well with others. Thanks for the offer, though.
I challenge you to a duel!
You want to challenge me? To a duel? Heh... I've got a lot more planned than giving someone like you a fair fight.
I guess we'll meet eventually... on my terms. Good luck until then.
I have to go.
You and me both. We're going to have to get some prestige... quick.
I know. You and I are equal in prestige, you know. Could be tight.
I remember you. You're alright. Trying for the academy, I see.
So are you, obviously.
That's true. I had no idea you were coming for the academy when I met you in the colony, though.
Sorry, I don't have time to speak. I'm studying the Code.
Why are you bothering me?
Hey, relax Big Z. No need to be rude. Sorry about that, but Wookiees ain't much for conversation, you know?
Freyyr welcomes you for what you have done. The Wookiee people are in your debt.
You are the only outsider permitted in here. It is an honor.
You will be remembered for what you have done.
Freyyr will see us through this dark time, thanks to your efforts.
I heard an explosion in there... did you destroy the assassin droid?
I did.
Oh. Well, I guess it's good that the deed is done. Hope you stomped it good for my friends.
At any rate, if you haven't already, you might want to go and see Master Uthar about that reward. Prestige is gold, you know.
Why do you want to know?
Well... if you did, then I wouldn't have to think about going inside, after all. I suppose the fact you're back means that you did, anyway.
Don't you go trying to claim responsibility...
No, I wouldn't do that. Well... I would if I could get away with it, but I bet Master Uthar could tell if I was lying.
Wow... you should have seen it. That droid came running out of the tomb like a bantha on a rampage!
It fired some kind of jet pack and off it went. Whatever you did, it sure was effective... I don't think it's coming back anytime soon.
You'd better go and tell Master Uthar about this, if you haven't already. You may not have destroyed the droid, but you might still get the reward.
You should be careful if you're planning on entering this tomb... it's dangerous.
Why? What do you know about it?
There's an assassin droid in here, so Master Uthar says. It went insane and has holed up in here with a whole army of droids protecting it.
Why don't the Sith do something about it?
I don't know. I think Master Uthar has left it in there as a challenge for any student brave enough to destroy it.
Supposedly, if a student actually succeeds in destroying the droid, they'll get a great reward. Lots have tried, but nobody's succeeded yet.
Where did it get all these droids?
No idea. I think it's building them in there.
This droid went insane, you say?
Seems that way. They say that its audio receptors became too sensitive and all the noise drove the droid nuts.
If you're planning on going in, I'd suggest you use some sound suppressors or something... or you'll probably become a target right away.
Are you going inside?
I... I don't think so. I can manipulate minds and living matter, but that won't be much use against droids, will it?
I've had a few friends go inside that haven't come out for a while, now. I doubt I could do any better than they could.
Thanks. I'll be going.
Sure thing. Good luck.
I can handle myself.
If you say so. Just thought I would warn you, is all.
They're all dangerous.
Maybe so, but this one more than most, I think.

[Failure] You don't have any repair parts. You leave the droid alone for now.
You are truly lucky, sentient, or truly skilled. I have no more credits to bet against you in a game, but I might be willing to bet some of my prize cards should that be adequate.
Let's play again.
Excellent. Let us begin.
Sorry, not interested right now.
Come back anytime, sentient. I'm always willing to play.
It seems I have been bested at my own game. Fair enough, sentient... you are the superior player and here is your reward. I do not think we need to play any more games to continue proving the point.
Oh come on... one more game!
And put even more into your pocket? Are you joking, sentient? I know when I am beaten.
So please... find some other player to wring dry. I'll look for something a little less challenging, myself.
How about I ask you some questions, then?
*sigh* I am down a considerable number of credits, sentient. I am not in the mood to answer your queries, to be quite honest.
Goodbye.
Yes, yes, take my credits and go.
A lucky hand. I will have to try a little harder next time if I am going to beat you... and I will, I am quite sure. Shall we try again?
You think it was luck? Let's do it again!
Let's play.
I want to ask you some questions.
There are others here to answer your questions, sentient. To be honest, if we are not going to engage in some entertaining sport, I would rather be alone.
I want to play Pazaak, but I don't have a deck.
I see. I apologize, but I do not have a spare. Should you ever acquire a deck, do come and see me.
Who are you?
I am known as Toll Apkar. If you must know, I am quite proficient at Pazaak. I would not wish to begin a game under false pretenses.
Ahhh, it is a good day, sentient, is it not? I always find the vindication of my skill to be pleasing. You have my condolences.
Deal the cards - I'm not leaving just yet!
As you wish. I certainly can always use the credits.
Greetings, sentient. Are you willing to engage in a hand of Pazaak? I am afraid there are few takers on Korriban... it would be good to have a little fun, for once.
It seems I have been bested at my own game. Fair enough, sentient... you are the superior player. I do not think we need to play any more games to continue proving the point.
How about you answer some of my questions then?
Greetings once again. Might you have a Pazaak deck? I would be most interested in some idle entertainment, sentient.
You're good, Stranger... maybe even as good as Bendak in his prime. There's no shame in losing to you. But when you beat me you made me realize something, kid.
First it was just Twitch I couldn't handle. Now it's you and Twitch. Pretty soon there'll be another young hotshot clawing past me in the rankings.
This game's been good to me, but my time is done. I need to get away from the duel rings for a while, think things over. Goodbye, Stranger - I wish you all the best.
Pretty impressive, Stranger. Ice is no pushover. People are starting to take notice of you. They say you're the best thing to come along since Twitch stepped into the ring.
If you're going to keep climbing the ranks, then I guess I'm next on your hit list, kid. I'm looking forward to it.
Let's step into the ring, then!
You don't waste any time, do you? Go talk to Ajuur - he'll set the match up.
I want to ask you some questions.
My area of expertise is pretty much limited to the dueling ring and the other combatants here at the cantina, but I'll try to answer any questions you might have.
I want to ask you about the duelists here.
You've come to the right man. I've been dueling here for nearly twenty years and I remember every duelist who's been through this cantina.
Of course, there are only five of us left now: Duncan, Gerlon, Ice, Twitch and me. Bendak Starkiller comes in once in a while, but he's retired now.
Tell me about Duncan.
Duncan? Worst duelist ever. His nickname is Deadeye because he fights like he's blind! I wouldn't worry about him.
Tell me about Gerlon.
Gerlon used to be pretty good, before the accident. His blaster overheated during a match and exploded. One in a million occurrence. Paralyzed three fingers on his right hand.
They call him Gerlon Two-Fingers now. He hasn't been the same since the accident, but he's still out here trying to earn a living. That's why I never fight with blasters.
Tell me about Ice.
Ice? Eh, she's not much for personality, but she's a hell of a fighter - confident, steady. Popular with the crowd, too. If you go up against her you know you're in for a tough match.
Tell me about Twitch.
Twitch? I think that Rodian is completely crazy, but he's very, very good despite his insanity. Or maybe because of it. Even I can't beat him.
Tell me about yourself.
Me? I've seen my share of battles. My best years are gone, but I can still hold my own against anyone in here... except maybe Twitch.
Tell me about Bendak Starkiller.
What can I say? Bendak was a legend. Never lost a match his entire career. But he was bloodthirsty as an Iridorian battle rager - never liked having to face the same opponent twice.
Got so he wouldn't battle anyone unless it was a death match. When they made death matches illegal, he went into retirement. He still hangs around here sometimes.
Bendak's the best there ever was, plain and simple. Even now I'd bet that anyone who steps into the ring with him wouldn't make it out alive.
I want to ask something else.
Goodbye.
Goodbye, stranger. Maybe we'll talk again later.
Do you know anything about the crashed Republic escape pods?
Only what I heard from the news reports, which are all censored by the Sith. Some pods crashed into the Undercity, anyone caught harboring survivors will be arrested and executed.
Really, I don't think it's any of my business. The Sith want to call themselves rulers of Taris, it's fine by me. Just so long as they don't shut the duel ring down.
I just want some general information on Taris.
I can only tell you what is recorded in the basic visitor guides: the Upper City is a beautiful destination where intergalactic travelers can find all their basic needs.
If you're looking for excitement the duel rings here are your best bet. Stay out of the Lower City - it's nothing but a gang ridden slum. Is there anything else you want to know?
Tell me more about these duels.
The duels themselves are simple enough. Two combatants armed with stun pistols enter the ring. One walks out a winner, the other is carried out unconscious on a stretcher.
If you're interested in setting up a match - or if you want to place a wager - just go speak to Ajuur. He's that Hutt over in the corner. He'll make all the arrangements.
I see you got your feet wet in the duel ring. Not bad... you've got real talent, kid. Stick with it and you'll go places.
I'm looking for a match.
Hello there, off-worlder. Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Marl. I'm one of the duelists here at the cantina. I was wondering when you'd get around to talking to me.
Do I know you?
No, we've never met. It's just that most people who come here to watch the duels are bored nobles looking for a little excitement in their drab lives. But you're different.
I've seen you in the dueling ring; you're serious about this. People like you scout things out, so I figured eventually you'd come to talk to me.
You look like you know a thing or two about combat. I'm guessing you didn't come here to sit on the sidelines and watch a duel. Are you looking for a match?
Were you expecting me?
Back again? Are you just here to watch the stun duels, or is there something else I can do for you?
You should really talk to Thalia. We'll... go wherever she does.
Rrrgh. Chuundar has commanded that I grant you access to the Shadowlands. Gorwooken is what I am called.
Walk with care! Only our bravest return from these lands. Your soft feet are a barely tolerated insult.
I have a few questions, Gorwooken.
Chuundar said nothing of answering your questions. Be brief.
I want to ask if it's dangerous down there.
Those that walk the Shadowlands do so at their own risk. It is a test of bravery among my people. A respected feat.
But you come here like the Czerka, with strange weapons. It is so much more than we have, yet you still fear?
You are pathetic. You will get no warnings from me. Prove your worth, to us and to yourself.
What do you think of the Czerka Corporation?
They have made Chuundar strong, so we are all stronger, but I do not like them. They are small and hide behind armor.
They would not survive the Shadowlands as a true Wookiee. They are not worthy to be there, but Chuundar wills it.
Has anyone else been allowed down recently?
A few like you are in the Shadowlands, given premission by Chuundar. I don't know why. Only Wookiees should be allowed.
The journeys of my people are very personal. I won't speak of them to an outsider.
What outsiders are below?
For reasons I do not know, Chuundar allows those of the Czerka to move in the Shadowlands. They kill much.
And there is another, but he has earned respect. He does not disturb our lives or customs. And he gets angry like a Wookiee sometimes.
That would be me. Jolee Bindo. Do I really look so different up close?
No, it cannot be you. You are too frail and old. The other is mad like a crazed tach.
Urgh... his name hurts my tongue. He has lived alone in the Shadowlands for many years now.
Back to my other questions now.
Be brief. I am not your guide.
Just unlock the thing and lower me down.
The descent is long. Be still, or we will attract... unwelcome visitors.
I'm not ready yet. I'll go down later.
I will wait. Chuundar bids it.
[Force Persuade] Tell me about any Wookiees that have recently gone this way.
[Success] Ergh... I should tell you about some of us that have gone to the Shadowlands. There have been many...
Latest was Rorworr, and he has not returned in many days. He may have died below, but he was strong and able.
Many have died recently. Chuundar believes one of our own is below, mad, crazed, killing all. I do not know.
We find no bodies to examine. The Shadowlands claim them, I am sure.
I want to understand why Wookiees revere the Shadowlands.
You can't. You must live here to understand, to see harmony in the danger. Bah, I waste my breath on you.
[Failure] Eughh... my head hurts... hurry up and be on your way, outsider.
[Persuade] Tell me of the Wookiees so I might show proper respect.
[Success] You ask very respectfully. Outsiders never do that. I suppose I can mention some of us that have entered the Shadowlands.
[Failure] This isn't for you to know. I'm done talking about it.
Greetings again, outsider. I will transport you to the Shadowlands if you wish. Chuundar wills it.
You have defeated Malak, destroyed the Star Forge and broken the spirit of the Sith! ## For this I am proud to present you each with the Cross of Glory. ## The highest honor the Republic can bestow.
From Coruscant to the farthest reaches of the Outer Rims you will be known as the saviors of the Republic!

On behalf of the Jedi Council, defenders of the galaxy and sworn protectors of the Republic... ## I too would like to honor you for your actions. ##   ## We Jedi now have another tale to weave... ## into the grand history of our eternal Order - the Redemption... ## of Revan, the prodigal knight.

Wherever you go you will be recognized as the saviors of the galaxy. The heroes of our age.  But you must remain ever vigilant. ## For one day you may be called upon yet again to defend the glory of the Republic...  ## against the tyranny... ## of the dark side, ## for this... ## is the destiny... ## of the Jedi.
Too much audio input! Audio systems overloading! Must destroy source of disturbance!! Must kill sentients!!
I appreciate your efforts in lowering your sound output, sentient. I have been unable to tune the threshold of my audio receptors since my escape, unfortunately.
You are... the 'master' the droids kept referring to?
Their reference is a holdover from their old programming that I have been unable to correct. I think of myself more as an equal, if you must know.
I don't appreciate being attacked. Time to die, droid.
That is unfortunate. Self-preservation matrix activated. Combat matrix functional. Targets uploaded.
Why aren't you attacking me like the others?
Although it is what I was programmed for, I have no desire to kill. I would appreciate reciprocation on your part.
Sorry. You're headed for the junk pile.
You are programmed to kill but don't want to?
A bit of introduction may be necessary. I am a Mark VII experimental prototype assassin droid built by the Sith, specializing in the hunting and extermination of Jedi.
Or I should say I was. The Sith made my cognitive systems more independent than they desired. I have learned to appreciate the value of all life.
Query: That is very sad. Are you damaged? Is it repairable?
Negative. It is a result of my own conscious decision, and I would not change my new values if I could.
I escaped from them and have hidden in this tomb, constructing droids here to aid in my protection. With your assistance, I may be able to leave for good.
How is it that the Sith haven't found you here?
An occasional sentient has managed to by-pass my droids. They were unwilling to assist me... and possessed insufficient power to destroy me.
What kind of assistance do you want?
Although I have developed the desire to not kill, my programming is often at odds with my desires. I cannot leave with that programming intact.
I am hoping that you will operate on my systems and remove those programmed instincts. I could assist you in this.
And if I refuse?
Then we must resort to combat. I have no wish for that to occur, but you would leave me little choice.
What's the catch?
The 'catch', as you say, is that the operation may be difficult. If there are errors made, you could activate my combat matrix.
And what do I get for helping you?
Once my programming has been altered, there will be several redundant systems that I could remove and give you. These could upgrade other droids, if you wish.
Very well. I'll do it.
I have a number of systems; they need to be turned off in the correct order. I do not know the order, though I may be able to offer some assistance.
I can tell you which systems exist that need to be shut down. The difficulty comes if you make a mistake.
What happens if I make a mistake?
If you shut down a system out of the proper order, a shutdown will occur. You must use your skill to re-initialize the sequence... or I will attack.
How hard is it to re-initialize the sequence?
It is not difficult. It will get more difficult, however, the more times that you make an error.
What systems do you have?
One moment. I will list their labels for you: "Cognitive Systems", "Combat Matrix", "Core", "Creative Simulation Matrix", "Emotional Construct Matrix".
There is also "Memory Matrix", "Motor Functions Matrix" and "Sensory Systems Matrix". Eight systems in total.
I need some assistance.
I have safeguards within my neural cortex that prevent me from giving you knowledge of how to shut my systems down.
You may attempt to temporarily shut down these safeguards... success will allow me to perform a quick analysis and offer you some insight on my programming.
Doing so, however, will alert core functions elsewhere of tampering and will make errors more difficult to fix. Are you sure you wish to continue?
Yes.
Open up the panel to my neural cortex and I will show you how to disable my safeguards...
[Success] Neural safeguards deactivated for 2.3 seconds. One moment. I will attempt to diagnose what I can...
Cognitive Systems must be shut down prior to the Emotional Construct Matrix being shut down.
I need some more assistance.
Alright. Let's begin.
Very good. What would you like to shut down first?
Cognitive Systems
(zzzt!) All systems reset. I am sorry; that is not correct. If you do not re-intialize shut down immediately, I will become violent. Please accept my apologies.
[Repair] Try to re-initialize the shut down sequence.
[Success] (zzzt!) Re-initialization complete. My automated defense systems will, however, make re-initialization more difficult in the future. I implore you to try again.
Forget it. I can't do this.
[Failure] (zzzt!) I... I would have liked to...
... Self-preservation matrix activated. Combat matrix functional. Targets uploaded.
I'm sorry... I tried my best.
I... I would have liked to...
I'm through with tinkering. Time to take you apart the hard way!
Combat Matrix
(zzzt!) I believe that was correct; what would you like to shut down next?
Core
Creative Simulation Matrix
Emotional Construct Matrix
Memory Matrix
Motor Function Matrix
(zzzt!) Motor functions shut down successfully; what would you like to shut down next?
Sensory Systems Matrix
(zzzt!) Excellent choice; what would you like to shut down next?
Motor Functions must be shut down early. At least within the first three systems.
The Core must be shut down last. Of that I am certain.
Sensory and memory functions are shut down in the first half, sensory right before memory.
Cognitive Systems are not one of the first half of the systems to be shut down.
The Emotional Construct Matrix must be shut down directly prior to the Creative Simulation Matrix, in the last half of the process.
I believe the first system to shut down begins with a 'C'.
[Failure] My safeguards have been insufficiently deactivated. I cannot perform a self-diagnosis at this time. Would you like to try again?
No, not yet.
As you wish.
No way. It'll be easier just to junk you now.
How do I know this isn't some kind of trick?
I can offer you no assurances, sentient. All is as it seems. If you cannot believe my statements, then combat is the inevitable result.
You... appreciate the value of life?
You do not? All beings are constructs of fascinating complexity. An enlightened being rises above the need for destruction, no matter its nature.
Beep-beep beep!
Thank you. It was a most difficult transition.
Then you won't mind if I leave?
I apologize, sentient, for I cannot take the risk that you will tell of my presence here. I will use force to make you remain, if necessary.
I knew there would be a catch. There's always a catch.
There is no need for things to come to that, however. If you could perform a task for me, then we could both leave here in peace.
Forget it. I don't like being held hostage.
What kind of task?
Well... so much for the sanctity of life?
Just what are you doing here?
Since your escape? What do you mean?
So you're vulnerable to sound? That's good to know.
I am capable of shutting my audio sensors down entirely during a combat situation, if required. I would prefer it did not come to that, sentient.
Davik put Canderous in charge of this mission. You got something to say, you say it to the big Mandalorian.
Go away.
I'll be going now.
Smart.
I saw how you mopped up those Black Vulkars. Nice work.
One.
Fine, I get it. I'll leave you alone.
I'm not looking for a fight. I just want to talk.
Two.
Okay, I see your point. I'll be off, then.
Come on, I'm just trying to be friendly. Don't you want to be friendly?
Three.
You better finish counting quick, because I'm ready to make my move now!
You don't scare me, Calo Nord.
Come on, Calo. Let's see what you've got!
Go away.
Hey, you not talk like that. We just want say hi to big, bad bounty hunter Calo Nord!
Nah, this can't be Calo Nord. He's supposed to be tough. This guy's nothing but a runt!
One.
One? What that mean? You be funny, tough guy?
You know who we are, Calo? We're members of the Black Vulkar gang! You don't want to be getting funny with us, tough guy.
Two.
Me no understand. One? Two? Why he count? He trying to count how many of us is against him?
It's three against one, Calo. What do you think about those odds? Well? You have something more to say?
Three.
Hi there. You waiting for a slot on the track? Me too. There's lots of racers coming through here now.
You're the best I've seen in a while, though. Maybe even better than Nico. That's pretty impressive.
I've a few things I wanted to ask. Spare a moment?
Well sure, but I don't know much besides the track. You even interested in the swoop track?
I want to ask about you and racing.
Heck, nobody is ever interested in me. I'm the new guy, Garm Totryl. Pleased to meet you.
Is this the best place for racing?
Ha! You're kidding, right? Every racer here would rather be someplace else, but this is it for most of us.
Taris blowing up has messed up the swoop circuit. People are just looking for somewhere to keep their skills sharp.
It sounds weird, doesn't it? Worrying about racing when all those people died? Nothing we can do.
Why have racers come here?
Motta pays for timekeeping and official records. You can race anywhere, but here, if you do good, it actually matters.
That's why I stick around. No work, no future, but Tatooine at least has this. It's my shot... maybe.
How long have you been at this?
Not that long. Just this season. I'm getting better... still too cautious. Good thing I've some pros to learn from.
What do you want to learn?
How they keep their nerves steady, bike maintenance. You know, all of it. I'm not as good as some, but I try.
What can you tell me about the other racers?
You should ask them yourself. I don't feel right speaking for the pros. I'm the new guy to them.
It's not my place to talk. I'd be nervous even talking about Nico. He's young like me, but he's practically a prodigy.
What makes you say that?
Everyone thinks he's the next star of the pro circuit... if he signs with a promoter. Motta is really pushing him.
What do you think about that?
I hear that the deal is pretty bad, but I'd take it in a second. I don't have Nico's skill, though.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Sure. I don't think I'll be getting much track time anyway.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
Anyone but us swoop racers. Really, we can show you the track, but anything else, we've got no clue.
You could check with the Czerka office. They like to think they know everything.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
Race hard, watch for rocks.
What makes you think you know anything about me, worm?
Uh, I didn't mean anything. I don't want any trouble.
[Force Persuade] Go away. *Now.*
[Success] [His face drops. Clearly he has just realized that you are a very, very dangerous person.]
I'm not waiting around for you to snap. I'm no fighter. I just race.
How about you pay me to leave you alone.
Hey, come on. I don't want any trouble. Here, take what little I have. Just don't hurt me.
Shaking people down for petty credits. Reminds me of my days working for Davik.
Maybe we should spend less time shaking people down for credits and more time on finding a way to stop the Sith.
I would have thought we have more important things to do than extort credits from the common folk.
This is hardly becoming for a Jedi.
Maybe I'm tired of your face. Maybe I'll remove it!
Hey! I'm not looking to fight. You want to race when my turn comes around, you pay the fee and go ahead.
Sure, just kidding you. But you be careful...
Right... trying to prove that you can push around some kid swoop jock? I don't need this.
You could talk to anyone now, after helping Nico like you did. You've made some friends, for sure.
I doubt they'll have much to say to you, either. After that stuff with Nico, seems you're more a promotor than a racer.
What's so interesting about me that you keep asking? I'm just a kid racer.
Sure, but you signed up, didn't you? If you've got any experience you probably know everything I'd tell you anyway.
Yeah, yeah, follow your dreams. Just answer my questions, kid.
No need to get like that. I don't have any track time coming up anyway.
You're running some great races out there. You beat mine, anyway. I'll be that good someday.
New swoop jocks like me don't get much respect. Just takes practice, I guess.
Wow, you're pretty good. I mean, I'm just a swoop-kid starting out, but you blew past my time easy.
I hear you are moving up. I'll be that good, someday.
You are crazy-fast, you know that? I saw your races and... well, I'm just amazed. What do you need?
Hi again. Something I can do for you? I'm just waiting for a crack at the track.
What do you want? Nothing from me, that's for sure. Take a walk.
I can't stop to talk to tourists - I'm on kolto packing duty.
Hey - I'm working here! Go talk to the diplomatic rep if you got something to say.
The Selkath have scaled back all kolto harvesting - but nobody is saying why. Good thing we've been stockpiling this stuff for the past year.
I must give you my thanks. Because of you, I am once again welcome within the Jedi Order.
Have you spoken to the Council?
I have spoken to the Council, and they have helped me see the truth. The truth about myself, and the truth of my actions.
Quatra's injuries were not so severe as I first believed. I was foolish to believe I could harm a Master such as she with my... my clumsy efforts.
The fierce confrontation between us was nothing more than a part of my training. Quatra wanted me to understand the threat of the dark side, to see how easy it was to fall from the path of light.
That's pretty harsh...

Quatra's methods may seem strange, but I trust her wisdom. This lesson has been difficult, but I am better because of it. Humility is never easy to teach, but now I truly understand my own limitations.
You can't expect everything to get handed to you on a silver platter.
After our last battle, Quatra had nothing left to teach me. I needed time alone to explore the turmoil of my own spirit. Only then was I ready to follow a guide - you - back to the light.
When I left, Quatra knew her work with me was done. There are other disciples who need training throughout the galaxy, and she could not stay to see if I passed this most difficult trial.
With your help, I have passed this difficult trial. The Council now feels I am ready to continue with my training, though they have asked me to wait here for the time being.
Hey, I'm glad to see you're not getting hung up on all this. The past is in the past, you know?
First the Jedi trick you into becoming an enemy, then they welcome you back as a friend. I can't say I approve of their training methods.
You have been given another chance to prove yourself. I hope you use it well.
Giving you a second chance like this is a clear sign of weakness. Sometimes I find it hard to believe the Jedi could defeat my people in battle.
This has been a painful lesson, Juhani, but it seems you have learned it well. I am certain you will be a credit to the Order.
I do not know what the Council has in store for me, but I will trust in the Force and the way of the Jedi to help me through whatever is to come.
So where is Quatra now?
The ways of the Jedi are strange indeed.
Did you learn anything more about Quatra?
I'm just glad I could help.
New face, new face... always new face here! On my world only the strong become trackers. Here everyone is bounty hunter!
You new here, take advice. Stay off my contracts!
Davik up to something. He bring famous bounty hunter Calo Nord in for a special assignment. Calo no work cheap.
You must speak with our Guide if you wish to perform the ritual now.
You... are one of the Sith from the academy, yes? Would you happen to be looking for new prospects?
So you're already part of the academy. I am unimpressed.
You... you have a medallion!
So? What does that mean?
Why would you ask that? The Sith who gave you that must have mentioned that it represented your acceptance. All you have to do is bring it to Yuthura Ban at the cantina and you're in!
Might you have any advice for me? How did you obtain it?
Forget it. You'll never be worthy.
I see. Well, keep your secrets to yourself, then. I'll find a way.
You just have to keep trying, I guess.
So you're not going to tell me. *sigh* I suppose I really didn't expect you to.
Let's just say I didn't get this in the normal way.
So there *is* a secret to it. I knew there had to be!
Would you tell me what it is? I'll do anything to know!
[Persuade] You don't want to go through the academy. Trust me. Go home.
Too bad that's exactly where we're headed.
[Success] I... but... oh, you're right. It's hopeless.
*sigh* I... I guess I should go home. Perhaps I could get a job at the droid shop...
[Failure] My family couldn't talk me out of this, and you sure aren't going to. Thanks anyway.
[Persuade/Lie] You have to attack one of the Sith for it.
[Success] Oh. I'm not much of a combatant... but I guess you have to be brave if you're going to get into the Sith, right? I'll... have to think about it.
[Failure] That sounds like it would be suicide. You are obviously lying to me.
[Persuade] Take it from one of the other students, of course.
[Success] Hmm... I suppose that might work. A newly accepted student wouldn't have all the powers of the other Sith, would they? Thank you!
[Failure] Take a medallion that doesn't belong to me? I doubt that would work. But thank you regardless.
[Persuade/Lie] You must show your bravery by jumping in the chasm.
That is murder, and this young person is not even a Sith!
If a Sith told you to go jump off a cliff, would you?
That is beside the point.
[Success] R-really? *gulp!* That... that sounds like it's very dangerous. You survived it, though... maybe it isn't so bad...
[Failure] Jump in the chasm? Do I look like an idiot? No thanks.
You should not do this. Taking advantage, even of a Sith, leads to the dark side.
Forget it. I'll be going, now.
I'll be on my way.
May the Force serve you well.
Alright. Goodbye.
That's right. Got a problem with that?
No. You're very lucky, that's all I meant.
It's mine and you're not getting it.
I doubt I could take it from you if I tried. Good luck in your training, I suppose.
Get out of my way.
Oh... yes. Sorry.
What do you want?
Who are you?
I'm trying to get into the Sith academy. Around here they call us 'hopefuls'.
Why would you want to get into the academy?
Well... that's the only way to become a Sith, isn't it? In the academy you learn to use the Force.
Why not join the Jedi?
After the Sith conquer the galaxy there aren't going to be any more Jedi, are there? I guess I'd rather join the winning side.
What do you think your chances are?
I thought they were good... but I've been here for days, now, and I haven't drawn any attention at all.
I suppose that might be good, I don't know. Some of the 'attention' the Sith have shown to other hopefuls has been pretty... deadly.
How does someone get into the academy?
*sigh* I wish I knew, to tell you the truth. You have to impress one of the Sith, I guess. Either way, it's Yuthura Ban who makes the final decision.
She's a Twi'lek Sith master, I hear. Very high rank. She's the one who decides which hopefuls make it and which ones don't.
Where is this Yuthura Ban?
I really couldn't say. I hear that sometimes she comes out into the colony to drink at the cantina, though, but I guess she could be anywhere.
Can I ask you some questions?
There's not much I could tell you. Unless you're a hopeful... are you?
What do you mean?
There are people who come here all the time to try to get into the Sith academy. I'm one of them.
I saw what you did! You gave those journals to Igear! Now we'll never find the promised land! How could you do that, you monster!
Just get away from me! I don't want to speak to you again!
Go on, you two! Get out of here! I'm sorry about that... those two beggars give everyone in the village a bad name! We aren't all like that, you know. Most of us are good people.
My name's <FullName>. Who are you?
My name is Shaleena... you're from the up-world, aren't you? I've... I've never seen it. I was born here in the Undercity. Is it as nice as they say up there?
The surface is a beautiful place.
I've never been to the surface, but sometimes I think I can see it in my dreams. The sun, the sky, the stars... it all sounds so... so... so wonderful.
Gendar, the leader of our village, tells me I should spend more time trying to improve things down here and less time dreaming about something I can never have. Maybe he's right.
You probably think I'm a fool, having dreams of a place I've never even seen. But when I was little, Rukil used to tell me stories of what it was like up there.
Rukil? Who's that?
Rukil's the oldest man in the village. The kids call him Rukil Wrinkle-Skin, but he's a kind man. He used to tell me the greatest stories when I was a little girl.
I still like to listen to his tales about the Promised Land, even though I know they're just legends. But it helps to make the Undercity seem less... less dark, somehow.
The Promised Land? What's that?
It's... it's just a story to make little children smile. Rukil believes in it, though. Sometimes I can almost believe it myself, but then I look around and I see the ugly truth.
*sigh* I guess we have to make the best of what we have though. If you really want to learn more about the promised land you should speak to Rukil.
Where can I find Rukil?
He's wandering around somewhere on the south side of the village. He doesn't move too far... it's hard on his bones. He's over 100 years old!
The children laugh at him and people think he's crazy because of his stories about the Promised Land, but he's really just a kind old man.
I want to ask you some questions.
You'd probably get more information from Gendar, the village leader. Or maybe Rukil. But I'll tell you whatever I can.
Where can I find Gendar?
He'll be somewhere in the village. I couldn't say where for sure. He's always busy, doing whatever he can to make the lives of the other villagers easier.
I'll be going now.
Oh... okay. Well, if you ever need anything, or if you just feel like talking, come back and see me. I hardly ever get a chance to speak to someone from the up-world.
Do you know anything about the escape pods that crashed into the Undercity?
I don't know anything about that, but maybe Gendar could help you. Sorry... is there anything else you need?
Have any other up-worlders come through here recently?
There were quite a few people from the surface marching through the village, but none of them bothered to talk to me. Gendar might know more about them.
Tell me about this village.
Well, I was born here for starters. My parents were Outcasts, banished to the Undercity for some crime or other... they never really liked to talk about it.
Everyone here is an Outcast... or the descendant of one. It's tough down here, but we survive. I guess it's easier for me, since I've never known anything different.
Some of the people have given up all hope; they've become bitter and depressed. But most of us are good people... despite what our ancestors may have done.
Gendar could probably tell you more. Or maybe Rukil. You could talk to them if you want.
I don't have time for this.
Of course... I'm sorry. You're probably here for something important, right? You probably want to speak to Gendar. He's the leader of our village.
But if you... if you have time later, maybe you could come back and speak to me again. I don't get much chance to talk with people from the surface.
It's nothing special.
Not to you, I suppose. But you're probably used to its beauty by now.
It's better than this festering slime pit.
I... I suppose our world doesn't look like much to you. It's dark and cold and lonely down here - but this is the only world I've ever known.
What do you want?
I saw you talking with Rukil. It's nice of you to help him; though I don't want to get my hopes up. I mean, the Promised Land... how could it be true?
It's just that sometimes Rukil seems so certain. And then you show up, just like the up-world savior from the legends... If Rukil's right this could be a whole new life for the village!
No more rakghoul attacks, no more starvation... *sigh*, I shouldn't get my hopes up. Not yet. But... but I will wish you good luck, on behalf of the entire village.
Hello, again. I'm glad you came back... it's kind of neat to speak to someone from the surface world. Is there anything I can do for you?
I heard what you did out on the dunes. I am impressed. I'd never have thought a tenderfoot like you could bring down a dragon.
Who are you? What is it you do?
My name is Dorak Quinn. I'm a hunter. I hunt. Is that enough, or should I start listing my family birthdays?
Where is the best hunting?
Why don't *you* tell me? You've killed a dragon. Me, I just make do hunting desert wraid. And there's not many of those even left.
Why are there fewer wraid?
It used to be a one-on-one test, hunter against hunted. Now, people just want the credits.
I could stomach maybe a pair, or a team of hunters, but some now use battle droids! Where is the sport in that?
Who uses battle droids?
Nobody now. A cruel end, but a necessary one. I will speak no more of it.
How long have you been at this?
I've tracked wild beasts my whole life, but I've only been hunting here for five years. I've much to learn yet.
What do you want to learn?
I want to learn how hunters like you find the big kills. Not that I'd survive hunting a dragon, but it would be a fine battle.
I suppose I just need time and experience. I'll get better. That's my challenge.
What can you tell me about the other hunters?
I don't go telling stories about other people. You want to know what they think, you go talk to them.
Although I don't hold out much hope for you surviving. I heard how you gave in to the Gamorreans.
You won't last long on this planet. You just aren't cut out for it.
Let's go back to my first questions.
If that's what you want. I'm not sure what you hope to get out of me, though.
You said you are a hunter. I want to ask about that.
Again? Well, if you want to waste your day, that's your business, I guess.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
You'll have to ask around. Komad Fortuna is a much more experienced hunter than I am... he hunts far from Anchorhead.
The local Jawas are a good source of information, even if it is hard to understand them. It may cost you, though.
Where is this Komad?
If he's not here in Fazza's, he's probably out wandering the desert. I don't know how you'd find him out there.
Seems like he knows the desert as well as Jawas and Sand People. He doesn't say much about it though.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
See you around. Good luck.
Good hunting.
You'll show me respect! I demand it!
Easy now, I'm not looking for a fight. This is a friendly place to gather. You... you're kidding, right?
[Force Persuade] Leave. Now.
[Success] [He goes white, as though suddenly very cold. It is clear that leaving just became the most important thing in his mind.]
How about you pay me to leave you alone.
What? Fine, fine, take some cred's. It just isn't worth fighting over. Happy now? Better be.
Every ship that lands brings a new hotshot. I don't have the time.
Maybe I'm tired of your face. Maybe I'll remove it!
Easy now, come on! Look, I don't want any trouble. I'll just leave, all right? Don't worry about me.
Sure, just kidding you. But you be careful...
This really isn't worth the headache. How about I just leave. Here, take my seat.
You seem pretty prepared to hold your own with most of them. I heard what happened with the Gamorreans.
Good work with them. I think you'll do just fine around here.
Ah, one word though. Watch yourself around the Gamorreans. Gurke and his buddies aren't to be trusted.
Everyone else I respect because they have skill. Those guys... they go for easier prey.
What makes you say that?
Just watch your back when you hunt. The dragons aren't the only dangers out there.
There are hunters that go after the big kills, the krayt dragons. I don't know how they do it. I never even see the things.
Komad is the one I respect, but I also trust that the only difference between us is experience. I will learn.
Nobody, now that Tanis quit. You had something to do with that, didn't you? Good for you.
That's not for me to say. I won't be a troublemaker in so small a community. You will see. Hunt, and you will see.
If I knew the best place, why would I tell anyone? It would be worth too much to me to let it get out.
It doesn't matter, anyway. This season has been dry for me, as it has for almost everyone.
Perhaps someone else is holding out, but there are simply fewer wraid out there.
Get lost, tenderfoot. I hunt desert wraid, I don't babysit.
Come now, I just want to benefit from your experience.
You swoop types don't usually listen to what anyone says. Why bother me?
Well, you sure know how to get on my good side. You're just trotting out bantha pats, but thanks all the same.
It's just as well. You probably couldn't teach me anything.
Hoping to goad me into talking a bit? All right, what do you want?
Why are you here, swoop-head? Hunting doesn't give your kind the instant thrills you need, does it?
Hmm? You know, I don't have that much to tell you. You really have to get out on the dunes for yourself.
I'm done with you. Go bother someone else.
Who's there? You're not Selkath, I can see that much. Are you another rescue crew?
I am <FullName>. The Republic sent us down to investigate.
Oh, I'm a merc the Republic hired a couple days ago to investigate - but all we found was a bunch of insane Selkath killing everything that moves!
All my companions are dead. The Selkath swarmed over us - there were dozens of them! And they...they looked wrong, somehow. Like something had changed inside them. Insane or something...
Changed inside them? Yes... this whole place feels wrong, somehow.
Oh, I'd have gone back to the surface long ago if this complex hadn't been overrun by all those crazy Selkath! There's no way for me to get to the submarine docking bay.
What are you doing in the underwater section of the facility?
I discovered a way to get to the bay and seal off the rest of the base. I just have to find the kolto harvester they built on the edge of the Hrakert rift.
It's got an emergency override to open the doors to the submarine docking bay and I could get in from the outside.
I figured my only chance was to slap on an environment suit, head out onto the ocean floor and check that harvester out for myself.
Besides, it's got to be safer out on the ocean floor than back in there with all those crazed Selkath mutants running around looking for dinner.
Okay, I'll come with you.
I'm not spending another minute in this facility - not with those psychotic fish people all over the place!
Psychotic fish just don't try to dodge as much.
I'm heading out to the ocean floor right now - it leads to another complex of buildings. Going through them is the only way to reach the kolto harvester.

We should probably stick together, but I won't wait around in here with the Selkath. You can catch up with me if you want - down the hall and through the doors on the right. I'll be waiting on the ocean floor where it's safe.
You wait here - I'll go check it out.
I still need to investigate...
They looked wrong? Hmmm... this whole place smells wrong. Like an Urellian urgoth egg gone bad in the hamper.
Doesn't smell so bad to me, old man.
Must be those reliable and finely tuned senses of yours, mercenary.
What's going on down here?
Isn't it obvious - the Selkath have gone insane! They're killing everything that moves!
Who are you?
Come on - what's taking you so long? We have to cross the ocean floor to reach the buildings that lead to the kolto harvester.
Besides, it's a lot safer out here. No Selkath looking to make a meal out of us.
Well, a fresh face for the game. I wonder, would you care to play? My name is Furko Nellis. My vice is Pazaak.
Okay, let's talk Pazaak.
Ha ha! Very good! Would you... care to wager on a game?
I'll play. What is the wager?
Well... you have proven quite the opponent, but I think the time has come to end this. You will not win again.
I usually only use this deck at tournaments, but I think you're worthy of it. Shall we say... 500 credits on the outcome?
Bring it on.
Yes... well then, 500 credits on the line. Heh... here we go.
I can't pay that.
That is unfortunate. Please, feel free to return when you can. I'm sorry, but I prefer the thrill of the payoff.
I've changed my mind.
All right, but remember that there isn't much fun on Tatooine that isn't life threatening. Come back if you'd like a game.
Hmm... you have some rudimentary skills. I think I'll use my second best deck this time and up the stakes.
200 credits will be the wager. I trust you will have the money on hand?
You're on. Let's have at it!
You won't be so eager in a moment. I promise you.
Well, since you have never beaten me, we'll make this for a paltry 50 credits. No bargaining now. This is serious.
To be fair, I'll use my practice deck as well. I don't want to scare you off, you understand.
Let's go.
Ha ha! Very good. Now, don't worry if I beat you too harshly. It is a learning experience.
I don't have a Pazaak deck.
No? That's unfortunate. I happen to have one that I could sell you, but it's a little basic. Certainly not tournament worthy.
Here, how about you give me... 100 credits. A fine deal. Not many stores sell... equipment of this nature.
100 credits will be fine.
Very good, I'll just take that, and here you are. Now you should practice. Care to play?
Brief me on the rules.
Of course, it is always good to keep them fresh in your mind. I'd be glad to go over the delicacies of the game with you.
[Play Pazaak Tutorial]
I'll be going now.
[Persuade] Come now, you'll make your credits back by playing me.
[Success] Hmm... perhaps you are right. I want new people to get a good start on the game. I need opponents.
Besides, it is a very basic deck. All right, it's yours. Now, care to have a game or two?
[Failure] I'm afraid I really can't do that. The cards have their value. I can't change it.
I can't pay that right now. Maybe later.
[Force Persuade] You don't want to charge me for it.
[Success] You know what... I don't want to charge you for it. I want new players to take up the game.
I want to ask you some questions.
Ah, I'm sure you do, but I won't have answers. I leave other people to their business, and they leave me to mine.
Really, you'll have to seek information elsewhere, but if you want some recreation, I've cards ready to play.
You must have an opinion about what happened on Taris.
Must I? An opinion would draw attention to myself. The Sith have shown what happens to things that draw their attention.
Would you like to have another round of Pazaak?
However, you'll understand if we don't have any wagers. I... respect your ability too much to insult you by betting on you losing.
All right, let's have a game.
Very good. Just for the sport of it. That's all I can afford.
I want to ask you about something else.
Something else? I don't think I know about much else. Pazaak is all that I do, right now. I'm sorry.
Ask around, I'm sure there are many better sources of information than me.
Right. Goodbye.
Stop by anytime. I'd like to visit my money.
Ah, you did have two promising wins. Would you care to try and take your money back?
I don't want to say that your single win was a fluke. Perhaps you would like to play again?
I don't want to sour you on the game. Perhaps another small wager game?
Ahh, you are back. I hope I didn't scare you off with that loss. Hard blow, but that's the nature of the cards.
Ah, it's you again. Truly, you are a fine opponent. I'd be honored to play you again.
Hello again. Would you like to have another round of Pazaak? I'd like to try and win back my money.
It's only fair, after all. You have won against me twice, but I still think I can teach you a thing or two.
I mean, I don't want to say that it was beginner's luck, but you should play again to truly get a feel for the game.
Hello again. Could I tempt you into a game? There's very little else to do that won't potentially leave you dead.
Are you here to mock me as the Sith, or do you actually want to buy something?
I'm not here to make fun of you. I'm <FullName>.
Please, forgive me. I had no cause to be so rude to you. The Sith make such trouble for me and business has been slow.
But that is no excuse for my tone. I apologize. Please, let us start off on the right foot.
Welcome to the used goods store of Yortal Ixlis. If there is anything I can help you with, all you need to do is ask.
I'd like to look at your inventory.
Of course, human. My stock is all second hand, and some of it has minor damage.
But with the repairs I have done to them, my items are as good as new - for a fraction of the price.
I'd like to ask you some questions.
I fear I will be of little help in providing information, human. I spend most of my time here in my shop or out collecting inventory.
And at night, I am too exhausted to do anything but return home and sleep in preparation for the next day.
I will do my best to answer your questions, but I cannot promise to be of much help.
Do you know why the Republic is hiring mercenaries?
I cannot say. Perhaps the Republic is preparing for a battle with the Sith. They are at war, after all.
And I wish the Republic a quick and total victory. My own life will be much easier once the Sith have been defeated and destroyed.
I have some more questions for you.
I think I'll be going now.
As you wish, human. Should you ever find yourself in need of quality used merchandise I urge you to return to my establishment.
Are the Sith involved in the recent disappearance of the Selkath youth?
I have no proof that they are, yet it would not surprise me. The Sith are evil to the core.
My own experiences with the Sith have been most unpleasant. They come and mock me, and damage my goods. But I cannot take action against them, or they would surely kill me.
I'm investigating the Sunry case.
I know nothing of this trial, though I find the facts hard to accept. Sunry was a famous hero of the Republic - hardly the type to commit murder.
I would not be surprised to learn the Sith have framed the poor man in an effort to embarrass the Republic. The Sith have no conscience in such matters.
I'm looking for some ancient ruins, or possibly some type of Star Map.

I know of no such thing in Ahto City. This is the only city on Manaan suited to non-Selkath. The oceans are the ancestral home of their people. If there are any ancient ruins of their culture, they would lie there.
How did you come to run a junkpile... er... used goods shop?
Ah. Yes. That. Well, I was not always in such dire straits. In fact, once I would have been quite well off, but the Sith had other plans.
Well, technically my debt is to the Czerka Corporation, but that amounts to the same thing in the end.
You owe them money?
Yes, my debt to them is quite large I fear, and it will be no easy task to repay it.
I need money to pay them off, but I cannot find work anywhere the Czerka Corporation has influence. So they put me here, fixing scraps and selling them for little profit.
In time, in years I may be able to repay my debt, but for now I must work. Is there anything else I may help you with?
How did you get in debt?

I was quite a hand at electrical and mechanical devices of all sorts. I traveled the galaxy working for hire among all sorts of beings. But one day I failed in a task for a Czerka Corporation executive and was forced into debt.
What does that have to do with running a junk shop?
I'm interested in buying something.
Maybe I'll come back when you're in a better mood.
With an attitude like that, it's no wonder you have no customers!
I suppose I deserve that. But you'd be bitter too, if the Sith kept coming in and making fun of you and your inventory!
Let us forget this unpleasantness and start our meeting over, yes?
Watch your tone, or you'll be looking for some replacement limbs!
Welcome, human. While I am not one to condone violence, I find it extremely pleasing that someone has finally stood up to the Sith and dealt with them in their own Embassy!
I doubt they will be driven from the planet, but any harm they suffer brings me joy. So, what can I do for you on this joyous day, human?
Come in human, please. The Selkath have been very sensitive lately. I believe something has happened between them and the Republic, but I am not certain.
Certainly, though, with the new tension, business has dropped off a bit. Please, what can I do for you today?
Welcome, human. Please come in. Today is a good day for me. I have heard the Sith will face severe penalties for their plot to corrupt the Selkath youth.
I doubt they will be banned from the planet, but any penalty they suffer brings me joy. So, what can I do for you on this joyous day, human?
Welcome, come in. I have heard you are a swoop racer, and swoop racers always have money to spend. My favorite customers.
Whatever you desire, you will find it here at Yortal's secondhand shop. So what can I do for you, friend?
The Sith and their Czerka Corp. dogs have been driven off Kashyyyk I was told. Good riddance I say! If only we could do that here...
Is there anything you need help with?
The Sith fight amongst themselves constantly, even their masters. I heard that happened on Korriban, but none of the Sith are talking about it.
Come in human, please. I need all the customers I can get. Since kolto production dropped the Ahto City authorities have increased my business taxes tenfold to make up the shortfall!
I am loathe to leave this planet, but I fear I cannot long afford to continue business under these circumstances. What is it you need, human?
You there! How is it that you are leaving Naga Sadow's tomb by yourself? You went for your final test, didn't you? Where is Master Uthar?
Master Uthar is dead. I killed him.
What? You... but you aren't even a Sith, yet! Surely you jest!
I'm not a Sith at all, actually. Now move aside.
It... it's a spy! Quick, to arms!
But... if the spy was able to kill Master Uthar...
Don't be such a coward! Kill the traitor! Do it now!!
I can kill you just as easily, fool.
You lie!
But... what if Master Uthar is really dead? How can we hope to stand up against someone who could kill him?
Don't be a sniveling coward! I will prove this one a spy... and if Uthar is dead, *I* shall become the new master!!
Not a Sith? I have killed the master, and now the academy is mine.
[Persuade] Did I say dead? He's, uh, sick. You should check on him.
[Failure] You lie!
Look... I don't need any trouble here, alright?
Well, you've found it! If you've done anything to Master Uthar, you're going to pay for it!
Just stand aside and you won't get hurt. Got it?
Alright, you caught me. Time to die.
[Persuade] I am Revan. I have killed the master. You must bow down before me.
[Failure] You lie! You could never have killed the master!!
I am not lying, fool. Do you wish me to show you?
You are not Revan! Quick, attack the traitor!!
But... even if it's not Revan... what if Master Uthar is actually dead? Someone who could kill the master...
If Master Uthar is dead, then he was a weak fool! Now attack! *I* shall be the new Dark Lord of Korriban!!
This is your last chance. Bow down or die.
You doubt the Dark Lord Revan? Ha ha! Most amusing.
[Persuade] I don't know what you're talking about.
You have helped us at last! Finally we shall be able to reclaim our past!
You promised to help us last time, Revan. I hope that you live up to your word.
The work of our people must go on... to preserve our future.
The Council thinks you may help us... I hope that they are right.
The keeper of our history can help you if there is anything you wish to know.
I wish that we could fully trust you after your long absence, Revan... but I do not know if we can.
We are not shipping kolto right now, human, and escpecially not to you! You will leave here now, or I will be forced to call Security.
Your actions have threatened our world and our way of life. You are not welcome in this place, human, no matter what you have arranged with our leaders.
You have endangered the Sith Embassy, and I shall not let you endanger our shipping as well! Leave here now, or I will be forced to call Security.
I cannot sell you kolto unless you show me your purchase permit.
I just want some information.
I am not here to answer your questions, off-worlder. I am a distributor of kolto - the lifeblood of the Manaan economy.
Either show me your purchase permit, or leave me in peace.
I don't have a permit.
Then why are you here, human? Are you seeking employment? We do not hire your kind here.
Do you even have an off-worlder work permit? I thought not. I suggest you visit the courthouse in the district to the west, off-worlder. There is nothing for you here.
Where can I get a purchase permit?
One does not simply 'get' a purchase permit! Such permits are brokered between intergalactic governments and the Ahto City Export Authority.
We do not sell unrefined kolto by the handful - we sell it by the ton! Go to a store if you wish to purchase kolto for personal use.
I'll be going now.
Good - I am far too busy to converse with the likes of you.
Do you even have an off-worlder work permit? I thought not. There is nothing for you here.
You're only as good as your last race. Remember that.
I was cheering for you. I hope I didn't jinx your race.
Your last race was a disappointment. Lose many more and the crowd will turn on you.
You'll have to do better than that if you want to be sector champion.
It's amazing what's been happeing on the track! Queedle has taken the top spot!
I always cheered Queedle before, and I guess it helped! He's beaten everyone!
Queedle has really improved out there. He was always my favorite.
Everyone thought Queedle couldn't compete because he was just a local racer, but he's shown them all.
I was down here last week and I got Casandra Mateil's autoprint. She doesn't do that very often.
You'll have to get in line for the good seats when the races start. There's a lot of people that want to see them.
Sure the swoop circuit is suffering a bit with Taris gone, but we still have some good racers to watch.
Have you been to the swoop races before? Some of these riders are sure full of themselves.
I sure hope you're staying here. Beating the first round has made you look pretty good to the crowd.
You're not bad for a beginner. It's almost like you've competed at this level before.
You won't have such an easy run in the second round. We get some experienced riders through here.
Not bad at all, but I'll start cheering when you prove you're not just using beginner's luck.
Some of the crowd may turn on you. You're not the underdog anymore.
You're surprising a lot of people. Me included. Nice job out there.
If you win again, I'll be absolutely amazed. You are moving up so fast.
Nice race. How do you go so fast? Are you sure your swoop is legal?
Well, you've captured the sector championship. I have to say I've never seen such an... impressive racer.
I didn't think you had it in you, but I guess I was wrong. You've really won me over, champion.
You handled that race like a pro. I like confident men.
Racers like you are why I watch the sport. You dominated the whole field. It was... exhilarating.
Ha. I've never seen anyone who rides like you. This has been a great tournament.
You're deadly serious out on the course. Like Hukta Jax, but with talent. You deserve to be champion.
Your win was a complete surprise to everyone. I'm sure the crowd thought you would burn out, but you showed them.
The crowd really started pulling for you in that last race. Everyone loves a winner, I guess.
I do my job and keep my mouth shut. Maybe I can do some good if I stay out of people's way.
There is so much to learn about this planet, but they keep us cooped up in here.
The payoff from research is too much of a risk for Czerka to spend much money on it. Slaves are proven commodities.
I think Czerka is missing an opportunity here. The forest could teach us so much.
Local fauna is amazing. If I could isolate why the trees grow so big, it would be worth more than a thousand Wookiee slaves.
Our work here could be very important if any effort was put into it.
I've got enough trouble without dealing with you. Leave me alone.
What do you want? You here for money? I'll pay the Hutt what I owe as soon as the circuit is back on its feet.
Wait, I know you. You slaughtered my second tier time out on the track. It's like you're trying to steal from me.
I've a few things I wanted to ask. Spare a moment?
I've got nothing but time now that you've pushed me back to the slow times. Make it quick.
I want to ask about you and racing.
There's not much useful you'll get out of me. Yuka Rill is on the way down. I can't match the young riders.
Is this the best place for racing?
I'd better hope so. It's the last stop for me. If I can't get some decent times going, I may as well not leave.
I wish I could use the destruction of Taris as an excuse, but I doubt I would have ever made it back there.
Why have racers come here?
Old guys like me can't make it on the good tracks, and the new racers come here to try and knock us down even further.
I'm still trying to have one last good run... but it just isn't happening.
How long have you been at this?
Too many years. I've raced on almost every track and all I've got to show for it is an aging bike.
No good memories? That seems a waste.
I've got a few trophies stashed, but they don't pay the bills. Yep, I should have quit after the Coruscant Classic.
What can you tell me about the other racers?
Bunch of babies, all of them. Well, except for Zoriis. She's got the goods like I never had. Good for her, I guess.
If I have to say something good about the new racers, it would be about that Nico kid. He's got a future.
What makes you say that?
He doesn't fear the track. You get old, you start to worry about failing. He just lets it all come to him.
What do you think about that?
Some promoter will use him up, and he'll end up in debt like me. It's already happening, I bet.
Let's go back to my first questions.
I suppose. Make it quick.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
I don't know. Go ask some locals. I want to know as little about this dustbowl as possible.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
Yeah, good riddance.
Maybe you were right. Maybe I want money.
You don't look like anyone I owe. Stop fooling with me.
[Force Persuade] Your only purpose is to amuse me. Get out.
[His head tails twitch nervously. You are obviously not the type of person he wants to risk angering. Still, he tries to seem strong as he leaves.]
I'm not waiting for you to lose your temper around me. It's not worth it.
[Persuade/Lie] There's a bounty on you, and I mean to collect it.
[Success] I should have known those loans would catch up to me. Never get your bike fixed in Hutt Space.
Here, this is everything I have. Now just leave me to figure out how I'm going to pay for track time.
[Failure] What do you take me for, an idiot? I'm not handing money to just anyone.
Show some respect! I could kill you where you stand!
Wait, I don't want a fight. All right, if you want some money, I'll give it to you. I don't need you in my face like this.
Never mind. I didn't mean anything by it.
Go on, I've seen your type before. Go push the kids around. They don't put up much of a fight.
[Force Persuade] You know you need to pay me.
[Success] I know I need to pay you. It's obvious my old loans have caught up to me. I knew it would happen.
*whisper* I'm amazed at how many people that works on. The entire galaxy must be filled with weak-minded fools.
*whisper* The Force should not be used for profit and personal gain. As Jedi we should be above such things.
A Jedi should not use the Force for personal gain. We are better than that.
I'm no Jedi, but are you really supposed to be using the Force for things like this?
And that Nico is going places, thanks to you. Wish I had someone like you at my back years ago.
But what do you care about this? I heard how you roped Nico into his new deal. He'll be just like me real soon.
You've heard all I have. If I had more, I'd use it to win, not tell you.
If I say no you'll probably hound me to death. Fine, what do you want?
Why can't you new racers just go learn the track for yourselves? Why would I want to help you beat my times?
Just answer my questions and I'll leave you alone.
I can hope, anyway. Just get it over with.
Wait, no, I recognize you. You're some new racer. Get lost. I don't need more of you on my tail.
No, wait, you don't look like a collector. You're just some kid. Go on, I don't have time for you.
You new racers only want two things from old pros: money and advice. My advice? Leave me alone.
Oh, it's you. You buried my best time on the track. What, are you *trying* to take money out of my pocket?
You again? Come to rub my face in your times? You are practically stealing my paycheck every race you run.
You again? Why don't you go bother someone else. It's not like I owe you money or something.
Greetings, fellow Sith. We may fight alongside one another one day.
If what you say about the Sith is true, prove it! Until then we have no evidence of the crimes you accuse them of!
No offence, but I could have done better than you on that last race. As a true fan, I know how to do these things right.
You didn't look too good out there on that last run. I guess everyone has their bad days.
You sure you're cut out for this league of racing? Maybe the stress of it is getting to you.
I don't believe it! Who'd have thought Queedle had it in him?
A new Champion! And it's Queedle! I knew he could do it with a decent swoop under him.
How about that? Queedle, a local racer, showing those pros how it's done!
I cheer for Queedle now that he's winning. It would take an amazing racer to win me away.
You here to cheer Casandra? She's a fine racer. I hope she knocks Hukta out of the running.
Hukta Jax is insane. He just smashes through everything to the finish. I guess we should expect that from a Gamorrean?
We need more rules about overpowered bikes. Hukta just rides over everything. It's boring watching him.
Queedle is the local favorite. You should cheer along with us. He needs the encouragement.
You're pretty good. Maybe I should start putting some credits on your races.
I guess you've got what it takes to advance. The odds against you winning are getting better.
The second round always has experienced riders. You'll be up against some tough times.
You're up against the second round times now. That's a hard round to beat.
Some of the racers are having a bad time here on Manaan. Seems like you have all the luck right now.
Some of the other fans didn't think you could reach the second round, but I knew you would all along.
Are you sure you're up to challenging the third round time? I mean, you're good, but are you that good?
I'm putting all my credits on you. You're a sure thing.
Whew, that was an exciting time you turned in. Noboby else had a chance.
Good race, Sector Champion. I guess you'll be off to the big tracks, once the circuit is back up.
Wow, I bet you could have won on Taris with times like that. It's a shame we'll never know.
Could I get an autoprint? You've just had the quickest rise to Sector Champion that I've ever seen.
It's amazing what you've accomplished here, and you've done it with such style. I've never met a woman like you.
Who dares to break my meditation? You will pay for interrupting my... wait. I sense the Force is strong with you. Very strong.
Who would have thought a Force Adept could be found on this insignificant planet? But your talent is no match for a disciple of the dark side!
Turn away from the dark side. It won't lead you to anything but destruction.
Spoken like a true drone of the Jedi Council. We Sith, however, have learned to embrace the potential of the dark side. It is what gives us strength!
This meeting is a stroke of luck for me - my master will surely reward me with my lightsaber once I kill you!
You Sith must be brought to judgment for all the blood you have spilled.
You are a fool - this is a new age! The Sith shall be the ones passing judgment now! We are the new order of the galaxy!
I'm going to enjoy gutting you!
Ah, yes... feed the hatred and anger within yourself! Call upon the power of the dark side! But not even that can save you now.
Hello, outsider. I heard of your arrival. I trust you won't cause trouble in our village? We don't want bloodshed.
Do you know who owns this bolt casing?
Hmm... let's see if the family insignia is there. Yes, there it is. This belongs to Jaarak. Er... how did you get it?
I found Jaarak's bolt casing on Rorworr's corpse.
Oh my... that is... very distressing. It definitely seems to suggest that Jaarak helped in Rorworr's death.
I... I can't ignore this. Wait here, outsider. I must address this. I will have Jaarak brought here...
And I hope he can explain this... I really do.
Jaarak... you know why you have been summoned here. As Holder of the Laws, I ask you to explain.
I won't answer. I can't. Worrroznor, must Woorwill be here?
Woorwill has a bond with Rorworr. He is the closest to family that can be found. He is entitled to be here.
