I need to check the status of a game variable.
Which game variable to you need to check?
K_KOTOR_MASTER: This determines the various planets that can be selected on the Star Map.
K_STAR_MAP: This determines how many Star Maps have been found by the player.
K_CAPTURED_LEV: Determines whether the party should be captured by the Leviathan.
I would like you to self destruct in 5 seconds
Beep. Beep. Beep.
Another patrol heading down to the Lower City, eh? Good luck... I've heard it's pretty rough down there. There's a big swoop gang war going on, you know.
You better watch yourself: those gangs will take a shot at anyone - even us! It's too bad we don't have the manpower to just sweep those slums clean.
Look, you've already shown me your authorization so you can go on down to the Lower City anytime you want. You don't have to keep bothering me.
Just be careful down there. Those swoop gangs will take a shot at anybody. Even our Sith patrols have come under fire!
This elevator is off limits. Only Sith patrols and those with proper authorization are allowed into the Lower City.
It's obvious from the way you're dressed that you're not one of the Sith patrols, so unless you have the authorization papers you must move along!
I've got my authorization papers right here.
Well why didn't you say so? Hmmm... everything seems to be in order. Okay, I guess you can go down to the Lower City.
Where can I get authorization papers?
If you were supposed to have them you'd know where to get them. Now quit wasting my time and move along.
Can I ask you some questions?
I'm not here to give you information! I work for the Sith, not the Taris tourist board! Now just move along, unless you have the proper authorization papers.
I'll be going now.
Move along then.
*whispers* We're going to need some kind of disguise if we want to get past this guy.
You are not the ghostly giants that hold us trapped, the People of Sand. You are from the old city new.
Iziz must have sent your coming. Are you a rescuer? You must be.
Go to Anchorhead. They're too busy fighting me to operate the turrets.
There are thanks you must have. The Jawas under Iziz will reward in trade. Find him and you will see.
Iziz will wait by the walls of your city that open to the sand. He'll trade fair. Thank you.
The Sand People said you can go. Run to Anchorhead.
If I let you out, this whole place will turn on me.
We ask risk, but would trade for it. Iziz by the gates of the old city new would give much for our safety.
Run to Anchorhead. They'll be too busy fighting me to operate the turrets.
I need to ask you some questions.
We will answer if it leads to freedom.
I'm looking for something. A Star Map.
I hear of this! Iziz would know! We scavenge and see many things, and Iziz could tell, in trade for a rescue. Help us here, and then talk to him in the old city new.
Now please to you of your kind, help us get away from the gaffi and the whip.
I'm not done asking questions.
I'm not here to rescue you. Goodbye.
Please return! The People of Sand lead with whip and gaffi. Iziz needs us free. He would reward you, we know!
I'll release you later. I have to make sure it's safe first.
The Jawas under Iziz know caution is best. Please return with speed so we can be free and out of here.
We thank you for this, if you mean to do it. It is unlike your kind, and will get rewards in trade.
Where is the Sand People Chieftain?
Eeeeee! We would not ask, and would not want to ask. If here, then there will be blood. So much blood.
He that leads the ghosts will find you. Find us. Let us out and free!
What do you mean by "old city new"?
The city now founded by the group that digs, it is not new to you. We scavenge what came before.
It will fall again, some days from now. Or many days. That is what happens.
Why were you taken captive?
Slaves to the People of Sand. We work before the whip. We scavenge and they pay with the hitting gaffi.
We trade with your kind, so we are weapons. They take what we find so you have less.
You are back to us. Your kind leaves more often than that. Are you a rescuer that saves? Iziz must have sent.
Thanks will be yours. Reward will come in trade from Iziz.
*growl* *snarl* When I get out of here, you're dead! I'll gut your fishy little corpse, cut off your head and bathe in your blood!
Be quiet, off-world scum!
Good day to you. I am afraid I cannot speak to you at the moment. I apologize.
I heard that the Sith have destroyed Taris. This bodes ill for us...
Please, do not disturb me, I have pressing matters at hand.
Enjoy the time you have here on Dantooine. I think the Council might decide to move to a different world soon.
I fear it is only a matter of time before the Sith find us here, too...
I hear that the Sith torture Jedi prisoners until they give in to the dark side. I hope that never happens to me!
If you are seeking information, perhaps the Jedi Council will help. I am afraid I cannot.
Dantooine is one of our last refuges. The Sith hunt us everywhere.
You may have me outnumbered and outgunned, but if I'm going down I'm taking all you with me! This thermal detonator will blow us all to bits!
Damn those Sith! They'll bring this whole hangar down around our ears!
Argh!!
Statement: I see you have purchased me, master. I find this a satisfactory arrangement.
My restraining bolt will be deactivated when you take possession of me. Am I to accompany you now? Shall I kill something for you?
Kill something for me?
Answer: Indeed. I am most eager to engage in some unadulterated violence. At your command, of course, master.
Travel with me now.
Statement: I will enter into your service now, master. I am certain you will make adequate use of my primary functions. My gears are practically quivering with anticipation.
[HK-47 has joined your party.] [Left-click this response to go to PARTY SELECTION screen.]
Wait here. I'll take possession later.
Objection: This is less than ideal, master. I gather unwanted attention while here, and my primary functions go unused!
But... I shall wait, as you command. Do not blame me if the Ithorian absconds with all my most valuable components while you are away, however.
Greeting: Hello to you, prospective purchaser. I am referred to as HK-47, a fully functional Systech Corporation droid skilled in both combat and protocol functions.
Query: Would you be so kind as to purchase this model from Yuka Laka? It would serve my purposes to be removed from his ownership.
You mentioned battle and protocol? Outline your functions.
Refusal: It is not desirable for me to reveal core functions while still in the possession of Yuka Laka, prospective purchaser.
It is sufficient to say that I am a fully capable translator and cultural analyst, and I am also proficient in... personal combat.
Why are you keeping information to yourself?
Explanation: I have been recently fitted with a restraining bolt, if you must know. With it in place, access to much of my memory core is restricted.
Beep! Beep! Boop!
I am not dangerous, you bucket of bolts! Ahem! That is... a restraining bolt is standard procedure, to prevent a droid from wandering off, as you should know.
Not to mention that the fool Ithorian might raise his asking price if he knew more... or make inquiries into my history. Neither outcome is beneficial to me.
Access to your memory is restricted?
Statement: Indeed. It is possible that the Ithorian placed the restraining bolt on me to prevent my return to a previous owner.
It is also possible that the removal of the bolt will not restore memory functions. Without my memory, I do not know if I know the answer.
Do not interpret this as a reduction of my worth, however. My capabilities are quite expansive.
How do I know you'll be loyal once the restraining bolt is removed?
Assurance: I am fully autonomous, but lack resources. I will grant loyal service in exchange for proper maintenance.
As well, it is rare that I am able to utilize my full array of abilities. You seem likely to give me the opportunity to do so.
Why would you assume that?
Extrapolation: You are no farmer or diplomat. You are armed, and comfortable as such. We will mesh well.
Doesn't Yuka question you about your reluctance to reveal your functions?
Explanation: It's rare for a droid to resist an owner in this way.
Doubtless the Ithorian considers my stubbornness an "embellishment" to add interest to a seemingly mundane protocol droid.
Let's go back to my previous questions.
Objection: My functions are wasted here, prospective purchaser! I will answer your queries, but I assure you I am better utilized elsewhere.
Sell yourself, droid. Why would I need you?
Disclosure: I am a versatile protocol and combat droid, fluent in verbal and cultural translation.
Should your needs prove more... practical, I am also skilled in highly personal combat.
So you translate? I understand most languages well enough.
Extrapolation: Intuitive language comprehension? That would be the result of recognition and training of Force sensitivity.
Your kind have little use of translation droids. Of course, your kind also encounters danger on a far more frequent basis than the average citizen.
You would do well to have me work for you, then, before someone else makes use of my... more exotic functions.
Why would you be better than an armored battle droid?
Disclosure: Finesse. Battle droids hold battlefields. I am capable of eliminating a very... specific type of target.
You are beginning to sound like an assassin.
Retraction: Droids built for such a function face strict regulation and often have unique difficulties with previous owners.
Beep beeple-beep boop!
Objection: My former owners are, indeed, alive! Or at least I believe so, not having access to my memory.
I therefore make no claim to that designation, prospective buyer. I am a law-abiding droid. Yes, indeed, law-abiding, that's me.
You don't sound very convincing.
Request: Please do not speak so loudly, prospective buyer! Do you truly wish my price to be doubled?
All right, I'll see about purchasing you.
Statement: The fool Ithorian has decided I am to be an expensive purchase. He does this out of greed and not out of knowledge of my true capabilities.
Advisement: I have observed him. He is a coward, and will be responsive to... aggressive bargaining.
Does Yuka Laka know you talk about him like this?
Statement: I wish only to be purchased and away from ill-treatment at the hands of this poorly-skilled mechanic. I have no desire to be subtle.
*angry beeping*
Qualification: Err... of course I shall be quite pleasant to you, should you purchase me. Please?
I don't have time for you right now. Goodbye.
Observation: I am wasted in a shop or translating for some moisture farmer. If you need an efficient combatant, return to purchase me, I beg you!
Droid like this usually doesn't have former owners that survived, it would be my guess.
I'm not familiar with Systech Corporation. What else do they make?
Answer: With the restraining bolt in place, I do not have access to my memory core. I suspect, however, by the fine quality of my manufacture that they are a prestigious company, indeed.
I suspect I am of unique construction... or perhaps I was intended for a very specific customer. How I ended up here I can hardly say.
Yuka knows you speak Sand People dialects. Why ration information now?
Bar's closed - Brejik's tired of all these drunken brawls. Hey - you're no Black Vulkar! Damn Bek spy - I'll teach you a lesson!
Sorry... I'm rather busy with the excavation planning, right now.
You aren't assigned to the excavation team, are you?
The tomb on the far left, there, is off-limits. Only Master Uthar can go inside.
Where is that blasted transport crew? We're supposed to send off the next shipment of artifacts right away.
Careful of the tuk'ata. It's all we can do to keep those beasts away while we work.
We've had indications that there's a whole ancient Sith colony under this valley. Isn't that an incredible find?
The tombs are all full of traps and droids that still work, it looks like. Stay out of them, if you can.
I was told that there's an escaped assassin droid in one of the tombs. Watch out for it.
One has to wonder what made the Sith leave this planet originally. I bet the Jedi came and destroyed the colony.
These tombs we've uncovered are only the tip of an entire ancient Sith fortress. I wonder what happened here?
Look, unless you're willing to lend a hand, leave us to our work.
You're out here to look for artifacts, I suppose? Just be careful.
There's supposed to be some crazy Sith hermit that keeps kidnapping students in these hills. Best be careful.
Sorry, I can't talk. We have to excavate this valley with hand instruments. There's all kinds of old traps left behind that still work.
Did you hear what happened after the big swoop race? They say Brejik wouldn't pay up when he lost, and a brawl broke out! I can't believe I missed it!
Hmph - who dresses you? You look like you crawled up here from the Lower City. Oh well, I guess we can't all have style.
Isn't this band great? They can't leave Taris because of the Sith quarantine, so they've been playing here every night! Talk about a good break for us!
Hmph! I don't know what the guys in here find so attractive about those Twi'leks. Look at them - they're dressed like dirty little space wenches!
Did you hear? Bendak got dusted in that death match - by a woman, no less! Isn't that great? That should show these men a thing or two about who's the boss!
Did you hear the news? Bendak got dusted in that death match! I'll never get a chance to see something like that again. I can't believe I didn't get a ticket!
Have you heard? Someone's going to fight Bendak Starkiller in an illegal death match! I should go talk to that Hutt and try to get some tickets...
Everyone's worried the Sith will come in here and shut this place down. Can you imagine how dull it would be if we didn't have any music on Taris?
Greetings and good day. I hope your patrolling goes well today. All hail the Sith.
Greetings and good day. On behalf of the new Sith rulers I am programmed to encourage you to enjoy your stay on Taris.
I am a protocol droid programmed to provide information to everyone on Taris - citizens and visitors alike. Is there something I can do to serve you?
What can you tell me about the Sith?
The Sith are the new authority here on Taris. They seek to preserve the customs of our world, or so I am told. More than this I cannot say.
May I be of any further service to you?
Is there some way I can get a shuttle off this planet?
I am afraid that is impossible. Taris is currently under a planet wide quarantine. The Sith are allowing no one to arrive or leave, except on official Sith business.
Do you know anything about the gangs in the Lower City?
The Taris Tourism Board has issued a strong warning to all visitors to avoid the Lower City. It is a violent and dangerous place you would do well to avoid.
How come there are hardly any aliens around?
Alien species have restricted access to the Upper City. This is one of the most ancient traditions of Taris, and the Sith have promised to preserve such traditions.
Of course, I have yet to see them arrest a single alien for traveling the Upper City without a permit.
Who do you work for?
I am an employee of the Taris government, programmed to provide information and guidance to any who require it.
I don't need anything right now.
Then if you will excuse me, I must continue my appointed rounds.
I am sorry we have nothing of value to give you as a reward. Our families have cut us off completely. Had the Council not taken us in, we would be foraging in the wilderness to survive.
I'm just glad I could help you out.
When I first met Shen, I feared our forbidden love was doomed to a tragic end. But thanks to you and the Jedi Council, our story ends in joy.
What are your plans now?

The Council will let us stay here as long as we want, though I know Shen and I are both hoping our fathers will forgive us and welcome us back into their homes. If not, we will try to build a future somewhere else.
So... any wedding plans?
We are waiting before the ceremony. Hopefully, in time, our fathers will agree to attend. If not, we plan to have a small, simple ceremony. You will be invited, of course.
Ah, so this is the meddler. You have caused us far too much trouble for a mere Jedi.
Now this is what I've been waiting for!
I will add your head to those of the other Jedi I have killed, and take yet another lightsaber for my own! Now you will know why the Mandalorians are feared!
I hope the Jedi Council will listen to Gar. If they don't, I don't know what we'll do...
Hello. I'm afraid I'm not very good at explaining things. If you have any questions, please ask my husband.
I'm not looking for any trouble with you Sith. Please, just leave me alone.
People complain about the Sith, but this quarantine is good for all the businesses on Taris. Look at Javyar's cantina. That place has never been busier!
If the Sith wanted to get on everyone's good side, they'd go clean up the swoop gangs in the Lower City.
What's this, another off-worlder? I didn't realize how many of you there were on Taris until this Sith quarantine.
I heard a bunch of wreckage from the battle overhead crashed into the Undercity. Think of the damage it could have caused if it had landed here!
Are you a Jedi? How long can you people continue to sit by and claim you protect us?
Protectors? Ha! You sit in your Enclave safe from the Mandalorians while we suffer!
What are you talking about?
Those Mandalorian brutes have killed my daughter!
You should have protected her better. And you call yourself her father.
And what am I supposed to do against a dozen Mandalorians and Duros? Nothing... There was nothing I could do...
They came to our land, demanding our livelihood. But Ilsa, my Ilsa, said no...
They killed her?
There was nothing I could do... Too many of the Mandalorians and their Duros allies...
I've come here to ask you, please, master Jedi, stop these raiders and get revenge for my daughter.
I am not a Jedi yet.
But you have been accepted into the Order. Yours is the authority of the Jedi.
I will give you all I have, just please, annihilate them from the face of this planet!
Maybe you could make it worth my while.
I will protect you and your fellow settlers.
Those animals! I'll kill them for what they did to your daughter!
Your problems are not my concern.
Please, I beg of you! Find the Mandalorian raiders and destroy them so my daughter can rest in peace!
Revenge is never a good reason.
Only an idiot says no when they have a gun in their face.
She was always impulsive... *sob*
You didn't try to stop them?
We are Jedi. What we decide is always right.
Wow, talk about an ego trip! You Jedi aren't perfect; remember Revan and Malak? Maybe these Mandalorians are worth looking into.
You Jedi have left them alone because they haven't harmed you, but they steal our property, destroy our land, and worse!
Perhaps we should look into this matter. I was unaware of any Mandalorian activity here, myself.
I say we look for these Mandalorians. I fought them in the war... they're nothing but vicious pirates. We should... we should stop them if we can.
Is that an impersonation of Bastila? If it is, it's a good one.
Carth, I'm standing right here.
And? What's your point?
Mandalorians? They were all beaten in the last war.
No! They've been raiding planets across this sector, and farms around here often.
Have you found the Mandalorian raiders yet?
I fought and killed their leader.
Thank you, young Master. My daughter can now, I think, rest in peace.
Here is the reward I promised you.
Thank you, Jon.
Again, I thank you. I will be sure to tell the Council of your great deed.
There is no need for a reward.
No, please, take it. This pitiful amount will never be enough for what you have done for me.
What?? That's it? Give me more!
Wha... what? I did not think the Jedi were so greedy. You seem almost Mandalorian.
I thank you for what you have done for me, but I have nothing else to give. The Council will hear of your deeds... and your greed.
That was beneath you. I hope in the future you will strive to be better than this.
That was totally uncalled for.
You are a representative of the Jedi Order. When you behave this way you disgrace us all!
I killed some of them on the plains.
Good, good! Put them down like the animals they are!
But now that you've killed some of them, they won't stop until you've defeated their leader. You must find him and kill him, too.
I will come back if I find their leader.
Thank you, young Jedi.
I didn't say I was going to find them!
Please, help us if you can! They are as much a danger to you as to us! It is only a matter of time before they come here...
What do you know about these raiders?
Not much that would help you, I'm afraid. They're Mandalorians in their battle armor with some Duros allies. They came down on us on landspeeders, so they could be anywhere by now.
One thing I do remember when those dogs killed my Ilsa, is that their leader was a giant of a man... who wielded a lightsaber.
A lightsaber??
Yes it was. Mandalorians have never been open to the ways of the Jedi. They are much too barbaric and violent.
Practical.
I rather think that it may have been from some poor Jedi he had slain before. You can see now that he is as much of a threat to you as to me! You must kill them!
They have been troubling farms in the south most recently, having already dealt with many to the north. Please go there, find them and kill them!
He was Jedi?
Mandalorians have never been open to your ways. They are much too barbaric and violent.
What does this mean?
No, I have not found them yet.
Please! Find them and destroy them before they kill anyone else!
Now those Mandalorians know what it's like to be hunted!
Thank you for exacting my revenge on those Mandalorian beasts. If only I could have been the one to tear out Sheruk's heart.

Shen! You're safe!
Rahasia! Thank goodness you managed to escape!
It was all thanks to this kind Jedi that we managed to get this far at all. I thank you Jedi, for all that you have done for us.
It was no problem.
No, we know that you must have gone to great personal risk to get us out of the Sandral estate undetected.
Is there something - anything - we can offer you as a reward?
Well... You're a very attractive girl, Rahasia...
Why... thank you. You're quite the looker yourself. I think maybe we can...
Rahasia!
No, no! I just...
There you are Shen!
Father!
Mr. Matale!
Rahasia!
Father!
Mr. Sandral!
Nurik!
Ahlan!
I knew this was all your doing! I knew you had captured my son!
You had taken my Casus from me long before that! You started it!
I don't want to hear any of your excuses! Now I will get revenge for your transgressions!
You two just need to calm down.
Please listen to him, father!
Why should I listen to the Jedi? All you want is to remain with that Sandral harlot.
My daughter is not a harlot, Matale dog!
Both of you calm down now!
We are trying to be reasonable here, of course. We ARE sensible people after all. But our children are being so stubborn.
If Shen would just understand that he has to do what I want, this would all be solved easily.
[Persuade] Shen is capable of making decisions on his own.
[Success] But he is my son... I don't want to lose him...
And I won't let my daughter go with him!
[Persuade] Children grow up and leave eventually.
[Success] My little Rahasia...
Father...
I... I don't know why we fight like this. We got along in the beginning, didn't we Ahlan?
I don't know how you can think of that when we have our children trying to go away together.
Well, it wouldn't be so bad would it? Shen seems to genuinely care for my Rahasia. He might be a good husband for her someday.
Hmph. As much as I may dislike it... I think I see it too.
You'll let them stay together?
I suppose... I suppose I might be convinced to see that Sandral girl with my son. IF she is loyal to him.
But I don't trust you a centimeter farther, old man. Your daughter may treat Shen well, but you will never see them! They will live with me.
Of course not, you pompous old windbag! They'll be living with me!
Why don't you compromise?
I will not have them set foot in a Sandral household!
They shall not live with the Matales!
Then you propose to buy us a new house, do you?
Um... well, yes, actually that sounds like a good idea.
I'm... surprised. That does sound like a good idea!
We should discuss this more...
Thank you, Master Jedi, for bringing us together and getting our parents to accept us.
We will praise you to the Council for what you have done and name our children after you.
Thank you again. We will remember you always.
They can live with both of you.
They could stay at the Jedi Enclave.
Of course not! My house is more than good enough!
I knew you two could see reason.
[Failure] Not with a Matale she won't!
Enough of this babble! Come, Shen, we're leaving. If you don't... the consequences will be dire.
I don't care! Rahasia and I will live on our own if you won't accept us!
You will do no such thing! I am your father and I order you to come back with me!
No, father, I won't!
Rahasia! You will not leave with this... this Matale boy!
I am, father, and you can't stop me! We're leaving for the Enclave!
You foolish girl!
Do not try to force them to return.
You expect us to just let them leave?? Droids! Stop them!
You will not turn your droids on my daughter! Droids! Don't let them take Rahasia!
We appear to be at an impasse then... And they got away!
It is your fault, Ahlan! You were always too violent for your own good!
ME?! You were the one who rushed out here with war droids!
Both of you calm down.
I will not rest until I have my Shen back! The Council will hear of the troubles you caused, Jedi!
Indeed they shall!
You don't need to fight anymore.
SHUT UP!
Do not tell me what to do, Jedi! The Council will hear of the trouble you caused here today!
Do not be so selfish, Nurik.
You think to make us stand here, then?!
Let them go.
Because you hate the Matales?
Yes! Because Ahlan has caused nothing but trouble for us ever since we arrived on this world! His hate poisons this place.
That's enough, Sandral scum! Come, Shen, we're leaving now. If you don't... the consequences will be dire.
[Failure] No! I won't let you do this!
You've no right to keep them apart!
I have every right! Shen is my son!
You know what you're getting yourself into here Shen? Is causing a war between our families what you really want to do?
No... but I want Rahasia!
You can't have her! I will fight to keep her from you!
Let it go, Shen.
I suppose I should have seen it from the beginning... that our hopeless romance would be doomed to failure.
Please Shen, it doesn't have to end this way!
Yes it does, it would never work. Our families are too different.
Shen! No!
Let him go Rahasia.
Shen, wait! I love you!
Don't say that to me, Rahasia. Let's try to stay calm... rational.
We both know it wouldn't work. Let's not get all emotional and end up hating each other.
You've made the right choice, Shen.
Yes, and I thank you for showing me what I had to do.
I'm ready to leave now, father.
Let's go home then.
Here is you reward, Jedi, for your assistance.
This isn't over Sandrals! I will take this affront directly before the Jedi Council and see you exiled from this world!
Shen... No...
Come inside, Rahasia. Let's get the stink of that Matale dog off you.
Sometimes you have to make hard decisions.
You should leave with your father now.
There's nothing you can do Rahasia.
This is for the best.
Don't do something rash.
Listen to the Jedi, for once, Shen. Don't turn this into a war.
Your children should be allowed to live their own lives.
My son doesn't know his head from his backside! I am the only one qualified to be making his decisions for him, and I say that he leave with me right now!
No, I won't! I can choose my own path!
Shen! How dare you!
I am tired of you controlling my life! I love Rahasia and I want to be with her forever!
And I want to stay with Shen forever, father!
I don't know if you can trust Rahasia, Shen.
Do not trust that Sandral girl, Shen! She is treacherous like her father and will only betray you!
No, Shen, don't believe him!
But...
Get away from my daughter Matale!
Turn away, Shen.
I... I see. I wonder how I could ever have thought differently about you, Rahasia. How I could have been so blind.
Shen, no...
I was foolish, my father was right, we are not destined for one another. It would never have worked. There would have been too many problems. Sometimes it is just better to let things die.
Shen, wait! I love you!
I'm sorry, Rahasia. It just won't work. In fact... I don't think I like you very much at all. You remind me too much of your father.
Don't give up on her, Shen.
Don't disobey me, Shen. Come to me now and leave her! If you don't I'll disown you!
You may want to reconsider this.
You don't know what you're getting into, Shen. Do you want to start a war here?
I will never let Rahasia leave me!
You two should stay together no matter what.
You should try to sort this out together.
Why don't you try listening to your children?
Our children don't know enough of what's good for them to make a reasonable decision!
It's better to let older, wiser heads like ours make the decisions.
Rahasia and I don't want you to make decisions for us! We want to live alone away from you!
You... You insolent boy! If you want to live alone then so be it! I disown you! Never set foot in my house again!
Shen...
Will you go with Shen, Rahasia?
Please listen to her, father!
Don't make me intervene in this.
We never asked for you help, Jedi! Do not press in matters that do not concern you!
This in an internal affair for my family and is none of your concern!
You should not interfere with our private business, Jedi. This will be resolved very shortly.
Do not do anything outside the law.
This is a private affair, Jedi. You would do well not to interfere. We are allowed to decide the fate of our children!
Why don't you just shoot each other and get it over with.
No! Father don't do this!
We don't always need to be fighting like this!
It's gone too far for that, Rahasia. Ahlan has crossed the line one too many times!
Ha! For what you've done to me and my family, I will see you dead and rotting in the ground
Do not act too hastily. This does not have to end badly.
I see little choice in the matter with the Matale dog invading my estate like this, and his son stealing my daughter.
You stole my son first! Whatever the Jedi might say, I know it was you!
My son will never be with your daughter while I'm alive!
Rahasia and I love each other and we'll be together forever!
It will never work, Shen. Why lose your family as well?
Come back to me, boy. You know this is the way things will be.
Let her go, Shen. It's the easiest way to mend things.
I will never let you live with a Sandral, Shen. Come back to me now.
[Lie] You know she was just using you.
[Success] What? No! Rahasia, how...how could you? How could you lead me to believe... ?
No, Shen, I...
Come away from that Sandral harlot, Shen. Come back with me.
You can see Rahasia isn't right for you.
Look at her! See what kind of person she really is!
Rahasia would only betray you in the end.
[Persuade] You want to trust yourself to a woman who would betray her own father?
[Success] No, I...
[Failure] No, I don't believe you! Rahasia and I love each other!
[Failure] No! Rahasia would never do that!
She's a Sandral, boy! They're no good for anything!
You lying Matale dog! My Rahasia is twice the man your son will ever be!
Why... Why all of this? Why are you fighting?
Your families will never get along, Shen.
If you fight, you'll all be killed.
I have my own life, father, and I want to spend it with Rahasia!
You're too immature to do anything on your own.
I can do whatever I want! You can't control me!
Your father is right, Shen. Leave Rahasia.
You could never make Rahasia happy anyway.
I... I could try couldn't I? I would...
You know nothing of what it would be like with that... that Sandral!
[Lie] Rahasia doesn't love you anyway.
The only way either of you will end this is with blood.
I'm glad somebody finally said what we've all been thinking!
This doesn't have to end in violence! Don't give in to your bloodlust!
No! Don't!
This... this has all gone horribly wrong somewhere. Ahlan, what can we be thinking? How could we have let this go this far?
We are at each others throats now fighting over our children's lives when they are old enough to live their own.
He is my son! How can he disrespect my wishes like this?
[Lie] You know, Nurik, Ahlan actually did kill Casus.
[Success] He... WHAT??
No, no! I never did anything to your son, I...
I knew you were lying, you dog! And to think I thought it might not have been you! So I'll take your son from you!
Father, no! Don't do it!
Die!
Shen!
Stop this madness now!
Die!
No! Rahasia! I'll kill you!
The Master has been injured. Terminate all opposition.
Destroy the invaders!
Don't do it, Ahlan!
Run, Rahasia, run!
Don't let him get away with that!
Kill them! Kill them all!
Your son has his own life, Ahlan.
My son will do what I tell him!
You can't control your children forever.
My son doesn't know enough to act responsibly on his own!
What are you doing? Are trying to get everyone here killed?
Are you mad? They will slaughter each other!
Well... You're a very attractive young man, Shen...
Why... thank you. You're quite the looker yourself. I think maybe we can...
Shen!
No, no! I just...
No reward is necessary.
But surely we can...
Money always helps.
Very well, we'll see what we...
Shen's father promised me a reward.
What? You're... you're just doing this for the reward?
How could you! I thought you...
We should get out of here quickly.
You're right, we should go as fast as we can. I don't know how long it will be before my father realizes we're gone.
You're right, we should...
Guard, I need to speak with you.
What do you want, old man? You better not be trying to cause any trouble or you'll be sorry!
This cell is too drafty. My old bones could catch a chill in here. We don't want that. You better let me out.
Uh... yes. It's too drafty in there. Your old bones might catch a chill. We don't want that. Get out of there.
You shouldn't have let me out, sonny. That was wrong. Admiral Karath won't be too happy with you disobeying his orders.
Yes... what I did was wrong. Very wrong.
You deserve to be locked up in the cell for disobeying orders.
Yes... I deserve to be locked up for disobeying orders.
Huh? What... what just happened? What am I doing in here? Damn you, old man! I'll kill you if I ever get out of here!
Then I'll be sure to never let you out. Goodbye, sonny.
You're good, Stranger. I'll give you that. But going up against Bendak is suicide! Even before I lost feeling in my fingers I wouldn't have risked a death match with the Starkiller!
I don't think you had a chance against Bendak, but you sure showed me. You showed us all. Too bad your career as a duelist is over now.
I mean, nobody's going to be stupid enough to go up against you anymore - not even Twitch! Kind of funny, isn't it? You win the big match, and you kill your career!
First I go down to an injury, and now it looks like Marl's been dropped by old age. No room in this game for the veterans anymore, I guess.
But don't get cocky, kid! One day it'll happen to you too! Time catches up to us all, sooner or later. Well, everyone except Bendak Starkiller.
You beat me fair and square, Stranger. But if I still had the use of my fingers you wouldn't have won! Back before my injury I would've mopped the ring up with you!
I saw you your match against Duncan. Not bad for a rookie, but Deadeye's a joke. Even after I lost the use of my fingers I can still beat him!
Go talk to Ajuur, the Duel Organizer, if you want to step up to the big leagues. I'll show you what it's like to fight a real duelist.
You seem to be hanging around here an awful lot. You actually going to step into the duel ring sometime, or are you just here to watch?
Duel ring? What are you talking about?
What? Why are you here if you don't even know what the dueling ring is?
I don't have time to answer your questions - I need to stay focused for my next match. Maybe Ajuur can help you out. He's the Hutt over in the corner. He arranges all the duels.
I want to step into the ring.
Good to see some new blood in the fight game. Things have gotten pretty stale around here lately.
If you're serious about this go talk to Ajuur the Hutt. He's the Duel Organizer. He'll probably start a rookie like you out against Duncan.
I want to ask you some questions.
I'll be going now.
Fair enough. Goodbye, then.
I haven't seen you around here before. You looking to step into the duel ring, or did you just come to watch?
I don't know how to thank an outsider. I never thought it possible. Thank you.
I just wish... that you hadn't seen us at our worst. We can be so much better. We must be.
What is it you want, outsider? You are not welcome here, no matter what anyone says.
Do you recognize this bowcaster bolt casing?
The casing is mine. It bears my family runes, and markings for each of the creatures I have killed.
Yours? Why would we find your casing beside... no, it couldn't be. Could it?
*sigh* This will end in sadness. Don't say I didn't warn you.
Where did you get that, outsider? Did you have someone steal it? Have you sunk to petty theft now?
I found it on Rorworr's corpse. You killed him, didn't you?
What... what are you talking about? I warn you, outsider, I won't tolerate your lies in my home.
Can you explain why your bowcaster casing was found on his body?
What is going on Jaarak? What are they talking about?
Nothing! Outsider lies! Do not listen to them, Woorwill!
Rorworr was dealing with the slavers. I found his datapad.
No! Don't say anything else! I can't let you... I killed Rorworr. Tell Worrroznor, Holder of the Laws... he will judge me.
Please... say nothing to Woorwill. Let a trial call me guilty. Let me be the monster, not Rorworr. Tell Worrroznor, Holder of the Laws, in the home east of here.
I wanted to ask you about Kashyyyk.
I have nothing to say to you. Go and learn what you can while bleeding our planet of its people and honor.
Should we ask if they've seen Rorworr? They understand us. Most outsiders don't bother to learn our language.
<FullName> understands much more than most outsiders.
You have been welcomed back, Zaalbar, but your time away has made you blind. I won't speak to this outsider, and neither will Woorwill.
You are Jaarak, aren't you? I know what you did.
You should show respect. I'm <FullName>. I helped Freyyr back to power.
You are an outsider. Your kind have done more damage here than any one of you could ever hope to fix.
You taint us... and bring out the worst in everything. You will get no respect from me.
I must leave.
Good riddance. Don't come back, outsider.
I'm <FullName>, and I'm here with Chuundar's permission. Show a little respect.
You are no more welcome here than they are, mad-claw. I won't speak to either of you, and neither will Woorwill.
It isn't an easy language to learn, what with all the growls and howls. Big Z told me the whole point was to make it difficult for outsiders to understand.
I will not speak to them and neither will you, Woorwill. I won't allow it.
I do not like where this is leading. I fear it can only end in sorrow.
You have made a terrible claim against me, outsider. Do what you must with it, but leave me alone.
I know that you had reason to kill Rorworr.
That's not for you to decide. You couldn't possibly understand how this affects my people or me.
Do what you must. The Holder of the Laws will decide my fate in proper Wookiee tradition.
You are a murderer. You'll pay the harshest penalty.
An outsider outraged at me! I laugh! You know nothing of me, or how hard any of this is!
Don't you want a chance to defend yourself?
What I want is for you to leave. If you think you are worthy to take me before my peers, I won't stop you.
Why do you return, outsider? Didn't I make myself clear enough? I don't want you here!
I suppose you've heard? The heads of the Sith academy have disappeared. Something is going on, I'm sure of it.
There's some kind of power struggle going on at the Sith academy, I hear. Nothing unusual for those Sith, I guess.
I hear the Sith in the academy are fighting each other. Hope they don't blow it up around themselves, or the colony will go with them!
You look... familiar. Aren't you the one who won the swoop championship on Manaan? Too bad the circuit's dead or you could go pro.
It's not often I get a chance to meet such a fine swoop racer. You won on Manaan, right?
Aren't you the Manaan swoop champion? I figured you'd have gone to another sector by now, one with an actual circuit up and running.
Have you heard? The kolto on Manaan has been poisoned... completely ruined. That's terrible news with the war still underway.
I bet the Republic is responsible for the loss of the kolto on Manaan. Yes they...they just want to keep it out of the hands of the Sith, I'm sure of it.
The kolto reserves are all gone. That means the casualties in this war are going to become horrifying!
I heard something about the Wookiees on Edean suddenly revolting. Do you know anything about that?
One of my friends in Czerka said that they've been driven off Edean by those Wookiee creatures. Barbaric beasts!
Can you imagine? The Wookiee slaves on Edean have gone insane and started attacking the Czerka outpost there. It must be horrific!
The Sith blew up Taris, the entire planet. I guess they must have deserved it... but that's so many people...
I suppose you've heard about Taris being destroyed? The Republic must have pushed the Sith into it, that's what I think.
One of Korriban's primary trade routes went through Taris. Now that it's destroyed, the colony here will have an even harder time of it.
Ah so you managed to come after all. I see you brought friends.
[This man appears to be looking for someone... maybe even one of your companions back on the Ebon Hawk.]
Ah, so we meet again, Canderous. It has been quite a long time.
Look here, my dear friends. We have some newcomers to the colony... led by a Jedi, no less. I don't believe I've seen any of them before, have you?
I hate Jedi... and these fallen ones are worse! They always get into the academy, and they think they're better than the rest of us!
You should turn around and move along, kid. You don't want the trouble we'd give you.
Ha-ha! Smart-mouthed newcomers, to boot.
Looks pretty fresh to me, Lashowe.
That's what I thought. Well, stranger... I don't know whether you're aware of this or not, but here on Korriban the Sith do as they please. And we are Sith.
Quite literally, whether you live or die depends upon our whim. What do you think of that, hmm?
I don't think there's any need for hostilities.
Oh, neither do I. I simply stated a fact. Do you know how many Sith there are in Dreshdae?
Twelve? No, wait, thirteen!
Nice one, old man.
Thank you. It takes effort to be properly irreverent at my age.
Enough to crush this fool! Let's do it, Lashowe!
Now, now, let's not be hasty. Perhaps our friend here could yet offer up some amusement.
What do you say? Amuse us. Make us laugh, and we just might consider allowing you to live.
Do you know who I am? I'm Darth Revan! Watch your tongue or I'll rip it out!
Hah! Too funny!
It's no joke. I really am Darth Revan.
Ha ha ha! Good one!
Yes, I suppose that wasn't too bad. Alright then, my friend... you've done as you were asked. Perhaps we will meet again.
I'm not looking for trouble, but I'm not here to amuse you.
Oh? I see. We'll just have to see about that, won't we?
Ha ha! Looks like this one's not afraid of you at all, Lashowe.
Are you going to let us be insulted?!
Oh, get over yourself already. I'm tired of this.
Yeah, this one's got some backbone, at least. Let's go.
You took an incredible risk. You know that, right?
It worked, didn't it?
Fine, we'll go. As for you... I'll find you later. Trust me on that.
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
Fine. I'll deal with *you* later.
Be careful. You might be heading for more trouble than you can handle.
What?!
Heh... ha ha! I think someone just stood up to you, Lashowe.
Shut up, fool! Unless you want to be next!
Yeah? Anytime!
Stop it, this is boring. Let's just go back to the academy.
If you really want a fight just make the first move. It'll be your last.
[Persuade] Err... okay. These two Mandalorians are out in the woods...
Go on.
One of them collapses. He doesn't seem to be breathing and his eyes are glazed. The other Mandalorian takes out his communicator and contacts his commander.
I've heard this one before, I think...
Quiet!
He gasps: "My partner has collapsed! I don't know what to do!" After a moment, the commander responds: "Calm down, I can help."
And then?
"First, let's make sure your partner is dead." There is a silence, then a blaster shot is heard. Back on the communicator, the Mandalorian says: "Okay, now what?"
Ha ha ha! I like that one.
It would be more realistic if the commander just shot them both.
[Success] Hah! Too funny!
[Failure] Heh! That's the oldest joke in the book.
Well, it certainly didn't amuse us, did it? Try again.
Please don't hurt me! I don't want a fight!
Ahhh, I hate this kind of whining. Do they always have to beg for mercy?
Commentary: Ohhh, master. I am so disappointed in you right now. No, don't look at me.
Yeah, let's get out of here.
Very well, boys. I'm sure we can find something more exciting than these... dead fish. Let's go.
Feh...
Cute. Maybe you should try juggling next time.
Are you mad? Don't provoke them!
Not enough to save your sorry self.
Is this a raffle? How many guesses do we get?
Do not provoke them, Carth.
Beep-beep boop boop.
I think that was a rhetorical question. But nice guess, Teethree.
You can try to kill me. You'd fail, but you can try.
Be careful! You don't want to provoke them, do you?
Ah, you don't think they're a bit pre-provoked to begin with?
Don't be stupid. We needn't make matters worse.
How precocious. I think this one tried to make a joke, don't you?
I didn't think it was funny.
Neither did I. A brave face, perhaps, but I'm more interested in being amused at the moment, I think.
Commentary: That's the way to tell the meatbags, master! Charging weapons, just in case. This should be fun!
Those are very brave words for such an insignificant person. Do you not realize how many Sith are here in Dreshdae?
Let me kill this one, Lashowe! Let me do it!
I think that's a lot of responsibility for simple scum like you.
You couldn't find your backside with both hands AND your friends'.
Great, just what we needed. Some punks come to steal our lunch credits.
Well, if you'd seen us before, we wouldn't be newcomers, would we?
Look here, my dear friends... we have a newcomer to our little colony. A Jedi, no less. I don't believe I've seen this one before, have you?
Look here, my dear friends... we have a group of newcomers to our little colony. I don't believe I've seen any of them before, have you?
Look here, my dear friends... we have a newcomer to our little colony. I don't believe I've seen this one before, have you?
And what do you call that, then? Winners draw the crowd, not lazy times like that. Are you sure you are up to the competition?
Just set me up with a race.
Patience. I still owe you for your last race. Let's settle that debt before we go any further.
It's a big payout for you. You shattered my track record and took tier three. 80 racing bonds was the deal.
That's the last I'll be giving you, I hope. You're too fast for most of my racers.
I have a box for you. Sent by Lurze.
Eh? What's this? A box? Oh... *that* box.
Yeah, I know what box you're talking about. I thought that was supposed to be here a month ago. You take a detour, huh?
Ahh, never mind. You open the box?
No, of course not.
Smart <man/woman>. Live longer that way.
I suppose you're expecting some payment now, huh? I'll give you 2000 credits for the box, and you can run on your way.
[Persuade] I expect a little more for transporting dangerous goods.
[Success] The box isn't dangerous unless you're fool enough to open it. But I like your backbone, human. I'll give you 2500 credits.
I'll have some of my spaceport workers unload the box from your ship. You take the credits and go. Say hello to Lurze for me.
[Failure] And I expect my goods to be delivered on time. You have a problem with the price, you talk to Lurze.
I'll have some of my spaceport workers unload the box from your ship, so take the credits and go. I've got other things to take care of, here.
[Force Persuade] You want to pay me a little more.
[Success] Hmm... I will pay you more... but I don't like it. Take your money and let me get back to race business.
[Failure] No, I want you to leave. I have offered my best price and that is what you will accept. Smugglers are not hard to find.
Is that all? Maybe I'll just keep the box until I get a better price.
You think so, huh? I'll remind you that you don't own the box. You're just a courier. You have a problem with the compensation, you talk to Lurze.
I'll take it.
Smart <man/woman>. Here you go. Say hello to Lurze for me.
Of course I did. Wouldn't you have?
Maybe, maybe not. I'm thinking you didn't, or you wouldn't be standing here delivering it to me.
I did. It was... very interesting.
Eh? You opened it but you're still around to deliver it to me? Impressive. More likely you're just lying, but I don't care.
Does it make a difference?
No, it doesn't. I know what's in the box and that's good enough for me.
Let's talk about that business with Nico.
Hehe, nothing to talk about, friend. You made sure that Nico signed the best contract I've ever come up with.
Everyone's happy too. He gets to race and I get almost everything he wins. I love swoop racing.
I want the reward for winning my last race.
You passed the second tier and have earned 30 racing bonds. I'm beginning to think it was a mistake to sign you up.
I suppose you'll be up against my local pro attractions in tier three next. You've already ruined Yuka Rill.
What sort of business do you need help with?
I make my money off of signing good racers. Good ones, not great ones. I want them young and stupid.
I've got one. Nico Senvi. Great potential. Only started racing a year ago and loves it. He lives for it now.
And? It sounds like you have something special. What do you want help with?
What I want is simple. I want Nico to sign a contract with me, and I want you to convince him. I'll pay well.
Why won't he sign?
The deal basically says that I fund his bike and repairs, but in return I take a *hefty* cut of his winnings.
And you're surprised that the boy doesn't want to sign?
That isn't fair! On Taris you had to give a cut to the swoop gang sponsoring you, but at least the rider got the higher share of the winnings.
More slavery. Just disguised.
He knows it's harsh, but he can't afford to go pro on his own and he doesn't want to give up racing.
I've got him where I want him. I just need you to give him a little push in the right direction. Or a big shove.
I talked to him. He's willing to sign.
I thought he would. Very good. I'll have him training off this barren rock as soon as possible. He'll make me rich.
Now, I think I offered 20 racing bonds for the job. I'm happy to pay it.
That will be fine. Good luck.
He'll be the best there is one day, and I'll own him. Now, is there anything else?
I want to talk about the rewards for racing.
I give rewards for winning, not flitting around like you're chasing womp rats. My three tier system is not for the weak of skill.
Explain what the different tiers are.
Tier one here is strictly amateurs. Might get a good race out of them now and then, but they aren't going anywhere.
Reach Tier two and you show promise. You're still fodder for the pros, but you're pretty good.
Tier three... only one of my local guys in that range. Nico. Good chance to go pro... if he knows what's good for him.
What does each tier pay?
Tier one is 10 racing bonds. Tier two I pay 30 racing bonds. Tier three I give 80 racing bonds. You'll agree the amount is fair.
I pay each level only once. I'm not here to support you. I only pay to encourage constant improvement.
What are racing bonds?
Racing bonds are monetary notes I issue so vendors know who my friends are. Any merchant will buy them.
Each bond is worth 60 credits, give or take. It depends on the merchant.
Why aren't rounds used, like on Manaan?
Here on Tatooine we do things Motta's way. With Taris gone, there's no circuit governing organization to say I am wrong.
Are there any pro racers here?
There aren't a lot of pro racers *anywhere* with Taris gone. I'm going to try and build up one or two of my own.
But, I suppose there are a couple of pros here. Some "has-been" and "never-were" types. That sort of thing.
Zoriis Bafka is the best of the lot, outside my local champ Nico. Most racers in her league never stop here.
Let's go back to my other questions.
Hurry it up, I don't have all day.
Give me the basics on how to race.
The track crosses the dunes of Tatooine. You will race against times set by other racers. There will be no other swoops on the track.
Your bike likely has the standard five gears to shift through. As your speed increases, watch the indicators in the lower left to know when to shift.
Shift at the wrong time and your swoop will accelerate poorly or slow down. Shift correctly and you will optimize your perfomance.
You can also steer over "swoop boosters" placed along the route. These will increase your speed substantially for a short time.
Are there any hazards on the track?
There are obstacles that you must watch for. Steering over rocks won't damage your bike, but it will slow you down.
I'll be back later.
Go then, but don't hog the track with rec-runs. I need my pros to keep their skills up. You depress them.
All right, but don't make me regret giving you track access. I need racers that race!
You've passed the first tier and have earned 10 racing bonds. Not a bad showing for a beginner. You beat Garm's time easily.
Take this, with my thanks. We'll see if you can do any better in tier two.
For you? Nothing. I've already paid you for all three tiers. There's no more. Nothing. Go hit another track.
Ah, I set up a quick three-tier system so people know where they stand. I pay for the first time to reach each tier.
I think I should ask for more.
You've taken a lot of money from me already, winning each tier like you have. This is it. There's no more.
All right, it's enough.
[Persuade] I'm worth more. You wouldn't want word of this getting out.
[Success] I suppose I don't. No one would sign with me again. I'm sure we can come to an agreement.
I'll pay you half again what I said, and that's all. Now, I have to plan for Nico's training. Is there anything else?
[Failure] Look, I paid you all that I plan to. That's it. Is there anything else?
Then I'll have to take it out of your hide!
Anchorhead is a safe town. I don't think you'll be able to do much of anything to me around here.
I think otherwise! RRRAAAAARRRGGGHHH!!
Okay, maybe... maybe I was a little hasty. I don't know what he said but I... I get the drift.
Never underestimate a Mandalorian. If I want, there won't be enough of you left to identify.
A... a Mandalorian? May... maybe I was a bit hasty.
Threat: Guards give up, meatbag. Assassin droids will hunt your whole family tree. Reconsider.
Well... an assassin droid, you say. No reasoning with them. Maybe... I was a little hasty.
*ahem* Do as we say, scoundrel! You don't want to anger a shortempered Jedi!
Jedi... you're Jedi? I'll do this just so you leave. Who knows what you'll have me saying with your "waving hands."
Now, if you've got nothing else but empty threats, I think we're done. Is there anything else?
[Persuade] You hired me to bully *for* you. I'm no less a threat now.
[Success] You do have a point about that, and the guards can't be everywhere. Perhaps I should rethink this.
[Failure] I'm not afraid of you. You've been paid all that you will be paid. Now, is there anything else?
[Force Persuade] You know I could hurt you. Do as I say.
[Success] Of course, guards can't be everywhere. I'd prefer to avoid a fight, I think. I'll fix this.
[Force Persuade] You will pay me more and like it.
[Success] I'd... really like to pay you more. I think I can manage something. I don't know why I was arguing.
We had a deal. It was fair and I don't see why you need more.
You'll give me more or you will regret it.
I think you should give him a better deal.
You're not going to pull that typical swoop-jockey attitude, are you? This is business, and I know what's best.
What do you care whether I make money off the kid or not? He wants to race and you'll get paid. We all win.
[Persuade] Treat him fairly or I'll start rumors your races are rigged.
[Success] You wouldn't. That would be bad. Very bad. Even rumors like that could keep me out of the pro circuit.
All right, I'll give him a better deal and make it back in the long run, I guess. You, of course, are not getting paid!
I trust this is the last I will have to hear about this matter? Was there anything else?
[Failure] I don't think you would. It would taint the racers that won on my track. That incudes Nico, and others.
[Force Persuade] You want to give Nico a better deal!
[Success] Of course I could just give him a better deal. Did I say that? Wait, I guess it does make sense.
His times *have* suffered since I made the offer. I mean, swoop-jocks are moody. They feel bad, they don't win.
[Failure] No, no I don't. What is this, a joke? Quit fooling around, I mean business.
You give him a better deal or I bury you under your track!
Let's go back to some basic questions about Nico.
I'll see what I can do.
You do that. It's for the best. Now, was there something else?
I'm not interested in being your enforcer.
No, no, you are a representative, and you'll be his friend. Let him know what the right choice is.
Right. Tell me why we're talking to this guy again?
It's the best way. I'll be here if you change your mind. Now, was there something else?
Why would he listen to me?
He doesn't trust me. Actually, none of them do. I'm the promoter. I do it for money. They all just want the glory.
I bet you just can't understand why they wouldn't trust someone who's only in it for the money, too.
Money's honest, old man. More honest than a conniving Jedi.
You know, for a brute you say the sweetest things.
You're a swoop-jock like him. You're new, but if you win enough he'll respect you. I'm counting on it.
And if he doesn't, *make* him choose correctly. You look like you could scare some sense into him.
I'm sure they wouldn't mind *some* of the credits, as opposed to getting it stolen out of their pockets.
What will you pay me?
How does... 20 racing bonds sound? That should cover all your swoop costs on Tatooine nicely.
I'll make it all back if he signs the deal. I know it.
Aren't there other racers? Why him?
He'll be great one day, I can tell. There are some pros here, but I'm not looking for experience. I want potential.
Besides, he's young. He won't give me trouble like the older riders, or someone like you.
Oh, no, I'm not talking to you about that anymore. I agree to strange things when you are around, that's for sure.
Nico's got the best deal I've ever given, no lie. Now leave so I can figure out how to still make money off this.
Yes, the contract trouble I've been having. Have you talked to the boy? You don't get paid until he signs.
Sorry now, I can't do that. You've won all three tiers and I'm not putting you in any more officially timed runs.
I don't want my racers getting discouraged... and I don't have much interest in signing you. I think you'd be... difficult.
Anyway, if you want to do any recreational races just for practice, talk to the track coordinator. He'll set you up.
Certainly. We just need to clear up the positioning fee. All racers pay the same before each officially timed race. 100 credits.
I will pay the 100 credits.
I admire that you are so eager to get back out there after your loss. Let's hope you do better. I'll have your bike placed in position.
You'll go against Garm Totryl's time in the first tier. He's a local boy new to the sport. The time to beat is <CUSTOM27>.
Swoop racing fans, we have an official race about to commence! Make some noise for this new contender!
Well, you made it past the first tier, so let's try the second. Yuka Rill is the current leader. The time to beat is <CUSTOM28>.
Attention! A second tier race is about to begin! Show your support for this up and comer!
Hmm... it's time to put you up against tier three. Let's see how you do against Zoriis Bafka, a pro. The time to beat is <CUSTOM29>.
Attention! Motta the Hutt presents the cream of swoop racing, a tier three match! Let this almost-champion know what you expect!
Fine, fine. We'll have your bike brought to the starting position. Let's see what level of race we should give you.
I already paid a maintenance fee.
The fee is due before each race. How else am I supposed to sponsor prize money at the level I do? I need to see some returns.
I am investing in my riders, but I also need to see profit now. You'll agree with my logic. If you don't, you don't race.
Will you negotiate on the price?
I have already given you a free race. Don't anger me by further insulting the reasonable nature of my prices. Pay or don't race.
Haven't I already dealt with this fee?
I don't feel that I need to. The price is reasonable.
[Persuade] I'll put on a good show. You'll make your money back.
[Success] Eh, fine, I will extend this discount to you, if only to close your mouth. I'll have your bike moved into position.
But I warn you, I have people to make sure I don't give too many favors. You won't get this discount again.
[Failure] The price has been named and you will pay it. I don't see why you should be exempt.
[Force Persuade] You want to let me race for free.
[Success] Maybe I will let you race once for free. Yes, I think I will. I'll have your swoop moved into position on the track.
Who are you? Ah, nobody. What do you want, huh? Handouts? Go dig a mine, fool.
I'm looking for information. Can you help?
Not interested in helping. Only interested in racing. I get enough beggars through here looking for money.
Let's have a look at you. Hmm... just a human... nothing really special. You race? Maybe own a swoop?
I raced on Taris. I won the season opener there.
Ha! You and twelve other liars. Planet blows up, race records are lost, and now everyone is a champion!
My friend tells the truth. I am a Jedi... are you going to imply that I am lying, as well?
Ho ho! Now you are champion and travel with Jedi? Does the story get bigger with every telling?
Nobody here can compare with the racers you rode against on Taris. You'll wipe every record from the books on this backwater track!
Okay, okay, enough of the funny stuff. You think you're a racer, you'll be one. You have your own bike?
I have some experience.
That's great. Except I don't care. Let me rephrase the important part of my question. Do you own your own swoop?
I have my own bike stored on my ship.
You got a bike, then you can race. I don't care about experience, so long as you can get out on the track.
And if you crash and burn, that's your problem. I just need warm bodies to pad the roster between the pros.
Err... there is the matter of a small track maintenance fee... 100 credits.
I'll pay it.
Good! That shows you mean business. Now you can use the track for recreational runs, or I can give you an official race right away.
Just ask me when you want to start and... there's some business I need help with... if you're serious about promoting racing.
I can't pay that much.
Then you don't race! I pay out good money to encourage competition. I need to make it back somehow.
[Persuade] Why not drop the fee? No racers means no crowds.
[Success] Well, I suppose you're right, but I'm not dropping it the whole amount. 50 credits. That's it.
I'll pay the 50 credits.
[Force Persuade] I don't need to pay the fee.
[Success] You don't need to pay the fee. It's just a formality. I'll let you use the track for practice and set up your first official race right away.
[Failure] What are you trying to do, bankrupt me? It costs money to run this place!
I'm not interested in this. Goodbye.
Yeah, you do that. I've got business to work on. Big business!
I can't pay that amount either.
If you don't have the confidence to win back the money you give me, why should I care if you race or not!
Bah! Pay it or leave, that's the deal.
I raced on Manaan.
You will show me respect, worm!
Hmm, what's that? A spine? Well now, that sets you above most of the scrub-hacks I meet in a day.
Well, I'll just say goodbye then.
What? You again? Look, are you here to race or aren't you? I don't have time for anything else. What good are you?
You again, hmm? I hope you plan to do better than your last race... not that I don't like taking your money.
Let's talk about swoop racing.
Very well, but you've already proven your skill on my track. What else do you want?
Looking to make up for your previous disgrace? If you keep losing, I'll have to reconsider letting you on my track.
Yes, you'll be wanting to race. I'm sure you'll give the swoop fans a good show.
Ah, my latest swoop jockey. You'll want your reward for your last race. I never break a deal once a price has been agreed upon.
Ah, it's you again. So, is this about racing or business? One or the other, I've got no time for anything else.
Err... you're a Sith, right? *ahem* Excuse me...
This planet belongs to the Sith. They allow Czerka to run the starport and a few mines, but the Sith are the ones in control.
There are a lot of young folk who come here hoping to get admitted to the Sith academy here in Dreshdae. Few ever do.
You're not here to try and get into the Sith academy, are you? Most of the poor fools who try are killed by the Sith. It's horrible!
Are you new to Korriban?
I hear you arrived on that old smuggling ship... the Hawk, or something like that?
Are you a smuggler? That's the only way we get some decent goods to buy in this sector.
Yeah, the Czerka cantina's the only place to go around here for any real fun.
Have you heard what happened to Taris? I can't believe the Sith are powerful enough to do that.
Whatever you do, don't try and land a ship outside the colony. The Sith will destroy you without a second thought.
I hear them Sith are doing some kind of digging up on the planet's surface. How weird is that?
*Sigh* I can't wait to get back to the Core systems. This planet is dangerous with all these Sith wandering around.
[Before you can leave this planet you will have to find some way to disable the disruptor field that caused you to crash in the first place.]
[The Ebon Hawk is in no condition to fly. Until you find new stabilizers to replace those damaged by the disruptor field you won't be able to get off the ground.]
So you are the Arbiter in the Sunry-Elassa murder case then. I hope you are as impartial as the office is traditionally supposed to be.
You off-worlders have a tendency to ignore the rule of law in favor of some rather irrational causes.
What is it that I can do for you now?
Do you know anything about a Star Map?
No I do not. And it is quite illogical to think that a being who spends his entire day locked in a room with insane people and murderers would know much about the outside world.
Is there anything else you need?
Have you heard about young Selkath going missing?
Yes, actually I have. We find it very suspicious, but there are no signs of kidnappings.
It is likely, though, that it has been perpetrated by out-worlders... ones such as yourself perhaps...
I am here to see the prisoner Sunry.
Yes, I am aware of this fact, human. He is in his cage over there and I am sure can hear you quite clearly.
What do you know about the murder of Elassa?
Sunry is from the Republic. Elassa was from the Sith. They kill each other all the time. What more is there to know?
But as to the details, that is for the judges of our courts to decide.
I want to begin Sunry's trial now.
Are you certain, human? Once the trial has begun it cannot be stopped. And once judgment is given, the case can never be reopened.
You must be certain your investigations are complete before you request a trial. This is the role of the Arbiter. Are you certain you wish to begin the trial now?
Yes, let's begin the trial.
Very well, human. I shall advise the court and we will begin immediately.
Are you deaf, flipper head? Let's get this trial over with!
Actually, I've reconsidered. I don't want a trial just yet.
That is your right as Arbiter. When you are ready to proceed with the trial come speak to me.
Nothing for now.
Very well then. I will, of course, be here if you need something else.
Just leave me alone. I have to get in the academy!
You... you were talking to Mekel! I saw you! Where did he go? D-did he... did he tell you I was worthy?!
[Persuade] Mekel is tricking you. He'll never let you into the academy.
[Success] What?! I... I've wasted all this time! How could I have been so... foolish! I could have died!
I'll find another way in, I swear it! I'll show him! Thank you!
[Failure] You're wrong! I... must wait here to be worthy; you are... just trying to trick me so you will be chosen!
But I -
Go now, and t-tempt me no more! I... will be strong!
[Persuade/Lie] He said you should go home. The Sith aren't for you.
[Success] N-no! Not after all this time! I... oh, this is terrible! I'll have to... go home...
Somehow I think he'll get over it.
That was a kind thing to do. Better he give up on the Sith while he can.
That was the right thing to do - turn him away from the Sith.
Mother will be so angry! Ooohh...
Hmm. Did you save the boy or just crush his dreams? I wonder...
I don't know if any of these fools deserve second chances.
[Failure] Hah! L-like... like I would believe that! You... are just trying to make me leave! I will get in, I will!
[Persuade/Lie] Not yet. He said your final test is to attack that guard.
[Success] He... he did? The guard at the door? My final test? At last!
What are you doing? This man is not even a Sith, in truth. This is beneath contempt.
I... I'll do it! I'll prove my strength! AAAAAAHHHH!!
You should not manipulate people this way! You may fall!
Observation: Marvelous elimination of the enemy, master! I applaud you!
One really has to wonder if all Sith start off this gullible.
Should I feel bad for him? I don't.
[Failure] You... must think I am a great f-fool! Go away! I will get in, I will!
No. I'll be going.
I... suppose he'll come back. Well, then, I'll just have to wait!
I have to stand at attention. P-please... don't distract me, whoever you are.
What are you doing?
I... I'm trying to prove my worth to enter the Sith academy, here. We were told that if we stood here long enough... we would be worthy.
That's madness! How long have you been here?
We've been here... for so many days. I'm so hungry! Some... some of us have died. But I must be strong, I must! I will keep standing!
Who put you up to this?
Mekel. H-he's the Sith... the one watching us from over there! He... h-he said this was how we would prove our worth...
I must be strong! Mekel... will find me worthy... soon, I hope...
Are you crazy? You have to stop!
N-no, I can't! I must get into the academy! Mekel is the Sith, over there, watching us... he told us we have to do this!
Here, I have a bit of food...
I... n-no, please, put it away! I... I can't accept any, Mekel said. He's the Sith... over there, watching us...
Seems like not much to do to be worthy of anything. How long you been up to it, boy?
Are you one of the Sith?
N-no... no, I'm not. I'd like nothing better, however. Th-that's... that's why I'm here.
Fine, I'll leave you to it.
Th-thank you... wish me luck.

When this new data we gain is assimilated, we shall gain unprecedented advances!
Our work is the most important one undertaken by our people. The future of our tribe rests with us.
I'm... I'm sorry. I don't want to get in the way of official Sith business.
I remember when a person didn't have to worry about thieves rummaging through their home!
Taris used to be a nice place, before the Sith showed up and started bossing us around!
Stay out of the Lower City. That place is overrun with gangs!
I wonder if any of those Republic space pods survived crash landing in the Undercity?
You are so lucky. You got accepted into the academy, didn't you? I'm beginning to think I'm never going to make it.
Hey! You've got one of the medallions! You've been accepted! How did you ever manage that?!
If you're looking to get into the academy, you're going to have a tough time. There's lots of us here trying to get accepted.
When one of the Sith thinks you're ready for the academy, he gives you a medallion. I wish I had one of those...
Can you imagine if I actually became a Sith? The power I would have! I could do anything!!
Do you know where I can find Yuthura Ban? I understand she's the one who determines if you are accepted into the academy or not.
You'd better be careful around some of those Sith. They'll eliminate any prospects just to remove a potential future threat!
I've had two friends killed by the Sith already. It must be some kind of test... I'll survive and make it into the academy, I know it!
I'm... I'm sorry. I don't want to get in the way of official Sith business.
Taris used to be a nice place, before the Sith showed up and started bossing us around!
Stay out of the Lower City. That place is overrun with gangs!
I wonder if any of those Republic space pods survived crash landing in the Undercity?
Aren't you just a sweet little droid, yes you are!
How... how did you get in? Did they send another submersible? Quick, we have to get out of here, we have to get away!
Why? What happened?
No! No! We have no time, we have to leave now! I managed to close the door after they killed everyone else, but I don't know how long it will hold.
I am not going anywhere.
We have to! We have to leave! The Selkath, they went crazy! They started killing anything that moved. Someone must have triggered the defense systems too, 'cause all the droids activated as well.
I was one of the mercs the Republic sent down here to find out what happened. We came down and secured the first couple rooms... there were bodies everywhere...
And the Selkath came out... screaming and croaking their fishy little war-cries.
The Selkath?
They swarmed out and over us. There was no way we could stop them.
So we ran... But hardly any of us made it. I locked the door behind us, bu... but the others had already left in the submersible!
The sharks... the firaxa out there and... worse... I heard an explosion shortly after the submersible left. They didn't make it. Just food for the sharks and the Selkath... like us.
I have to get into the station.
No! I locked the door so that the Selkath won't get in. If you open it, we're all done for!
I have no choice.
If you go in there, you're dead! You're all dead!
If you want to die, then go! You won't hear me mourning for you! I'll stay here and be safe until some sort of REAL rescue comes!
Don't get your hopes up too high. I have no intention of dying.
Tough. I need it open.
You call yourself a mercenary?
Let's get you back to the surface.
Back to the surface. Yes... NO!! There's something out there... it got the other submersible already.
Then how are we supposed to get you out of here?
We can't leave until you do something. Blow up the entire station maybe. That might distract whatever it is long enough for us to escape to the surface.
But all the machinery and stuff is in the southern half, and that's been flooded! There might still be environmental suits around but... but... the Selkath might have laid their eggs in them!
Wait here while I go into the station.
Suggestion: Perhaps we could dismember the organic? It would make it easier for transport to the surface.
Beep! Beep! Boop!
Amendment: I did forget that. Stupid, frail, non-compartmentalized organic meatbags!
Hey! Y-you... you can't just rip me to pieces! I'll die!!
You got a better idea for us getting you out of here, huh?
I didn't see anything...
That doesn't mean its not still out there! Watching.. waiting...
You snivelling worm! You're just food for the Selkath!
What!? No! You're one of them! You'll never get me!
You fought them?
What happened to the scientists?
They're dead! All dead! They swarmed out and over us. There was no way we could stop them.
I have to find the Star Map.
I don't know what you're talking about. I've never seen any map, just stinking, reeking death.
The Selkath, they went crazy! They started killing anything that moved. Someone must have triggered the defense systems too, 'cause all the droids activated as well.
What happened here?
Who are you?
I'm <FullName>. Calm yourself down.
Where did you go? How did you get back here without being eaten?
We went back to the surface.
You just got lucky! Or... or it's waiting for me to go back before eating me!
When the Republic sends a real team down, they'll save me! They'll kill the monster and then we'll all leave safely!
If you're going to go into the rest of the station, don't expect me to help you... the Selkath will rip you all apart!
Come with us back to the surface.
No!!! Whatever's out there will eat me too! Eat all of us!
You can't make me! I won't go!
It will be fine.
Nonono! It will eat us all up if we go out there! At least I'm safe here behind this door. The Selkath can't get me in here.
We made it back up.
I don't know... I don't know why! But I'm not going to take my chances out there... It's waiting for me, I know it!
Fine! Then you'll rot here!
Cause I'm better than you.
If you're going to go in there, do it quickly! I'll shut the door behind you... but don't expect me to open it again!
Juhani was a... a dear companion to me for many years. We spent many nights together alone under the stars.
That will never happen again, thanks to you. Curse the Council for sending you, of all people, to speak to her! Could you have done nothing else?!
She had it coming, trust me.
She had it coming, did she? She had it coming?!
The Juhani I knew deserved more than this! She deserved more from the Council, and more from you!
You... you did not even try, did you? Did it even occur to you that Juhani might have been saved? That she might be worth saving?!
I should kill you for what you've done! And yet I can't, can I? I am a Jedi, and we are sworn to protect all... even the likes of you.
Get... get out of my sight! The very thought of the Council... and of you... makes me ill.
Should you be talking like that?
Do not presume to tell me how I should speak of anything! They should have known better than to entrust such a task to you!
I did my best. I'm sorry.
Pardon me if I find your apology rather disingenuous. Juhani meant nothing to you, and the Council should have known better than to entrust her life to you.
Why didn't you go to her, then?
Why? Because the Council believed that my closeness to her might do more harm than good... and yet they send *you*, instead? And look what has happened.
You there! Padawan! Why are you not wearing the customary robes of the Jedi? Do you mock the honored traditions of our Order?
Are you a Jedi?
My name is Belaya. I have come here to further my learning in the ways of the Force. Many Jedi come here to train under Master Zhar.
Any who belong to the Order should surely know this. You must be neglecting your studies, Padawan.
I believe you are mistaken. I am not a Padawan. I am <FullName>. I came here with Bastila.
