Aren't you just a sweet little droid, yes you are!
I demand justice! The Sandral family is a blight upon Dantooine! They must be punished!
The Council will look into this matter, Mr. Matale. You must be patient. Your accusations have no proof, and we do not want you stirring up trouble with the Sandrals if there is some mistake.
Mistake? My son Shen is missing! How can there be any doubt the Sandrals are to blame?
There are other possible explanations for your son's disappearance.
Bah! You Jedi are good for nothing but talk! I shall only wait so long before I take action on my own!

As dangerous as the threat from Darth Malak and the Sith may be, we Jedi cannot simply abandon our other responsibilities. The Council has promised Alhan Matale we will look into his son's disappearance.
Should you have time, Padawan, you may want to investigate this matter.
I shall look into it at once.
If Shen Matale is not returned to his father it may ignite a savage and bloody feud between the Matale and Sandral estates. We must not allow that to happen.
Your study and training are important, of course. But the Jedi are not a cloistered Order. Our influence and teachings must spread beyond the walls of our Academies.
It is in the real world that we truly prove ourselves worthy of the title Jedi. You would do well to remember this, young Padawan.
Not to mention that I wouldn't mind getting out of this enclave for a bit. I mean, come on, how bad could it be?
This task has its own importance. It may also serve to divert our minds for a short time... something which carries its own rewards.
But what about my Jedi training?
I have more important things to do!
Is there anything else I should know?
These two families have been settled here for some years now...
And causing me no end of trouble!
Indeed. They have been settled here for some time and feuding ever since.
What caused this feud?
I do not know how the original feud started, but they want nothing to do with each other.
As you may have heard, Ahlan Matale believes that his son, Shen, has been kidnapped by Nurik Sandral.
Curiously, Nurik's son Casus has been missing for some time as well... I fear Nurik may suspect Ahlan in this...
Is there anything else you wish to know?
Which families are involved?
The Sandral and Matale families are involved.
The Sandrals live far to the south. The head of that family is Nurik Sandral. He is a stern man, but I believe him fair. Under the present circumstances, though... who knows?
Ahlan Matale can be much more unstable. He is convinced of his own importance and can be a most... oppressive individual at times. He lives closer to the enclave, but still to the south.
Where are they settled?
Both families have settled to the south of this enclave. The Matales are the closer of the two.
Both have similar estates, but Ahlan is much more paranoid about his and guards it quite heavily.
Is there anything else you wish to know?
I shall investigate this immediately.
I will investigate if there is time.
I must continue on my main mission.
Why are you bothering me? I am here to speak with the Council, not some servant! Please leave or I shall be forced to tell the Council of your rude behavior!
Greetings human, and welcome to the Ahto City Visitor's Provisional Stand. We are here to provide visitors with all manner of indigenous treats and products produced right here on Manaan.
We carry all manner of foods and provisions, and have contacts with resellers across the world to provide you, the customer, with the best shopping experience possible.
How is it that the Ahto City Provisional Company can help you today?
Tell me about Ahto City.
Ahto City is the center of trade and commerce for all of Manaan. Indeed, for this entire sector! It is the only known source of kolto in the galaxy, and thus one of its most important worlds.
This city was constructed by we Selkath so that other races and cultures could experience the wonders that Manaan has to offer.
Tell me about Manaan.

Manaan is the homeworld of we Selkath. It is here that our race has lived and thrived for uncounted millenia. With our valuable supply of kolto, we have become an important player in intragalactic politics.
We have taken a neutral stance in the current galactic war between the Sith and the Republic as we believe that violence is not a permanent solution.
Is there another way in which I can assist you?
Let me see your inventory.
Of course. The Ahto City Visitor's Provisional Stand is here to service you, the customer.
Nothing for now.
Rest assured that as long as Manaan is here, the Ahto City Provisional Company will be here to serve your needs. Good day to you, sentient.
I will be leaving now.
You are not welcome in this city anymore, human, but we cannot deny you entry either.  Therefore, I am obliged to treat you as I do my other customers.
You're that friend of Griff, right? He gave me a message for you.
I don't like the sound of this.
He told me to tell you that he made a mistake brewing the Tarisian ale. It didn't work out right for some reason.
What kind of mistake?
He told me the tach gland was ruined. And he said he wasn't going to stick around and have to face his Exchange contact.
You mean he's gone?
He hopped on board the last shuttle. I don't know where he was heading, but I can't say I'm sorry he's gone.
He was one of the worst employees I ever had. He was always on a break, he mixed up orders and I think he might have been stealing from me.
I have to go after him!
People like Griff, they know how to disappear when they get in too deep. You won't hear from him again any time soon. Waste of time to even bother looking for him.
Damn it, Griff - won't you ever learn? How can my own flesh and blood be so stupid!
There was one last thing. He said to tell his sister goodbye. And to tell her he's sorry.
That cheapskate owes me credits!
You and a dozen others. I was smart enough not to give him an advance on his wage, but you can kiss your credits goodbye.
Good riddance!
You just let him go?
Did he say where he was going?
I'm not surprised. Anything else?
Yes? What is it? If this is about mining or Sand People, you go to the Czerka officers. I just manage the storehouse.
What do you have available for purchase?
Was there something specific you were looking for? You seem like you are looking for unique things.
Do you have any moisture vaporators?
I may, but that is not something I usually sell to spacers. You don't look like a moisture farmer. What do you want them for?
To exchange with Sand People to stop their attacks.
Ah, exactly the kind of appeasement that Czerka Corporation doesn't like to support in their policies. I like it.
Well, I have two of the finest vaporators that Czerka Corporation produces. Of course, they only produce one model right now.
The price is 200 for the pair. I'm not sure how you talked me into that ridiculously low bargain, but there it is.
200 for the moisture vaporators sounds fine to me.
Fine, fine, I assume you'll be able to handle the deployment of them? They are surprisingly light.
It's a pleasure doing business with you. Do come again.
Could you be persuaded to lower the price?
I really don't think so. I don't know how, but you've already convinced me to lower it as much as I can. It's a good deal.
I can't pay you right now.
I'm sorry, but that is as low as I can go. There's nothing I can do about it. Czerka regulations, you know.
Well, I don't think that's very likely. I have to cover my costs, you know.
[Persuade] Czerka's costs, not yours. Who cares about their money?
[Success] Well, I don't have much love for the company, not like little miss Protocol Officer over there.
I'll lower the price to 200 credits, but that is it. Don't even ask again.
[Failure] I can't do it. I just can't. You'll have to come up with the money.
I'll take the moisture vaporators for 400.
Perhaps I could try to persuade you once more?
[Force Persuade] You want to lower the price.
[Success] Of course I want to lower the price, but Czerka regulations... ah, who cares about those, right?
You'll do as I say. I'm the biggest threat in the room.
You're a big something, but not so much a threat. That won't work on me, not in the heart of Anchorhead.
If you did anything in here you wouldn't be safe anywhere. There are guards everywhere. Look, let's just do some honest business.
The price is 400 credits for the pair. I won't break them up. They function best when linked together.
That's not really your concern, is it?
No, I suppose not. It wouldn't have mattered. Well, let me tell you what I have, then.
You just show me what you have. Don't risk angering me!
Of course, of course, I'll show you what I have, but don't push your luck with those threats. It's not polite.
No, just your normal fare.
Take a look. The best stocked storehouse on Tatooine. Not that that's saying much.
Mostly just standard Czerka provisions and supplies. Not enough to keep the locals happy. Have a look.
I want to ask about bounties.
Not my affair. You want to hunt for Czerka Corporation you talk to the Protocol Officer.
I want to ask about Czerka Corporation.
Then go ask a Czerka officer. I just collect my credits at the end of the day, just like the miners or guards.
Do you know about their operations on Kashyyyk?
Their operations on Kashyyyk are in more trouble than you or I could ever give them. Of course, they would never admit that.
I don't much care about how Czerka operates, but I get a chuckle out of anything that gives them grief.
How do you think they are doing here on Tatooine?
It doesn't matter what I think. Maybe they'll pull out, maybe they won't. I'll man the store on the next rock.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Very well, though I do have work to get back to.
Anything out of the ordinary happening?
I hear the Sith are wasting their efforts fighting among themselves when they should be getting things done. Like they did on Taris.
Okay, what about local events?
Don't care about them. I stay in the Czerka compound. We could be on a pleasure world, for all I care or know.
What about your opinions on Taris?
You know what? At least the Sith seem to make things happen. How old is the Republic? 15,000 years? It's stagnant.
Every year ships get a little faster, droids get a little smarter, and people get a little fatter. That's about it for progress.
I suspect I'd do just as much grunt-labor under them as I do now. They'll at least shake things up.
Even if it means the deaths of innocents?
Nobody's innocent once their mother has left the room. That's just my view.
I have to go. Goodbye.
Bye then. Come back if you need any supplies.
You like change; that's good.
You say that like you know something. Well, keep it to yourself. I like to watch this change from a distance, thanks.
Well, it's odd that I'm talking to the Manaan Sector Champion, but with Taris gone you likely don't have much choice about where to race.
Well, the cost increase of kolto is downright weird. Maybe the Selkath think the destruction of Taris scared people enough they will pay inflated prices for medical supplies.
Is that a coy way of referring to Taris going down? You don't want my views on that.
Look, it's not my business what Czerka Corporation does somewhere else. I don't even care what they do *here*.
And that absolves you of all responsibility?
Now, what would the officers say? Oh yes. Go talk to the Kiosk on Coruscant. You want to buy something or not?
Oh, a swoop-jock, hmm? I know I don't have the crazy suicide parts you're looking for.
You again? You want to buy something? If not, go bother the officers.
Hold on. The Sith commanders have said I can't let any of you troopers into the cantina while you're on duty.
I'm not on duty right now.
No? Then why are you in uniform? Sorry, but you aren't the first trooper to try and sneak in for a quick drink while out on patrol.
You can come back after your shift if you want. Just remember our rule:
Don't cause any trouble in Javyar's cantina. You leave your problems and your attitude at the door.
I'll be going now.
I can't thank you enough for saving me, up-worlder. If I had anything but these rags on my back it would be yours. But we have nothing.
I still have you, Hendar. That's all I need. Let's go back to the village.
Thank you once again for saving me from the rakghouls, up-worlder. I owe you everything.
As do I, up-worlder. I don't know what I would have done if anything had happened to Hendar.
Help! It's right behind me! Help!
You got authorization, you talk to Billan. Otherwise, leave the gate area.
Don't know why anyone would want to leave. Nothing but sand and death out there.
If you're fool enough to want to leave, talk to Billan.
Make sure you are well-armed if you plan to leave. Trust me.
If you must leave, I wouldn't go out at night. Krayt hunt at night.
The wraid predators are dangerous out there, but the Sand People are worse.
The sandcrawlers always come back with damage. Sand People are a constant threat.
The gate is closed to anyone without authorization.
I've had enough out of you. You either get Czerka authorization to leave or get out of my space.
I have proper authorization.
Well, let's see it. Come on.
Here is my hunting license.
All right, I'll just scan that and you're off. I'll keep it on file, too. Good luck out there.
You'll need it.
Sorry, I was mistaken.
Don't waste my time.
Goodbye.
No one leaves Anchorhead without proper authorization.
Where would I get authorization?
Only one place, and it means dangerous work. Go to the Czerka office for a hunting license. They sell them for Fazza's lodge.
Tell me about the Czerka office.
The Czerka Corporation office is in the center of Anchorhead. The Protocol Officer will sell you one. She might offer you other work too.
What do you know about Fazza's lodge?
Fazza's is north of the Czerka office. You'll need a hunting license to deal with him. He'll just send you to the Czerka office to get one.
[Persuade] If it's my risk, why not just let me pass?
[Success] You know, I agree with you, but Czerka Corporation just doesn't want the headache.
Besides, I couldn't let you pass if I wanted to. The gate lock needs to be swiped with your authorization. Sorry.
Why do I need authorization?
Czerka Coperation does not want the complications or expense that come with people wandering the dunes. It's too dangerous.
Running this installation is difficult enough without fools wandering around getting themselves killed by Sand People.
Why does Czerka Corporation think that will cost them?
Don't get cocky, it has nothing to do with how much *you* are worth. Workers to man the ion shovels are cheap.
What they don't want is Sand People salvaging your weapons. Their raids cause enough damage as it is.
[Force Persuade] You want to let me pass. It's my risk.
[Success] I... I want to let you pass... I really do... but I can't. You can't imagine how sorry I am.
It's just that... and I'm sick about this... I have to swipe the gate lock with your authorization. I haven't got a choice.
I'll just go then.
See the Czerka office for authorization.
[Failure] That's what you say now, but when the Sand People attack you you'll be screaming for help.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Hurry it up, will you? You're not getting through here until I see the proper authorization.
I go where I want. Show me respect.
Look, it's for your own good. Czerka Corporation will not accept liability if Sand People run you down.
Let me pass or this gets bloody!
Eh, no need for that. I'm just doing my job. Besides, your threats won't help. I need to swipe the gate lock with your authorization.
I've got no choice, which means you've got no choice. Get authorization from the Czerka office or don't come back.
Hmm? Oh, it's you again. I'll just let you pass. The boys in the office may need authorization in triplicate, but not me.
Good hunting out there.
Is there something specific you wanted?
Are you Mekel?
And what if I am?
You have to do something about those men! They're dying!
That is the whole point! Personally, I think it's wonderful fun... those fools actually think that if they stand there long enough, I'll let them become a Sith.
Idiots. A Sith is not a bantha, all endurance and no brains. A Sith would fight for his life, no matter the odds. If these rotgrubs are as stupid as they seem, then they deserve their fate!
So this isn't a real test for them?
Oh, it's a test all right. It's a test to see if they're actually fool enough to die. If they don't, however, I certainly wouldn't admit them just for that accomplishment.
Disgusting and barbaric. That these men chose to do this willingly astounds me to no end.
Well, you should know better than anyone what some people will do for power, Bastila.
And what is that supposed to mean?
Well, just that the dark side is quite tempting... or so you always say. What did you think I meant?
Never mind what I thought. Just be quiet.
Hmm. It is a bit boring standing out here all day, however. I think I'll go for some dinner... it will be fun to think of them while I gorge myself.
They'll still be here in an hour or two, surely. I suggest you run along before I decide to make you part of the fun.
You should not toy with people's lives!
Oh, what a sweet guy. He should get the Sith congeniality medal.
He victimizes them, but they are trying to join his vile kind. I'm not sure I would save them.
Why not just shoot them where they stand? It would at least be more direct.
That's what I would do.
Of course that's what *you* would do.
Observation: Yes, very efficient. It is what I would do.
Then I demand you stop this at once!
*You* demand? Why would I listen to you? I'll do as I please, and if watching these fools starve themselves amuses me, that's what I'll do.
Wouldn't it be more merciful just to kill them?
Perhaps, but where does it say I should be merciful? There'd be no sport in it, anyhow. I want to see if they are really as foolish as I suspected.
Sounds like fun.
Oh, it is. I wonder which one will be the last standing? Should I tell him then that his hopes are in vain, do you think?
Why are you making those men stand there?
Nothing. Never mind.
Then I trust you'll leave. I think another one of these fools is about to drop, and I don't want to miss it.
No, not really.
Leave me be. Can't you see that I'm busy?
Are you one of the Sith from the academy?
Isn't that obvious? You must be very sharp to possess such an astute sense of perception. Obviously deaf, however, since I asked you to leave.
Can I ask you some questions?
No you may not. I'm busy amusing myself and I'm not going to miss any of the fun. Now get lost before I teach you a lesson.
Fine, I'll leave you alone.
Good. I don't want to miss this for anything, heh...
You are not welcome here, human. You have disrupted our production severely and I have no wish to speak to you.
You are not welcome here, human. You have threatened our world with your actions and I have no wish to speak to you.
You kind is too disruptive and agressive to speak to, human. We have heard of the incident at the Sith Embassy and wish no further disruptions here.
Why are you disturbing me? Can you not see I am overseeing the packaging of this kolto?
I just want to ask you questions.
I have far more pressing matters than any questions you might have, off-worlder. This kolto is the backbone of Manaan's economy.
You obviously are in the wrong place, off-worlder. I suggest you visit the courthouse west of here - there you may be of some use to the Selkath instead of a hinderance.
I'd like to buy some of your kolto.
The kolto is not mine - I am merely coordinator of this shipment. And you cannot simply 'buy' unrefined kolto!
Such negotiations are worked out between intergalactic governments and the Ahto City Export Authority. We transact deals in the billions of credits.
You obviously are in the wrong place, off-worlder. I suggest you leave.
I think I'll be going now.
Good! Your intrusion has already wrought havoc upon my hectic schedule.
Pet the gizka.
Kill the gizka.
[Force Choke]
[Force Kill]
[Force Wound]
[Force Drain Life]
[Force Shock]
[Force Lightning]
Leave it alone.
At last we can regain our place in the galaxy! Our thanks, Revan.
I hope that you find what you seek in the Temple, Revan, and that you help us as well.
If you wish to know more about us, speak to our keeper of history.
There are many unanswered questions about your last trip into the Temple, Revan... but those shall have to wait.
The other Rakata assaulted us mercilessly... but our defenses drove them back.
In time, I hope our tribe can unify our race once more.
I have to thank you again. You really didn't have to save my sorry carcass out there. I appreciate it.
You know, darling... if there was anything I could do to make it up to you... anything? No, huh?
I want to ask about you and hunting.
I don't hunt anymore. I made a deal with you, and I'll stick to it. The others will have to help you.
Besides... without the wife I can't keep my droids going. But I don't need her. You can tell her that. Yeah.
I want to ask who you are and what it is you do.
Sure you do. Tanis can tell you all about the thrill of the hunt, man versus beast. It's all very exciting.
I'll do my best to make you happy. Ask away.
Where is the best hunting?
You're the one that took down a dragon! What could I possibly tell you? My battle droids can't even fight that good.
You hunt with battle droids? Is that sporting?
I'm more the practical type, beautiful. I keep myself fed and make sure everything I have is taken care of.
Some guys will talk about honor and stuff, but they still sell their plates to Fazza. I guess honor needs creds too?
Don't you need to take more kills to keep your droids running?
I suppose, but so what? When that resource goes belly-up, I'll just move on. I'm just a wandering spirit, I guess.
Hmph. Hunting a species to extinction. Now there's a logical way to make a living.
I'm not real popular with the others, but they just fool themselves. They're in it for the credits too.
How long have you been at this?
Too long, but it beats smuggling. You ever run into a Sith dreadnaught in the desert? No, you haven't.
You crossed paths with a Sith dreadnaught?
Hell, I married her. Ha ha ha! No, no, seriously now, I had this friend that crossed Sith-space and got stripped of everything.
It's not like I have much now, I guess, but I still prefer Sand People to getting ambushed on unproven trade routes.
You go on about your wife a lot. What's the deal?
Ah, she doesn't understand me. You know the drill. It's not my fault; she knew who I was when she married me.
What can you tell me about the other hunters?
Uptight and cold, like my wife. They don't like me streamlining the hunt with droids. I don't fit in, but I don't let it bug me.
You know how it is, you don't take any backtalk either. I heard about you and Gurke. I should have you deal with my wife.
What about the hunters besides the Gamorreans?
Dorak is reasonable. Komad is a pain, but he keeps his distance. I can tell he doesn't like me much.
Ask around the lodge if you want information about the other guys. I don't really talk to them much.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Fine, fine, whatever you want.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
Well, darling, old Tanis might be just what you need. Unless you mean the dunes. I suppose only the Sand People really know them.
I'm sure I can help you. Ask away.
Have you ever seen the Sand People with anything odd?
Uh, sure, my blood. They almost got me last year. Tore up two of my battle droids. The wife was mad about that. Heh. Took her weeks to fix.
Where they got weapons to cut battle armor, I don't know. They act like animals, but they can surprise you.
Where did this happen?
I don't know. Pick a dune and walk, they'll get you soon enough.
What about the Jawas?
Smart traders. They've salvaged and sold me my own damaged droids once or twice.
They don't say much I can understand. I think they're a little slow, but who am I to judge, huh? Ha!
I have to leave. Goodbye.
You hurry back any old time, darling. Anytime.
Good hunting.
It's serious business. I'm sure I can help you through it.
You are pretty forward for a married man.
He seems pretty forward, period.
Ooh, you're a sour one. Loosen up, we're all friends here.
Perhaps you had best turn your thoughts back to your wife, sir.
Ah, the old girl doesn't understand me. Her loss. Now, you have questions about Sand People or something?
Relax, loverboy. Just answer my questions.
Who knows the planet? I don't know. I guess the Sand People. I'm usually running when I see them, though.
But I suppose you would want me to do whatever they say. I heard how you rolled over for Gurke and his boys.
That's not the way to establish yourself, you know? It's hard to earn respect here.
The Gamorreans are different. Good rowdy drinking buddies. Gurke and his boys, they understand that hunting is a business.
Of course, they hunt... other things than wraid too. Just don't turn your back on them. Ever.
What are you suggesting?
Nothing, nothing at all. Just keep your eyes on them. That's all.
What do I care? I need to eat. I also need to pay for parts so the wife can keep the droids running. It's all about the credits.
There isn't any. Too many hunters, not enough prey. I can barely keep expenses covered. Maintenance on battle droids is expensive.
Of course, it's better than going alone. What if I stumbled on a bunch of Sand People? These solo hunters are crazy.
What, specifically, would you like me to cover?
You're pretty forward for a married man.
Well, the wife doesn't really take much of an interest in my work. Not like you. Now, you have questions?
Keep your cool, loverboy. Just answer my questions.
Well, my name is Tanis and what I do is hunt. I'm sure you've heard of me... well, actually, I hope you haven't.
Hunting is a dirty and tough business. What can old Tanis tell you about it?
Again? Nothing has changed. It's all just as dirty and tedious as it was before.
Not that it puts me in debt to you. Because I believe I mentioned how little this job pays.
What can I do for you, hmm? Did my wife send you? This ain't about credits, is it?
I'm looking for experts. You seem knowledgeable.
Well of course, darling, whatever Tanis Venn can do. You know, very few human females come to Tatooine...
[Force Persuade] Just answer the lady's questions.
[Success] I should just answer the lady's questions.
Jolee! Why did you do that?
I thought it obvious. Should he act like that after mentioning his wife? Greasy little wrench-rat. He asked for it.
Ask your questions. Please.
Ha! Thanks, Jolee, but I'm sure I can handle him.
I have no doubt. I just don't like him. Mentions his wife and then acts like that.
Jolee! Leave him alone! I'll talk to him myself!
I only meant to help him clear his thoughts. He's confused if he'll mention a wife and then act like that... the greasy little scavenger.
Hey! You talk to her with a bit of respect in your voice or you'll end this conversation minus a few teeth! Got it?
Hey, hey, hey, let's calm down, shall we? No offense was meant. You just go ahead and ask your questions.
Grrrr!
Uh, and even fewer accompanied by Wookiees. Whoa big fella. You related to my wife? Now, w-what did you say you wanted?
Ooh, candy words from a swoop racer. Well, I just feel all warm inside. Save it for the ladies, what do you want?
Oh, of course. Who put you up to this? My wife? I meant what I said about having no credits.
I'm just looking to ask a few questions.
I'll answer, but since when do you swoop riders show much interest in anything besides speed?
Everyone is looking for something, I suppose one of us should get it. Ask away.
Maybe it is. What is your life worth?
Whoa, what did you say? You know, I come here because the guards stop your kind of trouble before it starts.
[Force Persuade] You aren't worth my time. Leave.
[Success] [His mind is simple to manipulate. His face goes blank, then recovers as he assumes the suggestion was something he wanted to do anyway.]
I'm not wasting ammunition on a fight with you. I've wraid to hunt. We meet on the dunes... you watch out.
[Force Persuade] You like me. You want to give me credits.
[Success] You seem like a good sort. Here, how about I buy you a few rounds?
Wait... I never do that. Why... why does my head hurt? Something strange is going on here.
I'm leaving. I don't much like newcomers anyway.
[Failure] Uh, no I don't and no I don't. What do you think you are, a Jedi? Heh. That's a laugh.
Not fast enough to stop me killing you.
Well, actually, they probably are, but I'll save you the trouble of testing it. I'm leaving.
I didn't mean anything. Just scaring you.
It's more annoying than anything. You shouldn't make threats you don't want returned. Bad move.
Well, hello dragon killer! I should have you deal with the wife. You know, because she's scary? Like a dragon? Ah, forget it.
Give me credits before I kill you.
Hello again. Tired of the swoop track? What can I do for you?
You can give me credits before I decide to kill you.
Hello again. Something else I can do for you? Slow night? Day? Whatever?
Greetings again to you, human. It would seem the call of the hunt has brought us both to this troubled world.
I have not been here long, but I can already see I will not be as welcome here as I had hoped.
What are you doing here, Komad? Following me?
While I'm sure you would prove an interesting hunt, I don't track sentient prey. Two-legged animals do a fine job of killing each other without me.
I have come here to seek even greater prey than what we faced on Tatooine, but the climate here is politically cold, and I don't know if I will be allowed to hunt.
Whose permission are you looking for?
An astute question. Czerka Corporation seems in control here, but they don't care if I wander the Shadowlands, so long as I have paid their docking fee.
Instead, I hope to gain the trust of the native Wookiee population. I'm not here to just kill the biggest thing I can find; I want to understand how they hunt.
What are you doing to gain their trust?
Very little. I'm sure they have had enough of off-worlders like the Czerka claiming good intentions. I will simply try to stay out of their way.
I have heard of an off-worlder that has gained respect by living in the Shadowlands for some years. Perhaps I will attempt the same. It could just be hunter tales, though.
What do you know of Kashyyyk?
I know that I don't know enough. Even from this docking area I can see this world is a true wonder. My desert-dimmed imagination didn't do it justice.
It's just a shame to see Czerka Corporation here. They lack an appreciation for the wild nature of this world. I don't like having to deal with them.
I'm looking for a Star Map here. Have you heard anything?
No, but I wasn't listening for such talk. I'm sorry that I can't help you.
If not Czerka, who would you prefer to deal with?
The native leadership of the Wookiees, of course. This is their world, after all. I can't understand why thy have allowed it to be misused.
Perhaps they had no choice.
There is always the option to fight, even if there is no option to win. Of course, that is easy for me to say, being an outsider.
I would hope they are not complicit in the enslaving of their world, but it is not my place to judge. I have only just arrived.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
Farewell. Perhaps we will meet again. A great hunt on this world would be glorious.
Why did you leave your home on Tatooine?
It was a hard decision, but I felt I had no other choice. I had done a disservice to the apex predator of that world. It was time to go.
Another time, human. I wish you well on this world.
Greetings, friend. I think I can safely assume you are a member of the Jedi Order. Has the Council agreed to hear our petition?
I am merely an apprentice, not a Jedi.
Ah. I'm sorry. I was mistaken.
Does the Council require our presence?
Yes, they are waiting for you now.
Ah! Yes, thank you, Master Jedi.
Stay here Rilka, I'll be back in an hour or so.
Yes, dear. Good luck.
I am sorry. I do not know.
Oh, I see. I am mistaken.
How may I be of assistance?
Who are you?
My name is Gar. Me and my fine wife Rilka here...
A pleasure.
... live on one of the northern farms. But the kath hounds and the Mandalorian problem has been getting really bad of late, and we're here to ask the Jedi Council to help.
You mentioned kath hounds?
Recently the kath hounds have been acting much more aggressively. They've even attacked some of the settlers!
Those Mandalorian raiders have been milking the outlying farms dry, too... I hear Jon got hit really bad. Too bad about his daughter.
He should have been protecting her better if he wanted to keep her.
Don't be so heartless, Mandalorian.
I'm not sure exactly what the Council will do about it, but we need some help with this. I only hope they'll listen to me...
Is there anything else you require?
Mandalorians? Here?
Ever since the Republic beat them years ago, little groups have been roaming all over the place.
They're pathetic. They're taking scraps when they should be taking worlds.
With the Sith invasion, the Republic doesn't have the manpower to hunt them down.
The Jedi are even worse off because Malak has been hunting them specifically.
They're worried that he might even be supporting these raiders, so don't want to face them directly. That puts us in a kind of hard situation.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
What can you tell me about Dantooine?
Well, as you can see here, Dantooine is mostly plains and grassland, but it has nice hearty soil. A lot of new people have come in the last generation or so.
Hm... the ones you'll most likely hear about are the Sandrals and Matales. Big, wealthy land-owners, both of them.
But Ahlan Matale and Nurik Sandral just can't seem to get along, and now Ahlan wants to get the Council to do something.
Do something? Has something happened?

Well... from what I hear it started about a week ago. See, Nurik's son Casus is an archeologist, bright lad too, but he disappeared. Nurik of course blamed Ahlan, but even he didn't take it before the Council.
But now Ahlan's son Shen has disappeared as well... and no one knows where he's gone. Ahlan blames Nurik. He thinks he's kidnapped his son.
I don't know exactly what he wants to ask the Council, but from what I know of Ahlan, he's probably going to be after blood...
I would like to ask you something else.
I must be going now.
Farewell, then. May the Force be with you, is that how it goes? Yes, may the Force be with you.
What about Jon and his daughter?
His daughter was killed by Mandalorians when their farm was raided. He's been taking it pretty hard. If you want to ask him about it, he's just north of here. It's not my place to say anything else.
Mandalorian beast! Some of us don't like fighting and killing and butchering as much as you!
Are there many farms here on Dantooine?
I don't know anything. Leave me alone.
Ve... very well. Thank you, Master Jedi.
How may I be of assistance, Master Jedi?
I am not a Jedi Master yet.
Ah, but you are still a Jedi.
I can't thank you enough for saving me, up-worlder. If I had anything but these rags on my back it would be yours. But we have nothing.
I still have you, Hendar. That's all I need. Let's go back to the village.
Thank you once again for saving me from the rakghouls, up-worlder. I owe you everything.
As do I, up-worlder. I don't know what I would have done if anything had happened to Hendar.
Don't speak to me, up-worlder! You could have saved Hendar. You just stood and watched him die!
You're as selfish as all the rest from the surface! Please, just leave me alone with my grief.
No! Hendar - no!
Please, make him open the gate. Hendar will die if he doesn't!
I can't open the gate... not while the rakghouls are so near.
Open the gate... I will kill the rakghouls.
You would risk your life for a stranger? Heh. You are brave, up-worlder.
I will open the gate for you, but you've got be quick. In a few seconds I must close and lock it again.
You're right, it's too dangerous. Leave the gate closed.
I'm sorry, Hester - there's nothing we can do. It's too late for Hendar now.
Keep the gate closed. I'm not risking my life here.
You monster! How can you say that? Somebody do something!
Hurry - while the gate is still open! You must save Hendar!
Hurry, Hendar, hurry! I can hear it coming!
He'll never make it. He's doomed. Argh! I told him he was a fool to leave the village.
He WILL make it! Run, Hendar! Run!
Open the gate! Quickly! There isn't much time!
Ugh... I... I can't... the rakghouls are too close!
The mutants will kill him if you don't open the gate!
And if I open the gate they will kill us all!
No! You can't do this! It isn't fair!
You're one of them Sith, ain't you? My mommy says I'm not supposed to talk to you.
Is you one of the Sith? My daddy says the Sith are nothing but bullies. You don't look like a bully.
My Momma says I have to stay out of the Lower City. That's where bad people live.
You ever seen a swoop bike? I seen them at the races sometimes. They go fast and make lots of noise!
No offence, but I could have done better than you on that last race. As a true fan, I know how to do these things right.
You didn't look too good out there on that last run. I guess everyone has their bad days.
You sure you're cut out for this league of racing? Maybe the stress of it is getting to you.
I don't believe it! Who'd have thought Queedle had it in him?
A new Champion! And it's Queedle! I knew he could do it with a decent swoop under him.
How about that? Queedle, a local racer, showing those pros how it's done!
I cheer for Queedle now that he's winning. It would take an amazing racer to win me away.
You here to cheer Casandra? She's a fine racer. I hope she knocks Hukta out of the running.
Hukta Jax is insane. He just smashes through everything to the finish. I guess we should expect that from a Gamorrean?
We need more rules about overpowered bikes. Hukta just rides over everything. It's boring watching him.
Queedle is the local favorite. You should cheer along with us. He needs the encouragement.
You're pretty good. Maybe I should start putting some credits on your races.
I guess you've got what it takes to advance. The odds against you winning are getting better.
The second round always has experienced riders. You'll be up against some tough times.
You're up against the second round times now. That's a hard round to beat.
Some of the racers are having a bad time here on Manaan. Seems like you have all the luck right now.
Some of the other fans didn't think you could reach the second round, but I knew you would all along.
Are you sure you're up to challenging the third round time? I mean, you're good, but are you that good?
I'm putting all my credits on you. You're a sure thing.
Whew, that was an exciting time you turned in. Noboby else had a chance.
Good race, Sector Champion. I guess you'll be off to the big tracks, once the circuit is back up.
Wow, I bet you could have won on Taris with times like that. It's a shame we'll never know.
Could I get an autoprint? You've just had the quickest rise to Sector Champion that I've ever seen.
It's amazing what you've accomplished here, and you've done it with such style. I've never met a woman like you.
You sure put Hukta in his place. I don't have to say that you are a much more appealing champion.
I haven't seen a race like that in years. Well, there was Gandroff on Coruscant, but he lacked your... charms.
You are amazing out on the course... and in person. Congratulations.
It's really strange. Nobody seems to know where Master Uthar or Yuthura Ban have disappeared to. Some of the sensitives are claiming they're dead.
Rumor has it that something has happened to Master Uthar and Yuthura Ban. Do you know anything?
I heard that Yuthura Ban was dead. I suppose that means Master Uthar will be taking a new apprentice, soon.
Did you hear? Yuthura is dead. Master Uthar said so. I bet she got too impatient and failed to assassinate him. Idiot.
Master Yuthura has taken over the academy. Everyone's talking about it! I guess she finally got rid of Uthar, somehow.
Have you heard? Yuthura... I mean Master Yuthura has taken over the academy! Well done, I say!
You aren't even a full Sith. Don't bother me.
Get out of my way. I don't have time to deal with hopefuls.
Come back when you've taken your final test. If you survive it.
If Master Uthar gives you an order, you'd better follow it. There were some students who disobeyed him and now they're hiding out on the surface somewhere.
There are some students in hiding that refused to follow an order. Master Uthar wants them found and dead... and is offering a reward for it, too!
Just be careful if you go into the valley. I hear there's a hermit living in the hills that kidnaps students.
The former master of the academy, Jorak Uln, is supposedly hiding out in the hills on the surface as some kind of mad hermit.
Word is that one of our experimental droids went mad and escaped and is hiding in the ruins. I wonder why we don't just gather it up and destroy it?
One of my friends went to find that crazy droid that's hiding in the ruins in the valley. He hasn't come back, yet.
Ha! It's great to be on the winning side, isn't it? We've been crushing the Republic at every battle so far!
The latest reports say the Republic is on the run. Before long the Sith will be ruling the entire galaxy.
Darth Malak is one of the greatest Sith leaders ever. I hope he comes back to the academy before I leave.
It is my most fervent hope to serve under Darth Malak once my training is complete. Don't you feel the same?
Rumor around the academy is that you had something to do with those rebel students being caught, finally. They got what they deserved, I say.
I was told that you actually met the old master of the academy, Jorak. Is the hermit as mad as they say?
The buzz is that you took care of that crazy droid out in the ruins. That's pretty impressive.
Hmm. So you got enough prestige to win out, I hear. We'll just see if you make it through your final test.
Sorry, I don't have time to speak. My training awaits.
[The droid is now active. If a fight breaks out, its programming will now instruct it to come to your aid.]
The droid is actively engaged in its patrol route. You cannot reprogram it anymore.
The droid is now active. It will attack any enemies that come in range.
Optimize droid's weaponry. (<CUSTOM42> repair part(s))
[Success] The droid is now set for maximum firepower.
Optimize droid's targeting systems. (<CUSTOM43> repair part(s))
[Success] The droid is now set for maximum accuracy.
Activate droid's shields. (<CUSTOM44> repair part(s))
[Success] The droid's shields are now active.
Engage droid in patrol mode. (<CUSTOM45> repair part(s))
[Success] Patrol mode engaged. Once you end this session the droid will begin patrol and destroy any enemies it encounters.
WARNING: Once you end this session the droid's program will be locked in. You will not be able to modifiy the droid anymore.
Leave it alone.
You leave the droid alone for now.
The droid engages its patrol mode and moves off to carry out your programmed instructions.
[Failure] You do not have enough repair parts.
This droid is damaged and inactive.
Reactivate the droid. (1 repair part)
[Failure] You don't have any repair parts. You leave the droid alone for now.
Our ship will be ready soon. Then it's off to Coruscant for a week or so.
You own the Ebon Hawk, don't you? Wish I could fly a bird like that.
Greetings, human. I am called Bwa'lass, and I have been selected as your Arbiter for the duration of your trial.
Arbiter?
Yes, Arbiter. The one who defends you before the judges of the Selkath people.
I will endeavor to prove to them that you are not guilty of the heinous crimes that you are accused of, off-worlder.
I don't need anyone to represent me!
While it is true that you do have that right, I would recommend against it. Due to your confinement, you have not had much of a chance to build up evidence to pursue your case.
Also, I do not believe you off-worlders truly understand the minds of we Selkath. It would be best if you left your defence up to me.
How will you get me free?
I would first like to ask you a few questions regarding the events that led up to your arrest.
I have already been given all relevant data on you and your companions, so that can be disregarded. For what reason did you enter the Sith Embassy?
I was invited.
Indeed... That would explain the reason a passcard for entry was found on your person.
What is your prior association with the Sith?
I have no prior association.
Indeed... Since you have a passcard to their base, I can only assume you believe taking this route would lessen your sentence... Very well.
That should be all the information I require of you, for now. If you wish, we can begin the trial whenever you are ready.
Um... Don't you need to ask more questions?
I have all the information I need. We should proceed now, the judges are waiting.
How can you expect to defend me without getting more information?
I think this trial is relatively straight forward. It should be obvious to the judges what has transpired.
Let's get the trial started.
Very well, we shall proceed to the courtroom.
While your... special position bears heavily on our minds, we cannot ignore the blatancy with which you have violated our laws.
You stand accused of the grievous murder of many Sith, and extensive property damage to their Embassy here.
How do you plead?
Not guilty.
Let the record show that this trial has commenced. Presiding are judges Shelkar...
Jhosa...
Naleshekan...
Kota...
and Duula.
This trial is to determine the culpability and punishment of this individual in the recent assault on the Sith Embassy.
Given the severity of this trial, we can dispense with the normal formalities of the court and proceed directly.
You have pleaded not guilty, yet there were reports of weaponsfire and detonations from within the Sith Embassy.

You were seen entering and leaving the Embassy. The Sith have not conferred with the authorities about this matter, but from all available evidence, it would seem that you are the source of the disturbance.
What is your explanation for being in the Sith Embassy?
The Sith lured me inside.
Indeed. I am most skeptical of this statement.
But it may be true... How was it they lured you inside? What bait did they use?
I was there for diplomatic negotiations.
I am skeptical of this assertion... but it does seem in the character of the Sith to reneg on their commitments.
There have been many provocations before this! Their character is well known!
Indeed, but that is not an issue for outsiders to hear.
We will adjourn to debate your story and the charges brought against you.
We have reviewed your case and decided that there is not enough evidence to convict you of this crime.
The provocations of the Sith are well known, and we will be issuing a memo of censure against them. Their Embassy is considered off-limits to all Ahto City Security personnel.
No calls or incidents from their base will be attended to until this matter is dealt with, as they are no longer subject to the protections of Selkath law.
You have been found innocent, and may leave as you desire. This trial is now over.
They were secretly trying to lure me to the darkside.
This mystical darkside you Jedi keep speaking of is a convenient excuse. Basically, they wished to hire you away from the Republic.
How, then, did the fighting start?
I refused and they attacked.
Preposterous!
That does sound like something the Sith would do...
I am inclined to believe the off-worlder.
They tried to double-cross me.
I felt like showing them who was boss.
You... attacked them?!
I knew the off-worlder was a danger!
You have willfully and blatantly broken our laws, and for that you shall be sentenced accordingly!
No! I am a Republic citizen!
For the crimes you have committed against the Sith and against the laws of the Ahto City Civil Authority, this court finds no alternative: We hereby sentence you to death.
You will be executed immediately. This court has spoken.
I'm innocent!
I have this datapad as proof that the Sith are up to no good!
Let it be noted that the court has taken this new evidence into consideration.
Hm... This is... most disturbing.
The court will adjourn for a brief period to verify this evidence and discuss its importance.
We have verified that this is indeed a Sith datapad indicating their complicity in a plot to overthrow the lawful government of Manaan.
In gratitude for having discovered this heinous offense, all charges against you regarding this incident will be dropped.
Pending a suitable penalty against the Sith, their Embassy is considered off-limits to all Ahto City Security personnel.
If you try to punish me, I'll let everyone know that the kolto is gone.
You wouldn't!
I wouldn't doubt the human... they are known for these double-dealings...
Kolto is the lifeblood of Manaan. Our entire economy and independence rests upon it. Now that it is gone we must maintain a perilous pact secrecy with your Republic.
We can NOT afford to jeporadize that secrecy. Not for anything.
If we allow you to leave, you are a threat and a liability to the Selkath people. Therefore we cannot.
Your secret will die with you, off-worlder.
They offered me a job.
Offered you a job? To a Jedi?
Unlikely... but possible. How then, did the fighting start?
I was working for the Republic.
You were working for the Republic? So the Republic had you break in and kill the Sith? It is as I suspected...
Do not jump to conclusions.
Why did the Republic have you enter the Sith Embassy?
To steal information.
You admit that you enetered the Sith base illegally and attempted to commit crimes there!
It is obvious that they tried to stop you and that you initiated hostilities!
So like an off-worlder...
To retrieve data the Sith had stolen.
One crime does not permit the use of another to set it right!
To stop them from learning about the secret base by the Hrakert Rift.
It is good that you are looking out for the joint interests of the Republic and Manaan in this issue, but was is really necessary to take such extreme measures?
They had almost found out about the station.
The secret must be kept from the Sith, no matter the cost!
Indeed. We will adjourn to discuss the situation and the charges brought against you.
Station? What station?
This is a internal matter for Selkath alone! We will adjourn immediately to discuss these things without the interference of outsiders!
Upon review of this case, we find that there is no basis for a case against the defendant.
Additionally, the Sith will receive a censure for provoking combat within Ahto City.
They needed killing.
You admit to your crime!
I was investigating the disappearances of young Selkath.
You believe that the Sith have had something to do with those disappearance?
The off-worlder has probably been listening to Shaelas and his rumor-mongering.
Most likely. Do you have any proof to back up your assumption, human? Have the Sith been implicated?
I found this token on a dead Selkath inside the Sith base.
I recognize that token! It is from Galas, one of the youths who went missing!
You found that in their Embassy?!
The Sith HAVE been taking them!
Er... well, no...
You will need to come up with a better excuse than that, off-worlder!
I was killing Sith. See? Simple.
See! I knew that the off-worlder was guilty! They all are!
What... what possible reason could you have to justify your actions?
The Sith are a blight upon the galaxy!
That does not excuse your actions! The neutrality and laws of Manaan WILL be upheld!
The Republic ordered me to go into their base.
It was just a coincidence.
You were clearly seen entering the Sith base. You cannot deny this fact!
You must have had some reason for entering. What was it, human?
Guilty.
You... You are guilty? You admit to your crime?
Yes.
Well... Then I suppose we have no choice but to sentence you for your crimes.
Er... no... I was just kidding.
This court will not be mocked!
It was a lot of fun, really.
I don't plead! I tell!
We will not tolerate insolence! You will obey the rules of our court, or you will be summarily found guilty!
The Sith have been using and manipulating the young among our race; we know this. It is up to us to decide what actions we should take, not vigilante justice by some human.

While you have proven the Sith to manipulative and deceitful in their activities here on Manaan, I believe you will have a much harder time defending your actions now. Some things go too far, off-worlder.
The familiarity you gained in your successful defence of Sunry will aid you here, human. But the charges you are faced with are far more grave.
Your past experience as Arbiter in the Sunry case may aid in your defence now, human, but you must do a better job yourself, given the crimes you are faced with.
While your high standing among the off-worlders on Manaan may bring you some leniency from them, being a successful swoop rider brings you no credit here, human.
I think I'd rather represent myself.
While that is your right, I strongly recommend against it. I am versed in all the necessary particulars of this case and Selkath law, off-worlder. You would do well to heed my advice.
No, I'll represent myself.
You off-worlders are not known for your mental prowess. I shall leave your demise up to you.
Fine, represent me.
I said no, fish-head!
I have proof that the Sith are evil.
Indeed? And what is that?
This datapad proving they are kidnapping young Selkath.
This is most... disturbing. We should take this evidence and present it before the court right away.
I'll show it to the judges, or no one!
You must share the evidence with me before I can release you and we can proceed to the courtroom.
I am skeptical of that, as will be the judges. You off-worlders tend to congregate much amongst yourself. I see no inherent differences between your two groups.
I'm on a mission to stop them from taking over the galaxy.
The Sith are an expansionistic power, true, and at war with the Republic. You may make it your personal mission to foil them, but the authorities take a dim view of it taking place here.
I think you will need a more thorough explanation in order to convince the judges.
I kill them wherever I can find them.
I am... humbled by your candor. While I'm sure that you yourself see that as a noble sentiment, I doubt that those assigning your sentence will be so generous.
Indeed. I find that unlikely, off-worlder, but perhaps the judges will be more sympathetic to your view.
I had authorization to enter.
I... er... broke in.
Illegal acts seem to be a common occurance among you off-worlders. I am not terribly surprised by your actions, but the judges will want to hear a little more convincing reason.
What have I been charged with?

You have been charged with initiating violence within the Sith Embassy, murdering members of the Ambassadorial Commission of the Sith Empire, and disregarding our own laws regarding violence in Ahto City.
What can I do?
It's all the Sith's fault!
Be that as it may, I doubt the judges share your view. I will endeavor, however, to make them see your point, off-worlder.
Get me out of here!
The question of your freedom will be up to the court to decide. All I can do as Arbiter is attempt to sway their decision in your favor.
Go away. You would regret the only other option.
What do you want, rail-rat? I don't have the time or desire to bother speaking with wandering idiots.
Go talk with your adoring fans over at the swoop races. I'm sure they fawn all over their beloved Sector Champion.
Could I ask you a few questions?
I will get tired of your voice in short order, so make it quick.
You mentioned the races.
You're the Sector Champion; you know the races inside and out. Why ask me? Are you trying to worm a compliment out of me?
Nothing about the current state of the races make me want to watch. Especially if it means associating with the cattle grouped in there now.
There are no racers you like?
I admire the mercenary spirit of Casandra Mateil. Other than that, no one.
Her mercenary spirit isn't what's selling the autoprints.
She does have... other qualities as well.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Hurry it up. This is a poor use of my time. You should know not to annoy one of my kind.
I have some questions about Manaan.
Grow some gills and swim the planet yourself. There's no substitute for personal experience. I have nothing else to say on the subject.
I don't like how hostile you are.
Hostile? I would consider this the height of calm for dealing with insects like yourself. If I were hostile, you'd be dead.
A pity we can't test the theory now.
Yes, Manaan is a very unsatisfying world for settling disagreements. The Selkath are very insistant that even words are not used as weapons.
Since we both refuse to initiate a violent event, you'll have to accept my contempt-filled dismissal, and hope we don't meet again.
I won't take that chance. Goodbye.
Wisely played. Go away.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
Good. This visit was dragging on.
Our Taris campaign killed the giants of the sport. The current racers are hardly inspiring. An Aqualish champion? Hmph. Laughable.
You're probably another race fan in a fool's stupor after that big win by local whelp Queedle Molta.
Go join the other transients in the swoop race area. At least you'll all be contained.
Why are you back again? I didn't show enough disinterest the first time around? You really shouldn't pester a soldier of the Sith.
Go look for fans over at the swoop races, Sector Champion. I'm sure they'll give you what your looking for.
I shouldn't expect you to listen. You're probably just another open-mouthed fool here for the swoop races.
Hey - you can't come in here! This is a restricted area! You better tell me what you're doing or I'm going to hit the alarm!
[Persuade] I'm here for a meeting. Don't worry - I know where I have to go.
[Failure] Nice try. What - you think that just because I'm pretty I'm also stupid?
You better tell me why you're here or I'll hit this alarm and you'll have about three seconds before this office is swarming with Sith soldiers!
[Persuade] Look, here's 50 credits - just don't hit that alarm.
[Success] 50 credits? You've got a deal! The Sith have made my life a living hell ever since they took over this base.
You know, it's about time someone stood up to these Sith! Just do me a favor and wait until I'm out of here before you start blasting the place up.
[Failure] You must think I'm pretty stupid! If I take your bribe the Sith will have me executed!
I don't know what you're up to, but I have the feeling it might get me in a lot of trouble. I hate to do this, but you'll have to explain yourself to the guards.
Don't hit the alarm. I don't want to have to hurt you.
Don't shoot! I just work here - I never wanted any part of this! I would have quit when the Sith took over, but they wouldn't let me!
Okay - get out of here and I'll let you live!
You're in the wrong place at the wrong time. It's bad luck, but I still have to kill you!
You shouldn't threaten a girl who's got an alarm right at her desk!
Touch that alarm and you're dead!
[Persuade] I work here - look, I've got an access card.
Greetings, human. A word, if I may. It concerns the Dark Lord of the Sith.
You mean Malak?
No, human. I mean the *true* Lord of the Sith. I am speaking of Darth Revan. Of you.
How do you know who I am?
Listen to me, and all will be made clear. My name is Ziagrom. I am a... a businessman. I and my partner deal in rare items of extraordinary value and power.
You're with the Exchange!
No, we are not. We are independant operators, though often our transactions involve those who represent the Exchange.
Traditionally, we have always done business with the owner of the Ebon Hawk: Davik Kang, most recently. Ahita Othar before him. Forii Haxa before her. But we were reluctant to approach you.
You had no ties to the Exchange, which was a problem. Even worse, you were a Jedi! Not the sort of person we normally associate with.
Get to the point - how do you know my true identity?
There were reports of the Ebon Hawk traveling to many different planets. We wanted to know what you were up to. At your last port, I placed a small tracking device on your ship.
The tracking device reported back to us that you had been captured by the Leviathan. Once we had that information, we began digging into our sources within the Sith fleet.
Sources? What sources?
There are millions of soldiers in the Sith fleet. Surely you aren't surprised that some of them will sell information? Even high ranking officers aren't immune to the lure of easy credits.
Your escapades on the Leviathan created quite a stir in the Sith fleet. Of course Malak tried to suppress the truth about your identity: there were more than a few summary executions.
But even if security footage is destroyed and witnesses silenced, some bits of information always slip through. Spend enough credits to gather the tiny pieces and the puzzle becomes clear.
We know what happened on the Leviathan. At least, we know enough. You are Darth Revan, and you are going to kill Malak for daring to claim dominion over the Sith.
How does this involve you?
My partner and I deal in very rare and powerful items. Weapons, armor: things you could use in your battles against Malak and the Sith.
And you're just going to give these items to me?
I don't carry these items with me, of course. They're with my partner. But they're yours, if you've got the credits to buy them. We do want to make a profit on this, after all.
Just go to the Cantina here in Dreshdae. There's a Rodian there named Mika Dorin. Tell Mika that Ziagrom sent you to look at the premium items.
I'll go check it out.
Mika already knows to expect you. Like I said, just tell him you want to look at the premium items.
I guess my work here is done. Goodbye, Revan. And once Malak is beaten, don't forget who helped you to victory.
I can't be bothered with this.
It's up to you, I guess. But you'll be missing out on the best equipment in the galaxy! Sooner or later you'll realize this deal is to good to pass up.
Just go to the Dreshdae Cantina on Korriban. There's a Rodian in there named Mika Dorin. Tell Mika that Ziagrom sent you to look at the premium items.
I'll check it out next time on Korriban.
Let me see these items.
You're wrong. I'm not in this for revenge.
Maybe, maybe not. But whatever your motivation may be, you *do* intend to stop Malak and his followers - of that we are sure. And we want to help.
Go on.
So why are you approaching me now?
Who are you?
If you tell anyone who I am, I'll kill you!
Your secret is safe with me, Lord Revan. At least until you chose to reveal yourself. But I have come here with an offer of aid. I want to help you defeat your old apprentice.
I'm not Revan anymore.
You are what you are, human. You cannot deny that you were once the Lord of the Sith. And you cannot deny that you wish to defeat Malak!
*I* am the Dark Lord of the Sith!
Yes, human. I know. That is why I have approached you.
I don't have time for this!
Please, human - this is of importance to us both! I know who you are... Revan!
Thanks for your help, friend. I'm getting off this planet as soon as I can. I'll pay my own way, too. No more debts to anyone.
No more trusting anyone, either. I've learned what that gets you.
Hello again. Welcom back to Eli Gand's outpost, now under new management. What do you need?
Let's see what you have for sale.
Right you are.
You're still here? I'd never be so forgiving.
What do you mean? I don't need to go hunting Eli's family or anything. I've seen justice done.
[Persuade] It's not enough. This store was his life. Let it rot.
[Success] You know, maybe you're right. Why should I bother with this remote hole? This isn't the life I wanted.
I see your point. I'll leave his shop like his corpse. I'll take what I want, buy passage on a ship, and never look back except to spit.
Here, take this. Thanks for reminding me about how he misused my trust. I'll make sure it never happens again. With anyone.
You have taken a good and honest man and twisted him into a bitter, hateful creature. You must be so proud of yourself.
Feeding this man's hatred is an act of malice and petty evil. The Council would not approve of your actions here, and neither do I.
[Failure] I'd rather move on, you know? I don't want to be mad about this for the rest of my life. I can make this work.
In that case, let's see what's for sale.
All right then. Actually, I feel I owe you something. Here, take a few credits. If you spend it here, all the better. I think things are looking up.
Sounds like a boring choice to me. Goodbye.
Safe flying to you. Hope to see you again.
Well, that's your opinion, I guess, but I still owe you for helping me. Here, take a few credits with you. Spend them here, if you like.
Never mind. Goodbye.
All right then. Here, I should toss you a few credits for helping. I appreciate what you did.
[Force Persuade] Remember your hatred. Don't trap yourself here.
[Success] Working here when I was trapped was hell enough. Staying here now is just foolish. I don't want to be seen as weak.
Fine, fine. Just show me what's for sale.
I don't want anything right now, thanks.
That Thaylian bog-slime. Do you know that I have been here 36 days, slaving to pay a debt in good faith?
All for nothing. He killed my crew... who knows where my ship is. Well, there's your pay, Eli. Blaster fire, and keep the change.
I suppose that closes his little outpost here.
I suppose it does, though maybe I should keep it up for a while on my own. I've no ship at the moment anyway.
It'll probably take a while to convince Eli's suppliers that I'm the new boss, but eventually I'll buy my way off this rock.
If it were me, I'd wipe out all memory of him.
And you won't owe anyone a single credit. Good luck.
That's the idea. Actually, I should toss you a few credits for helping me out. Take them... maybe even spend them here.
What will you do now?
Well, there's not much for me to do but stay here. I've no ship, so I may as well make a few credits.
Did you have to kill him?
What did you expect I'd do? Besides, he'd have killed me. He couldn't have risked me telling everyone he was a cheat. He'd have no business.
He won't last long hiding in the Shadowlands.
I have to admit, I'm surprised you let him get away. I don't know if I could have been as forgiving.
I will never understand you meatbags. He cheated you and killed your friends, but you didn't terminate him when you had the chance.
If it had been me, Eli would a smoking corpse right now.
Well, I could have shot out his legs and let him crawl around for a while, but I consider this far more merciful.
His reputation's shot. Someone honest could take over.
Greetings to you. Something I can get for you?
Kindly direct your inquiries to me. Matton is merely an indebted employee. His opinions don't amount to much.
I think you'd better talk to Eli directly. He's the boss... for the time being.
Hukta says you earned a big enemy. You should have lost when you was told to lose! Now something's gotta be done!
Not here, because Selkath cameras are watching. I's too smart for that. I get you when you least expect. You just wait.
Yeah, you come talk to me. I got something to say to you, little racer. Hukta Jax doesn't like how fast you go.
See, back when more people raced, I lost lots more. Now, I win pretty good. I like winning. You maybe shouldn't mess it up.
So I says this, and you listen good. You don't win the Sector Champion race. If you win, maybe something bad happens to you.
Can't we come to an agreement?
Sure, you can agree with me. That's the only way this is gonna work, you understand? You do like I say, and you don't get hurt.
I will race, and I will win.
Then you and Hukta Jax are gonna have problems, I promise you that. You was warned, fair and square.
I don't want any trouble...
Then you is smarter than you look. I likes it when people are reasonable. Just stay away from the track.
I'll think about what you said.
Sure, you think. While you do that, stay away from the course. I's can make things very bad for you.
Try anything and you'll end up dead!
Maybe you end up dead first. Maybe it will be painful, too. I don't like when people don't do what they should. You win and you get hurt.
You'd never get away with it. Cameras are everywhere.
I am too smart to do something out in the open. Selkath gots cameras all over, and they lock everyone up without questions.
No, I would find you when you don't know it's coming, where no cameras are. You win Sector Champion race, and I hurt you.
You'd regret threatening me, piggie.
I already did it, and I don't regret nothing. You don't know how much I like to race. You don't know what I can do.
You just do as I says and you will stay safe. It's simple.
I told you once already, and I want you to remember; you don't win the Sector Champion spot. If you do, there will be trouble.
Who is you? Hmm? Hukta Jax -that's me- says you should step back, because pro racers like me are important.
You're Sector Champion, right? You only won because I gots distracted by stupid Queedle. He blew my whole strategy.
I just want to ask a few questions.
Yeah, okay, but you keep it short. I got no reason to talk to you.
I want to ask about you and racing.
Okay, maybe I say something, or maybe not. Hukta Jax don't give secrets out.
Is Manaan a good course for racing?
What is I going to tell you about this course? You won it already! Go let someone ask you questions instead.
How long have you been at this?
Lots of years. I got my swoop after we raided... I mean, I got my swoop when someone left it to me. It was sad, but happy too.
What do you mean by that?
Nothing, and I 'm not saying any more.
What can you tell me about the other racers?
You don't need nothing. You beat everybody. I got nothing to tell.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Why? You sure talk when you get going. Maybe we can hurry up and stop soon?
Do you know much about Manaan?
I know that if you do absolutely anything wrong you get locked up. Seems like fining criminals is a great way to bring in the credits.
I'm surprised they even let us race. Wouldn't want the crowds to get too excited. Excitement make people unpredictable. Or something.
I'm leaving. Goodbye.
Yeah, you go then, and leave me alone.
You'd better show me some respect, piggie.
Haw! That's funny! You is new here, so maybe you don't know, but Manaan gots Selkath cameras everywhere. No fighting allowed.
You got to be smart, and know the place good. You is too new for that. You just funny.
I just know that I am better than all the rest. I'd be better even with more pros here. Casandra is okay, but she is weak and little.
There's Queedle too, but he is the worst! I mean, what is he doing winning it all? That is just not right! He's not pro!
Queedle is here too, but he doesn't got what we got.
What do you mean?
He doesn't have the best swoop. He can have skills all over the floor, but if his swoop goes slow, he goes slow, and he goes slow.
This track is pretty good. It's too wet, but it's on the ocean, so you're gonna have that. Better to hit waves than rocks, I guess.
I don't like the new racers here, though. Queedle stole the top round from me! How'd he get so fast so all of a sudden?
I don't like you much, either. You come in and win everything from everybody, but you aren't a pro like me. It's not right.
This track is all there is until the circuit is up again. Taris took the best racers. I suppose there is Tatooine...
What's wrong with Tatooine?
I'm not going back to Tatooine ever. Hukta Jax is better than that dust ball.
When were you there?
That's none of yous business, and you stop asking about it. You stop!
What? Again? Ask and leave me alone.
Just answer my questions, and make it quick.
Heh, okay, I will answer, but you watch what you say. Hukta Jax don't take threats from nobody.
Wait! You's the one that beat my time! Twice I get beaten, by Queedle and you too! This is the worst showing I had yet!
Queedle is the big winner right now. I hate that. He should stay in the beginner races. He's not ready to beat me. It's not right.
You that new racer, winning from nowhere, right? I like winning, so you just stay away from my times.
So, you leave me alone so's I can get race-ready. It important. Meditation and stuff.
What do you want from Hukta now? I don't have time for you or anyone.
Grrr... Sector Champion. Well, that is very nice. Now how about you go away? I got to work on waterproofing my swoop.
Go away. You and me, we don't have anything to say about nothing. Go beat someone else's time or something.
You got one race, but that means nothing. Go bother another beginner or something, because you are no interest to me.
You don't need to talk to me, racer. I get enough of you on the track. I see you getting wins. Go away.
You are not permitted to enter the rest of Rwookrrorro. Our children live in the upper boughs. You will not disturb them.
You couldn't make the climb anyway. Only a Wookiee has the skill to navigate the wroshyr trees.

You need to equip a weapon for combat!
RESUME COMBAT
How do I equip a weapon?
Use the EQUIP screen to equip the armor and weapons from your inventory. You can access this screen by selecting the EQUIP menu icon in the upper right corner of the screen.
Use the mouse to look through your inventory slots. The menu on the right displays items you can equip in each slot.
Select the bottom right inventory slot. This is your WEAPON slot. Left-click the mouse on an item in the right menu to equip that weapon.
Can you repeat that?
Hitting the buttons over and over again will not speed up your attacks and will not help you in combat! Combat uses a real-time, turn based system.
Each character can only perform one action in each 3 second round. When a new round begins the character will perform the last command you selected.
RESUME COMBAT
What if combat gets too hectic?
Combat uses a pause and play system. At any time you can press the Pause button to pause the game and issue commands to your characters.

While the game is paused you can use the mouse to select a target or select icons from the TARGET and ACTION MENUs. You can switch characters by left-clicking on their portrait in the lower left corner of the screen.
Any commands you issue to your party while paused will fire when you press the Pause button to unpause the game.
Tell me more about the TARGET and ACTION MENUs.
In the lower right of the screen you'll see a list of icons. This is your ACTION MENU. You can select items from this menu by using the mouse.
Left-click the icon you want to use to activate that power or item. Clicking on the arrows above and below the icon will cycle to other powers or items in that list.
The first icon of the ACTION MENU is for Friendly Force Powers. The second is for Medical Items such as Medpacs and Antidote Kits.
The third icon is for Miscellaneous Items such as Stimulants and Energy Shields. The fourth icon is for Mines, and only appears if you have a mine in your inventory and have the DEMOLITIONS skill.
Tell me about the TARGET MENU.

The icons in your TARGET MENU will change depending on whether your targeting circle is on a door, a container, a friendly creature or an enemy. Left-click the mouse to select a target and bring up the TARGET MENU. Left-clicking on the target again will perform the Default Action on it.
The first icon is for combat FEATS. The second icon is for Hostile Force Powers such as Choke and Kill. The third icon is for Grenades.
How do I select icons again?
Use the mouse to select the FEAT, power or item you want to use, then left-click to select it.
Can you repeat that?
Explain the combat system in more detail.
Whenever you attack an enemy, you will enter combat mode. This locks the camera on your target. To exit combat mode and unlock the camera, push the Disengage button.
You can use the TARGET MENU to use combat FEATS or items, and the ACTION MENU to use friendly or miscellaneous items.

It's Canderous. We took care of the guards. We're inside the Ebon Hawk and all systems are go. As soon as you guys join us we can get out of here.

The path you have chosen to walk is difficult.  Intensive training will prepare you physically for the demands of the Order. ## Meditation will teach you to channel the power of the Force.

In all my years I have never seen one who has mastered the initial training so quickly. ## You have done in weeks what many cannot do in years. ##   ## I am honored to welcome you fully into the Jedi Order.

[This tach may be Rulan Prolik in disguise, but you can't tell for sure. Maybe if you kill it, it will revert to it's true form... assuming it's Rulan.]

Why do you disturb me, human? Grarwwaar comes to the Shadowlands to get away from your kind.
According to a datapad I found, Grarwwaar is dead!
So you have uncovered my little secret. No matter, this body has grown tiresome to me. Maybe I can find one more to your liking, human.
How can I help?
That's... that's impossible!
Your tricks don't fool me, Rulan!
Enough games, Rulan. Time to die.
What do you need?
Yes? What is it?
Got something on your mind, do you?
Yeah? What do you want?
Hey, there. What can I do for you?
Statement: HK-47 is ready to serve, master.
A remarkable likeness, wouldn't you agree?
The resemblance is uncanny, isn't it?
I want to ask you some questions.
I am no slave, human! I am Grarwwaar, a free Wookiee. I do not answer to you.
Leave me be, human. Return to the village in the tree tops. The Shadowlands is no place for your kind.
I'm sorry. I'll be going now.
You summoned me, Lord Malak?
The search for Bastila is taking too long. We cannot risk her escaping Taris. Destroy the entire planet.
Th... the entire planet, Lord Malak? But... there are billions of people on Taris! We'd be slaughtering countless innocent civilians. Not to mention our own men still on the surface.
Your predecessor once made the mistake of questioning my orders, Admiral. Surely you are not so foolish as to make the same mistake?
Of... of course not my Lord Malak.  I will do as you command. But it will take several hours to position our fleet.
Then I suggest you begin immediately. You are dismissed, Admiral.
Yes, Lord Malak.
Go tip a bantha, human.
You a hunter? I don't trust hunters.
Sand People will overrun this place one day. Sooner than later.
This city is dying. You can see it coming.
Who thought they could make a profit here? Blind fools.
Those Sand People... they're the thing I hate most about this place.
At this point, everyone should just work for passage out of the system.
Hmm? I've got nothing to say to you.
Help! Daddy!
You need a lesson on how to treat your social betters. Maybe you'll think twice before mocking me next time!
